original: mi gtsang ba bsten par mi byed par zas kyi sred pa skyed par byed cing /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba bsten par mi byed par zas kyi sred pa skyed par byed cing /
translated: It does not cause one to rely on what is impure, but it does give rise to craving for food.🔽It does not give rise to desire that arises from conduct.

original: spyod pa las byung ba'i 'dod chags skyed par mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni tshor ba ste /
analyzed: spyod pa las byung ba'i 'dod chags skyed par mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni tshor ba ste /
translated: This is feeling.

original: phung po lnga'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: phung po lnga'i gnas skabs so //
translated: This is the section on the five aggregates.

original: reg pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang / yul dang rnam par shes pa dag 'dus pa las reg pa 'byung zhing bde ba dang sdug bsngal yongs su gcod par yang mi byed /
analyzed: reg pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang / yul dang rnam par shes pa dag 'dus pa las reg pa 'byung zhing bde ba dang sdug bsngal yongs su gcod par yang mi byed /
translated: “Contact” is the arising of contact from the convergence of the sense faculty, the object, and consciousness. It does not determine pleasure or pain.

original: gnod par 'gyur ba spong bar mi byed me la 'dzin par yang mi byed /
analyzed: gnod par 'gyur ba spong bar mi byed me la 'dzin par yang mi byed /
translated: It does not avoid what is harmful. It does not grasp at fire.🔽It does not cause one to rely on poison, weapons, or what is impure.

original: dug dang mtshon dang / mi gtsang ba bsten par yang mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni reg pa ste /
analyzed: dug dang mtshon dang / mi gtsang ba bsten par yang mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni reg pa ste /
translated: This is contact.

original: phung po lnga'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: phung po lnga'i gnas skabs so //
translated: This is the section on the five aggregates.

original: skye mched du gces bya ba ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ces bya ba'i skye mched drug dod cing /
analyzed: skye mched du gces bya ba ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ces bya ba'i skye mched drug dod cing /
translated: “The sense spheres” are the six sense spheres of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: ji srid du dbang po dang / yul dang / rnam par shes pa gsum 'dus pa las reg pa ma byung ba gang yin pa de ni skye mched drug ste phung po lnga'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: ji srid du dbang po dang / yul dang / rnam par shes pa gsum 'dus pa las reg pa ma byung ba gang yin pa de ni skye mched drug ste phung po lnga'i gnas skabs so //
translated: As long as the three—the sense faculty, the object, and the consciousness—do not come together, there is contact. This is the stage of the five aggregates.

original: ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba nyid mtshams sbyor ba na skye mched drug ma dod pa'i bar skabs su mer mer po dang / nur nur po dang / mkhrang bar gyur pa rkang lag 'gyus pa'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de ni ming dang gzugs te phung po lnga'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba nyid mtshams sbyor ba na skye mched drug ma dod pa'i bar skabs su mer mer po dang / nur nur po dang / mkhrang bar gyur pa rkang lag 'gyus pa'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de ni ming dang gzugs te phung po lnga'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Name-and-form is the stage of the five aggregates from the time of conception until the six sense bases have developed.

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni ma'i mngal du rnam par shes pa nying mtshams 'byor ba gang yin pa ste phung po lnga'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni ma'i mngal du rnam par shes pa nying mtshams 'byor ba gang yin pa ste phung po lnga'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Consciousness is the stage of the five aggregates from the moment of conception in the mother’s womb until the six sense bases have developed.

original: nga'i yid rnam par shes pa nas phyir log cing zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa shes nas de kho na nas sems phyir log cing ngo //
analyzed: nga'i yid rnam par shes pa nas phyir log cing zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa shes nas de kho na nas sems phyir log cing ngo //
translated: “My mind turned back from consciousness” means that, having understood consciousness, the mind turned back from there.

original: de phan chad du 'jug par mi byed de zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa phan chad du sems 'jug par ma gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de phan chad du 'jug par mi byed de zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa phan chad du sems 'jug par ma gyur pa ste /
translated: He does not engage in it beyond that means he does not engage his mind beyond consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ni 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ni 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: The cause of consciousness is the characteristic of formation.🔽The cause of formation is the characteristic of ignorance.

original: 'du byed kyi rgyu ni ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir nga'i sems 'jug par ma gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rgyu ni ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir nga'i sems 'jug par ma gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In order to understand this, he says, “I do not engage my mind.”

original: 'o na ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpas yan lag gnyis po ma rig pa dang 'du byed gnyis ma brtags @299b she na sngar brtags zin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpas yan lag gnyis po ma rig pa dang 'du byed gnyis ma brtags @299b she na sngar brtags zin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Why did the Bodhisattva not investigate the two members of ignorance and formation? Because he had already investigated them earlier.

original: 'di ltar srid pa'i yan lag gsum po ma rig pa dang / srid pa dang len pa ni nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar srid pa'i yan lag gsum po ma rig pa dang / srid pa dang len pa ni nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
translated: Thus, the three members of existence ignorance, craving, and grasping are the nature of the afflictions.

original: gang gi tshe sred pa dang len pa brtags par gyur pa de'i tshe na ma rig pa yang brtags zin to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sred pa dang len pa brtags par gyur pa de'i tshe na ma rig pa yang brtags zin to //
translated: When he investigated craving and grasping, he had already investigated ignorance.

original: srid pa'i yan lag gnyis po 'du byed pa dang srid pa ni las kyi ngo bo yin pas gang gi tshe sred pa brtags par gyur pa de'i tshe na 'du byed kyang brtags zin to //
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag gnyis po 'du byed pa dang srid pa ni las kyi ngo bo yin pas gang gi tshe sred pa brtags par gyur pa de'i tshe na 'du byed kyang brtags zin to //
translated: Since the two branches of existence—formation and existence—are by nature karma, when craving is investigated, formation is also investigated.

original: 'o na lta srid pa'i yan lag bdun po rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / skye ba dang / rga shi ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir gzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
analyzed: 'o na lta srid pa'i yan lag bdun po rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / skye ba dang / rga shi ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir gzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
translated: The seven branches of existence—consciousness, name and form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, birth, and aging and death—are by nature the basis of karma and affliction.

original: gang gi tshe rga shi brtags par gyur pa de'i tshe na ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba yang brtags zin la /🔽gang gi tshe skye ba brtags par gyur pa de'i tshe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rga shi brtags par gyur pa de'i tshe na ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba yang brtags zin la / gang gi tshe skye ba brtags par gyur pa de'i tshe na /
translated: When aging and death are investigated, name and form, the six sense bases, contact, and feeling are also investigated.🔽When birth is investigated, consciousness is also investigated.

original: rnam par shes pa yang brtags zin pa yin na ci'i phyir de dag kyang rtog par byed ce na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang brtags zin pa yin na ci'i phyir de dag kyang rtog par byed ce na /
translated: Why are they investigated?

original: sngar rga shi dang skye ba mdor bsdus te brtags nas /
analyzed: sngar rga shi dang skye ba mdor bsdus te brtags nas /
translated: Previously, he investigated aging and death and birth in brief.

original: phyis de nyid rgya cher brtag pa'i phyir ming dang gzugs la sogs pa dang rnam par shes pa la rtog par byed pas 'di la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: phyis de nyid rgya cher brtag pa'i phyir ming dang gzugs la sogs pa dang rnam par shes pa la rtog par byed pas 'di la nyes pa med do //
translated: Later, in order to investigate those very things in detail, he investigates name-and-form, etc., and consciousness.

original: 'o na rnam par shes pa la mdor bsdu ba dang / rgyas par dbye ba gnyis med na /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par shes pa la mdor bsdu ba dang / rgyas par dbye ba gnyis med na /
translated: If there is no difference between the brief and detailed analyses of consciousness,

original: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa la lan gnyis su brtags par gyur ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa la lan gnyis su brtags par gyur ce na /
translated: why is consciousness investigated twice?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ni skye bas 'jigs pas de'i phyir rnam par shes pa lan gnyis su brtags par gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ni skye bas 'jigs pas de'i phyir rnam par shes pa lan gnyis su brtags par gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattva is afraid of birth, and therefore consciousness is investigated twice.

original: 'di ltar de rga shi yid la byung ba na don med pa 'di ci las byung zhes rtog pa na skye ba las byung bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar de rga shi yid la byung ba na don med pa 'di ci las byung zhes rtog pa na skye ba las byung bar mthong ngo //
translated: Thus, when he brings aging and death to mind, he thinks, “From what is this useless thing born?” and sees that it is born from birth.

original: skye ba yang gang gis mngon par bsgrubs zhes rtog pa na las kyis mngon par bsgrub par mthong ngo //
analyzed: skye ba yang gang gis mngon par bsgrubs zhes rtog pa na las kyis mngon par bsgrub par mthong ngo //
translated: He thinks, “By what is birth accomplished?” and sees that it is accomplished by karma.

original: las kyang gang gis kun nas bslang zhes rtog pa na /
analyzed: las kyang gang gis kun nas bslang zhes rtog pa na /
translated: When he thinks, “By what is karma impelled?”

original: nyon mongs pas kun nas bslang zhing nyon mongs pa ni gzhi la brten par mthong ngo //🔽gzhi yang gang gis mngon par bsgrubs zhes rtogs par gyur na skye bas mngon par bsgrubs par mthong nas de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas kun nas bslang zhing nyon mongs pa ni gzhi la brten par mthong ngo // gzhi yang gang gis mngon par bsgrubs zhes rtogs par gyur na skye bas mngon par bsgrubs par mthong nas de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: he sees that it is impelled by the afflictions, and that the afflictions are based on a foundation.🔽When he thinks, “By what is the foundation established?”🔽he sees that it is established by birth. He thinks, “All of this useless suffering arises from birth.”

original: don med pa 'di dag thams cad ni skye ba las byung ngo snyam du sems pas de'i phyir skye bas yid 'byung bas rnam par shes pa la @300a * //
analyzed: don med pa 'di dag thams cad ni skye ba las byung ngo snyam du sems pas de'i phyir skye bas yid 'byung bas rnam par shes pa la @300a * //
translated: Therefore, he becomes disgusted with birth and turns away from consciousness.

original: yang lan gnyis su brtags par gyur te /
analyzed: yang lan gnyis su brtags par gyur te /
translated: He examines consciousness a second time

original: sdug bsngal 'di dag thams cad skye bas bskyed pas de'i phyir de'i yid rnam par shes pa nas log cing de phan chad du 'jug par mi byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'di dag thams cad skye bas bskyed pas de'i phyir de'i yid rnam par shes pa nas log cing de phan chad du 'jug par mi byed do //
translated: and thinks, “All of this suffering is generated by birth.” Therefore, his mind turns away from consciousness and does not engage any further.🔽Thus, etc.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: is the conclusion.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po zhes bya ba 'di ni yams kyi nad dang / gnod pa dang / 'go ba'i nad dang / 'khrug pa dag gis tshig bla dags yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po zhes bya ba 'di ni yams kyi nad dang / gnod pa dang / 'go ba'i nad dang / 'khrug pa dag gis tshig bla dags yin no //
translated: This great mass of suffering is a designation for epidemics, calamities, contagious diseases, and disturbances.

original: 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya ba 'di ni blangs pa dang mthar phyin pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshig bla dags yin no //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya ba 'di ni blangs pa dang mthar phyin pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshig bla dags yin no //
translated: This alone is a designation for what is taken up, what is completed, and what is fully accomplished.

original: 'di zhes bya ba 'di ni kun du bstan pa dang / nye bar bstan pa'i tshig bla dags yin no //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba 'di ni kun du bstan pa dang / nye bar bstan pa'i tshig bla dags yin no //
translated: This is a designation for what is taught and what is demonstrated.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Will come into being means will be born.

original: 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba ni skye ba snga ma'i bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa'i las kyi gnas skabs gang yin pa de ni 'di'i 'du byed rnams te phung po lnga'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba ni skye ba snga ma'i bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa'i las kyi gnas skabs gang yin pa de ni 'di'i 'du byed rnams te phung po lnga'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Conditionings refers to the state of meritorious and non-meritorious actions in a previous birth, which are the conditionings of this life, the state of the five aggregates.

original: ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba snga ma'i nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de ni 'di'i ma rig pa ste phung po lnga'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba snga ma'i nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de ni 'di'i ma rig pa ste phung po lnga'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Ignorance is the state of affliction in a former life, and it is the state of the five aggregates.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpas 'jug pa'i phyogs la ni srid pa'i yang lag bcu brtags par gyur la /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpas 'jug pa'i phyogs la ni srid pa'i yang lag bcu brtags par gyur la /
translated: Why did the Bodhisattva investigate ten members in the case of entry into samsara,

original: ldog pa'i phyogs la ni bcu gnyis brtags par gyur ce na /
analyzed: ldog pa'i phyogs la ni bcu gnyis brtags par gyur ce na /
translated: but twelve members in the case of the case of the reversal of samsara?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jug pa'i phyogs la sdang la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jug pa'i phyogs la sdang la /
translated: The Bodhisattva is averse to entry into samsara,

original: ldog pa'i phyogs la dga' zhing 'dod pas de'i phyir ldog pa'i phyogs la yan lag bcu gnyis brtags par gyur te /
analyzed: ldog pa'i phyogs la dga' zhing 'dod pas de'i phyir ldog pa'i phyogs la yan lag bcu gnyis brtags par gyur te /
translated: but he is attracted to and desires the reversal of samsara. Therefore, he investigated twelve members in the case of the reversal of samsara.

original: 'di la nyes pa med do zhes bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung las 'byung ngo /🔽// / bam po bcu gcig pa /
analyzed: 'di la nyes pa med do zhes bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung las 'byung ngo / // / bam po bcu gcig pa /
translated: There is no fault in this, according to the Vaibhasikas.

original: sngon gyi zhes bya ba ni snga rabs kyi'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi zhes bya ba ni snga rabs kyi'o //
translated: The past is the former life.

original: lam zhes bya ba ni lam po che'o //
analyzed: lam zhes bya ba ni lam po che'o //
translated: The path is the main road.

original: bgrod pa zhes bya ba ni bgrod pa gcig pa'o //
analyzed: bgrod pa zhes bya ba ni bgrod pa gcig pa'o //
translated: The one path is the one way.

original: lam srol zhes bya ba ni shing rta 'gro ba'i 'phang los drangs pa'i rjes so //
analyzed: lam srol zhes bya ba ni shing rta 'gro ba'i 'phang los drangs pa'i rjes so //
translated: The path is the track left by the passage of a chariot.

original: de dag gis ni lam po che nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni lam po che nyid du bstan te /
translated: The path is taught to be a highway,

original: de ltar yang lam 'dis chu bo las rgal bar gyur cing /
analyzed: de ltar yang lam 'dis chu bo las rgal bar gyur cing /
translated: because it is said that one crosses over the flood by this path,

original: brgal bar 'gyur rgal bar byed do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽sngon gyi drang srong rnams gshegs shing rjes su 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi drang srong de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang nyan thos rnams sngar gshegs shing de dag gi rjes su nyan thos dag phyis 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: brgal bar 'gyur rgal bar byed do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro // sngon gyi drang srong rnams gshegs shing rjes su 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi drang srong de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang nyan thos rnams sngar gshegs shing de dag gi rjes su nyan thos dag phyis 'dod pa'o //
translated: that one has crossed over, and that one will cross over.🔽The path is the one that was traveled by the sages of the past and is desired by those who come after.🔽The path is taught to be the one that was traveled by the sages of the past, the Tathagatas, the Pratyekabuddhas, and the Sravakas, and is desired by those who come after, the Sravakas.

original: 'di ni lam ste chen po dag gis brtul ba nyid @300b bstan to //🔽nags mchog ces bya ba ni nags mchog tu thag ring ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lam ste chen po dag gis brtul ba nyid @300b bstan to // nags mchog ces bya ba ni nags mchog tu thag ring ba'o //
translated: The path is the one that was traveled by the sages of the past and is desired by those who come after.🔽The forest is the supreme forest, the one that is far away.

original: bzang po zhes bya ba ni mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: bzang po zhes bya ba ni mdzes pa'o //
translated: The forest is the supreme forest, the one that is far away.

original: nags dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni tshang tshing dang span spun gyis gang ba'o //
analyzed: nags dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni tshang tshing dang span spun gyis gang ba'o //
translated: The forest is the one that is filled with thickets and brambles.🔽The forest is the one that is filled with thickets and brambles.

original: dga' bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni yid dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: dga' bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni yid dang mthun pa'o //
translated: “Delightful” means agreeable.

original: de grong khyer bgyid du rtsol la zhes bya ba ni grong khyer rnying pa de sar par byed du chug cig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de grong khyer bgyid du rtsol la zhes bya ba ni grong khyer rnying pa de sar par byed du chug cig ces bya ba'o //
translated: “He should have the city repaired” means he should have the old city repaired.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya ba la 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya ba la 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The noble eightfold path: “Noble” means uncontaminated.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa shes rab zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa shes rab zag pa med pa'o //
translated: Right view is uncontaminated wisdom associated with uncontaminated attention.

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa nges par 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa nges par 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: Right thought is the absence of the thoughts of sensual desire, etc., associated with uncontaminated attention.

original: yang dag pa'i dag ces bya ba ni log pa'i 'tsho bar 'gyur ba dag gis nyes pa spyod pa bzhi ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i ngag gis nyes par spyod par spyod pa spangs ba zag pa med ba'o ;
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dag ces bya ba ni log pa'i 'tsho bar 'gyur ba dag gis nyes pa spyod pa bzhi ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i ngag gis nyes par spyod par spyod pa spangs ba zag pa med ba'o ;
translated: Right livelihood is the abandonment of the four kinds of wrong livelihood, and the abandonment of other verbal misdeeds, which is uncontaminated.

original: / yang dag pa'i las yi mtha' zhes bya ba ni log pa'i 'tsho bar 'gyur ba'i lus kyis nyes par spyod pa gsum ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i lus kyis nyes par spyod pa spangs pa zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: / yang dag pa'i las yi mtha' zhes bya ba ni log pa'i 'tsho bar 'gyur ba'i lus kyis nyes par spyod pa gsum ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i lus kyis nyes par spyod pa spangs pa zag pa med pa'o //
translated: Right action is the abandonment of the three kinds of physical misdeeds, which is uncontaminated.

original: yang dag pa'i 'tshe ba zhes bya ba ni log pa'i 'tsho ba spangs pa zag pa med pa'o ;
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tshe ba zhes bya ba ni log pa'i 'tsho ba spangs pa zag pa med pa'o ;
translated: Right livelihood is the abandonment of wrong livelihood, which is uncontaminated.

original: / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i brtson 'grus so //🔽yang dag pa'i dran pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i dran pa'o //
analyzed: / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i brtson 'grus so // yang dag pa'i dran pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i dran pa'o //
translated: Right effort is uncontaminated effort.🔽Right mindfulness is uncontaminated mindfulness.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Right concentration is uncontaminated concentration.

original: rga shi zhes bya ba ni rga shi'i ngo bo nyid de des ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ston to //
analyzed: rga shi zhes bya ba ni rga shi'i ngo bo nyid de des ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ston to //
translated: Aging and death is the intrinsic reality of aging and death. This teaches the truth of suffering.

original: rga shi kun 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rga shi'i rgyu skye ba ste /
analyzed: rga shi kun 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rga shi'i rgyu skye ba ste /
translated: The origin of aging and death is the cause of aging and death, which is birth.

original: des ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the truth of origin.

original: rga shi'i 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni rga shi 'gags la mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: rga shi'i 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni rga shi 'gags la mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The cessation of aging and death is the cessation of aging and death, which is nirvana.

original: des ni 'gog pa'i bden pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni 'gog pa'i bden pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the truth of cessation.

original: rga shi 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam zhes bya ba ni rga shi 'gags pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa grong khyer dang 'dra bar 'gor ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: rga shi 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam zhes bya ba ni rga shi 'gags pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa grong khyer dang 'dra bar 'gor ba'i lam ste /
translated: The path that leads to the cessation of aging and death is the path that leads to the city of nirvana, which is the cessation of aging and death.

original: des ni lam gyi bden pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni lam gyi bden pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the truth of the path.

original: skye ba la sogs pa yang lag lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa yang lag lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: The remaining limbs, such as birth, should be applied in a similar way, as appropriate.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir ma rig pa'i rnam pa bzhi ma bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir ma rig pa'i rnam pa bzhi ma bstan zhe na /
translated: Why are the four aspects of ignorance not taught?

original: skye ba snga ma'i nyon mongs pa'i @301a * //
analyzed: skye ba snga ma'i nyon mongs pa'i @301a * //
translated: The afflictions of a previous birth

original: gnas skabs gang yin pa de ni 'di'i ma rig pa yin par sngar bstan pas 'dir ma rig pa'i shes pa bzhi logs shig ma gsungs te /
analyzed: gnas skabs gang yin pa de ni 'di'i ma rig pa yin par sngar bstan pas 'dir ma rig pa'i shes pa bzhi logs shig ma gsungs te /
translated: Since ignorance is taught to be the condition of any state, the four types of consciousness of ignorance are not mentioned separately here.

original: de ltar yang shes pa'i dngos po bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de ltar yang shes pa'i dngos po bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: The Sūtra Teaching the Four Types of Consciousness explains:

original: dge slong dag khyod la shes pa'i dngos po bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi bstan par byas /
analyzed: dge slong dag khyod la shes pa'i dngos po bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi bstan par byas /
translated: “Monks, I will teach you the four types of consciousness.

original: de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zung shig dang / ngas khyod la bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zung shig dang / ngas khyod la bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, listen well and keep it in mind, and I will explain it to you.”

original: dngos po bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi gang zhe na rga shi zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang / rga shi kun 'byung dang rga shi 'gog pa dang rga shi 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam shes pa'i dngos po dang / skye ba dang / srid pa dang /
analyzed: dngos po bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi gang zhe na rga shi zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang / rga shi kun 'byung dang rga shi 'gog pa dang rga shi 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam shes pa'i dngos po dang / skye ba dang / srid pa dang /
translated: What are the four types of consciousness? Aging and death is one type of consciousness, the origin of aging and death is one type of consciousness, the cessation of aging and death is one type of consciousness, and the path leading to the cessation of aging and death is one type of consciousness. Birth, existence,

original: len pa dang / sred pa dang / tshor ba dang / reg pa dang / skye mched drug dang / ming dang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa dang / 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba'i dngos po dang / 'du byed rnams kun 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: len pa dang / sred pa dang / tshor ba dang / reg pa dang / skye mched drug dang / ming dang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa dang / 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba'i dngos po dang / 'du byed rnams kun 'byung ba dang /
translated: the entities of appropriation, craving, feeling, contact, the six sense spheres, name-and-form, consciousness, and volitions, the arising of volitions,

original: 'du byed rnams 'gog pa dang / 'du byed rnams 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam shes pa'i dngos po'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams 'gog pa dang / 'du byed rnams 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam shes pa'i dngos po'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: the cessation of volitions, and the path leading to the cessation of volitions.

original: de yang ma rig pa shes pa'i dngos po bzhi ma bstan to //
analyzed: de yang ma rig pa shes pa'i dngos po bzhi ma bstan to //
translated: Moreover, the four entities of the knowledge of ignorance are not taught.

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas zhes bya ba ni thugs su chud nas so //🔽mu stegs can zhes bya ba ni gcer bu pa'i zad byed dag go //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas zhes bya ba ni thugs su chud nas so // mu stegs can zhes bya ba ni gcer bu pa'i zad byed dag go //
translated: Having fully awakened means having realized.🔽The tīrthikas are the naked ascetics who practice annihilationism.

original: spyod pa can zhes bya ba ni mu stegs kyi rnam pa rab tu byung ba dag go //
analyzed: spyod pa can zhes bya ba ni mu stegs kyi rnam pa rab tu byung ba dag go //
translated: The practitioners are the renunciants who take on the form of tīrthikas.

original: yang dag par bsgrub pa na zhes bya ba ni nan tan byed pa na'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bsgrub pa na zhes bya ba ni nan tan byed pa na'o //
translated: When they are correctly practicing means when they are practicing assiduously.

original: sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa po'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa po'o //
translated: The practitioners are the ones who practice.

original: rigs dang ldan par zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: rigs dang ldan par zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: “Endowed with the lineage” means nirvana,

original: rigs pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not divorced from the lineage.

original: chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyis mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //🔽dge ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyis mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro // dge ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: “Endowed with the Dharma” means it is supreme among all dharmas.

original: thar pa ni don dam pa'i dge ba yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thar pa ni don dam pa'i dge ba yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Wholesome” means it is the ultimate wholesome state, because it is the pacification of all suffering.

original: tshangs par spyad pa zhes bya ba ni lam bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs par spyad pa zhes bya ba ni lam bstan pa'o //
translated: “The holy life” refers to the path.

original: rgya che ba zhes bya ba ni rgya chen por gyur pa'o ;
analyzed: rgya che ba zhes bya ba ni rgya chen por gyur pa'o ;
translated: “Vast” means it is extensive.

original: / skye bo mang po la phan pa zhes bya ba ni skye bo mang po la mkho ba'o //
analyzed: / skye bo mang po la phan pa zhes bya ba ni skye bo mang po la mkho ba'o //
translated: “Beneficial to many beings” means it is necessary for many beings.

original: yangs par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni ches rgya che bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: yangs par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni ches rgya che bar gyur pa ste /
translated: “Extensive” means it is very extensive,

original: nyan thos rnams kyis kyang gzhan dag gi rgyud la lam bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyis kyang gzhan dag gi rgyud la lam bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even the śrāvakas generate the path in the mindstreams of others.

original: lha dang mi'i bar dag la zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi'i bar dag la rab tu bstan @301b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha dang mi'i bar dag la zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi'i bar dag la rab tu bstan @301b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Among gods and humans” means that it is taught among gods and humans.

original: yang dag par zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log par ro //
analyzed: yang dag par zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log par ro //
translated: “Correctly” means without error.

original: rab tu bstan zhes bya ba ni rgya cher nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu bstan zhes bya ba ni rgya cher nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Taught” means that it is taught extensively.

original: de ltar yang mdo sde las dge slong dag de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni lam ma brnyes pa brnyes pa tshangs par spyod pa ma bcas pa 'cha' ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang mdo sde las dge slong dag de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni lam ma brnyes pa brnyes pa tshangs par spyod pa ma bcas pa 'cha' ba ste /
translated: Thus, a sūtra says, “Monks, the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas discover the path that had not been discovered, they create a spiritual life that had not existed, they see the doors to immortality and reveal them, they reveal the path that had not been revealed.

original: dge slong dag de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni lam mkhyen pa lam rig pa lam ston pa lam gsungs pa lam 'dren pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni lam mkhyen pa lam rig pa lam ston pa lam gsungs pa lam 'dren pa yin no //
translated: Monks, the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas are the ones who know the path, who see the path, who teach the path, who proclaim the path, who reveal the path.

original: nyan thos rnams ni phyis ldan zhing lam gyi rjes su 'dong ba'i ston pa'i bstan pa bzhin du byed pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni phyis ldan zhing lam gyi rjes su 'dong ba'i ston pa'i bstan pa bzhin du byed pa ste /
translated: The disciples follow the path later and act in accordance with the teaching of the teacher who reveals the path.

original: de dag de ltar bstan pa la yang dag par bsgrub pa na sgrub pa byed pa yin zhing rigs pa dang ldan pa chos dang ldan pa dge ba sgrub par byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag de ltar bstan pa la yang dag par bsgrub pa na sgrub pa byed pa yin zhing rigs pa dang ldan pa chos dang ldan pa dge ba sgrub par byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: When they are taught in that way, they are established. They are established by the one who establishes them, who is endowed with reason, endowed with the Dharma, and endowed with virtue.

original: mjug tu zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa na'o //
analyzed: mjug tu zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa na'o //
translated: “In conclusion” means when it is completed.

original: 'byung po gang dag ces bya ba ni lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin la sogs pa sems can gang dag go //
analyzed: 'byung po gang dag ces bya ba ni lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin la sogs pa sems can gang dag go //
translated: “Whatever beings” refers to whatever sentient beings there are, such as gods, nāgas, yakṣas, and so on.

original: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos bstan pa'i gnas su'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos bstan pa'i gnas su'o //
translated: “Here” means in the place where the true Dharma is taught.

original: lhags gyur zhes bya ba ni 'ongs bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lhags gyur zhes bya ba ni 'ongs bar gyur pa'o //
translated: “Having come” means having arrived.

original: bar snang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'o //
analyzed: bar snang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'o //
translated: “Space” means the sky.

original: skye dgu rnams la zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la'o //
analyzed: skye dgu rnams la zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la'o //
translated: “For the sake of beings” means for the sake of sentient beings.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa spong pa la sogs pa legs par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa spong pa la sogs pa legs par spyod pa'o //
translated: “Dharma” refers to good conduct, such as refraining from killing.

original: spyod gyur cig ces bya ba ni yongs su skyong bar gyur cig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyod gyur cig ces bya ba ni yongs su skyong bar gyur cig ces bya ba'o //
translated: “May they practice” means “may they be protected.”

original: yongs su bsngos zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu sbyin pa la gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su bsngos zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu sbyin pa la gzhag pa'o //
translated: The phrase having dedicated means having placed in the result.

original: bden pa mthong ba rtogs ma thag tu phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob ste zhes bya ba ni sngar 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir bden pa mthong ma thag tu phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon🔽du byas so //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba rtogs ma thag tu phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob ste zhes bya ba ni sngar 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir bden pa mthong ma thag tu phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du byas so //
translated: Immediately upon seeing the truths, he attained the result of non-returner means that immediately upon seeing the truths, he actualized the result of non-returner because he had previously abandoned the afflictions of the desire realm by the mundane path.

original: rdzu 'phrul yang mngon par bsgrubs so zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi dag la brten nas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul yang mngon par bsgrubs so zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi dag la brten nas bskyed pa'o //
translated: He also accomplished the superknowledges means that he generated them in dependence on the actual bases of the absorptions.

original: legs par gsungs so //
analyzed: legs par gsungs so //
translated: Well spoken! means excellent!

original: legs par gsungs so zhes bya ba ni gus pa'i phyir lan gnyis su bzlas so //
analyzed: legs par gsungs so zhes bya ba ni gus pa'i phyir lan gnyis su bzlas so //
translated: He said well spoken twice out of respect.

original: mgrin gcig tu zhes bya ba ni don brjod pa'i sgra dus gcig tu'o //
analyzed: mgrin gcig tu zhes bya ba ni don brjod pa'i sgra dus gcig tu'o //
translated: The phrase with one voice means with the sound of the same meaning at the same time.

original: sgra zhes bya ba ni skad do //
analyzed: sgra zhes bya ba ni skad do //
translated: The word voice means sound.

original: rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba na zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul sgrub cing skyed par byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin dag go //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba na zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul sgrub cing skyed par byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin dag go //
translated: When one is creating a magical creation, i.e., when one is in the concentrations which create and produce magical creations.

original: brtul zhes bya ba ni btang ba'o //🔽'byor ba rnyed ces bya ba ni sgrub @302a * //
analyzed: brtul zhes bya ba ni btang ba'o // 'byor ba rnyed ces bya ba ni sgrub @302a * //
translated: “To give up” means to abandon.

original: pa'i don grub pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: pa'i don grub pa'i phyir ro /
translated: “To attain mastery” means to accomplish the aim of the practice.

original: rgya chen po zhes bya ba ni che ba'o //
analyzed: rgya chen po zhes bya ba ni che ba'o //
translated: “Vast” means great.

original: zhum pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: zhum pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa med pa'o //
translated: “Without depression” means without fear.

original: dge ba zhes bya ba ni bzang ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba zhes bya ba ni bzang ba'o //
translated: “Virtuous” means good.

original: phan yon lnga zhes bya ba ni yon tan lnga'o //
analyzed: phan yon lnga zhes bya ba ni yon tan lnga'o //
translated: “Five benefits” means five qualities.

original: yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i zhes bya ba ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i zhes bya ba ni shes pa'o //
translated: “To see correctly” means to know.

original: rab tu 'byung ba la mos par bya ba kho nar rigs zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'byung bar 'dod par bya ba kho nar rigs pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu 'byung ba la mos par bya ba kho nar rigs zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'byung bar 'dod par bya ba kho nar rigs pa ste /
translated: “It is fitting that one should be intent only on going forth” means that it is fitting that one should desire to go forth.

original: rigs zhes bya ba ni 'os shing bzang ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rigs zhes bya ba ni 'os shing bzang ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Fitting” means proper and good.

original: rang gi don zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi don zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: One's own aim is characterized by nirvana.

original: ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni rgyal po la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni rgyal po la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin no //
translated: Unmixed means not shared with kings, etc.

original: rjes su thob pa zhes bya ba ni 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su thob pa zhes bya ba ni 'grub pa'o //
translated: Attained means accomplished.

original: bran zhes bya ba ni nye bar spyad par bya ba ste bran dang brkus pa dang / rnyed btson dang rtsod pa can dang / btsongs pa dag go //
analyzed: bran zhes bya ba ni nye bar spyad par bya ba ste bran dang brkus pa dang / rnyed btson dang rtsod pa can dang / btsongs pa dag go //
translated: Servant means to be used, such as a slave, a purchased person, a found person, a disputed person, or a sold person.

original: mngag gzhug pa dang zhes bya ba ni lkog gi las su bsko bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: mngag gzhug pa dang zhes bya ba ni lkog gi las su bsko bar bya ba ste /
translated: Messenger means to be employed in secret work.

original: nor gyis glas shing bsgo ba'i mngag gzhug byed pa'o //
analyzed: nor gyis glas shing bsgo ba'i mngag gzhug byed pa'o //
translated: He is a messenger who is paid with money and is employed.

original: bsgo ba zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi las su bsgo bar bya ste blon po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsgo ba zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi las su bsgo bar bya ste blon po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Command means to be employed in manifest work, such as a minister, etc.

original: rang dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan la rag las pa ste /🔽chab 'og gi rgyal phran la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan la rag las pa ste /🔽chab 'og gi rgyal phran la sogs pa'o //
translated: Independent means not dependent on another.🔽He is independent who is not dependent on another.🔽He is independent who is not dependent on another.

original: dga' dgur 'gror med pa zhes bya ba ni ci dgar spyod du med pa ste blon po chen po'o //
analyzed: dga' dgur 'gror med pa zhes bya ba ni ci dgar spyod du med pa ste blon po chen po'o //
translated: “Not going where one wants” means not going where one wants to go.

original: 'di ltar de ni rgyal po'i drung du rtag tu brten du yang med la gzhan du 'gror yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni rgyal po'i drung du rtag tu brten du yang med la gzhan du 'gror yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is not always present in the king’s presence, nor does he go elsewhere.

original: mchod par bya ba zhes bya ba ni chos gos la sogs pas so //
analyzed: mchod par bya ba zhes bya ba ni chos gos la sogs pas so //
translated: “To be worshipped” means with Dharma robes, etc.

original: bstod par bya ba zhes bya ba ni tshig gis so //
analyzed: bstod par bya ba zhes bya ba ni tshig gis so //
translated: “To be praised” means with words.

original: grub pa dang bde ba zhes bya ba la grub pa zhes bya ba ni sngar thob pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa dang bde ba zhes bya ba la grub pa zhes bya ba ni sngar thob pa'o //
translated: “Accomplishment and happiness” means that “accomplishment” is what was previously obtained.

original: bde ba zhes bya ba ni thob pa mi nyams pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba zhes bya ba ni thob pa mi nyams pa ste /
translated: “Happiness” is the non-degeneration of what was obtained.

original: de ni grub pa yang yin la bde ba yang yin pas grub pa dang bde ba ste /
analyzed: de ni grub pa yang yin la bde ba yang yin pas grub pa dang bde ba ste /
translated: That is accomplishment and happiness,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: which means nirvana.

original: bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Unsurpassed” means being supreme among all dharmas.

original: 'thob pa las nyams na zhes bya ba ni 'thob par bya ba las nyams shing ma thob na ste /
analyzed: 'thob pa las nyams na zhes bya ba ni 'thob par bya ba las nyams shing ma thob na ste /
translated: If one degenerates from obtainment, then one degenerates from that which is to be obtained and does not obtain it.🔽

original: mya ngan las 'das pa las ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams pas nyams na'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa las ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams pas nyams na'o //
translated: If one degenerates from obtaining it, if one degenerates from what is to be obtained, then one degenerates from nirvana.

original: dam pa zhes bya ba ni drang srong chen po rnams so //
analyzed: dam pa zhes bya ba ni drang srong chen po rnams so //
translated: The supreme ones are the great sages.

original: yang dag par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa rnams so //
analyzed: yang dag par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa rnams so //
translated: Those who have correct realization are the nonlearners.

original: yang dag par sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni slob pa rnams so //
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni slob pa rnams so //
translated: Those who correctly practice are the learners.

original: skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni @302b so so'i skye bo dge ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni @302b so so'i skye bo dge ba rnams kyis so //
translated: The excellent beings are the virtuous ordinary beings.

original: nyam nga bar gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'dir mi bde bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nyam nga bar gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'dir mi bde bar gyur pa'o //
translated: They are distressed means they are unhappy.

original: bdag gi mthus zhes bya ba ni bdag gi nus pas so //
analyzed: bdag gi mthus zhes bya ba ni bdag gi nus pas so //
translated: By my power means by my ability.

original: gzings lta bur gyur zhes bya ba ni dper na gzings kyis gzhan bsgral nas bdag nyid bsgral bar mi nus pa de bzhin du bdag gi mthus 'di dag gis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang rdzu 'phrul mngon par bsgrubs par gyur na /
analyzed: gzings lta bur gyur zhes bya ba ni dper na gzings kyis gzhan bsgral nas bdag nyid bsgral bar mi nus pa de bzhin du bdag gi mthus 'di dag gis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang rdzu 'phrul mngon par bsgrubs par gyur na /
translated: The phrase like a boat means that, just as a boat can carry others across a river but cannot carry itself across, in the same way, through my power, they have attained the fruit of non-return and have accomplished their magical powers.

original: bdag ni so so'i skye bo nyid du gnas shing rdzu 'phrul med pa lta snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni so so'i skye bo nyid du gnas shing rdzu 'phrul med pa lta snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: But I remain an ordinary person, without magical powers.

original: yud tsam zhes bya ba ni 'dir dus ji srid kyis bsams pa'i ngon 'grub pa'i yul la bya ba'o //
analyzed: yud tsam zhes bya ba ni 'dir dus ji srid kyis bsams pa'i ngon 'grub pa'i yul la bya ba'o //
translated: For a moment means that the time is as long as it takes to accomplish the intended purpose.

original: mang du thos pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dang // 'dul ba dang chos mngon pa la sogs pa dam pa'i bstan bcos la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: mang du thos pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dang // 'dul ba dang chos mngon pa la sogs pa dam pa'i bstan bcos la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Much learning means being skilled in the scriptures, such as the sutras, vinaya, and abhidharma, and in the treatises of the holy teachings.

original: gzhan la rag ma las pa zhes bya ba ni rang la rag las pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la rag ma las pa zhes bya ba ni rang la rag las pa'o //
translated: Not dependent on others means being independent.

original: chos gos kyi grva zhes bya ba ni mtha' ma'o //
analyzed: chos gos kyi grva zhes bya ba ni mtha' ma'o //
translated: The edge of the robe means the end.

original: 'dab ma brkyang ba zhes bya ba ni gshog pa phyar ba'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma brkyang ba zhes bya ba ni gshog pa phyar ba'o //
translated: With outstretched wings means with the wings spread.

original: rdzas mkhos su 'bebs par byed pa ni nang du 'jud par byed pa'am brungs su rtsig par byed pa na'o //
analyzed: rdzas mkhos su 'bebs par byed pa ni nang du 'jud par byed pa'am brungs su rtsig par byed pa na'o //
translated: “To be put in the storehouse” means to be put inside or to be built into the wall.

original: skyes zhes bya ba ni dbul ba'o //
analyzed: skyes zhes bya ba ni dbul ba'o //
translated: “To be born” means to be given.

original: dus yol zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'o //
analyzed: dus yol zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'o //
translated: “To be past” means to be expired.

original: re ba med par gyur zhes bya ba ni re ba chad pa'o //
analyzed: re ba med par gyur zhes bya ba ni re ba chad pa'o //
translated: “To be without hope” means to be hopeless.

analyzed: dam zhag pa zhes bya ba ni zla ba phyed cing las su bskos pa ste phyag rgya pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “To be appointed” means to be appointed for a half month. This is the same as “to be sealed.”

original: 'bru mar gyi tshigs ma zhes bya ba ni til gyi tshigs ma'o //
analyzed: 'bru mar gyi tshigs ma zhes bya ba ni til gyi tshigs ma'o //
translated: “Oil-cake” means sesame-cake.

original: kun nas dkris pa drag pos zhes bya ba ni sems kyi zhe sdang ba drag pos so //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa drag pos zhes bya ba ni sems kyi zhe sdang ba drag pos so //
translated: “With a strong entanglement” means with a strong hatred in the mind.

original: sdig pa sdig pa las shogs shig ces bya ba ni nyes pa nyes pa nyid du shogs shig pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa sdig pa las shogs shig ces bya ba ni nyes pa nyes pa nyid du shogs shig pa'o //
translated: “To confess a sin as a sin” means to confess a fault as a fault.

original: bsrabs pa nyid ces bya ba ni las myong bar ma nges pa rnams kyi sbyor ba las byung ba rnam par mnan pa'o //
analyzed: bsrabs pa nyid ces bya ba ni las myong bar ma nges pa rnams kyi sbyor ba las byung ba rnam par mnan pa'o //
translated: “To be thinned out” means to suppress the preparation of those whose karma is not certain to be experienced.

original: yongs su zad pa zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi'i dus su byung ba rnams rnam par mnan pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su zad pa zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi'i dus su byung ba rnams rnam par mnan pa'o //
translated: “Complete exhaustion” means the suppression of those that arise at the time of the main practice.

original: yongs su mthar thug ces bya ba ni mjug gi dus su byung ba rnams rnam par mnan pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su mthar thug ces bya ba ni mjug gi dus su byung ba rnams rnam par mnan pa'o //
translated: “Complete conclusion” means the suppression of those that arise at the time of the conclusion.

original: rnyed pa stobs pa zhes bya ba ni dgun dang dbyar la sogs pa'i rnyed pa 'brim par byed pa ste gsar bu rgad po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa stobs pa zhes bya ba ni dgun dang dbyar la sogs pa'i rnyed pa 'brim par byed pa ste gsar bu rgad po la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Distributing the gains” means distributing the gains of winter, summer, and so on, to the young and old.

original: bsgyur zhes bya ba ni gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: bsgyur zhes bya ba ni gzhag pa'o //
translated: “Transference” means to set aside.

original: zhal lta byed pa zhes bya ba ni las byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhal lta byed pa zhes bya ba ni las byed pa'o //
translated: “Attending to the face” means to do the work.

original: khyim gyis stong pa zhes bya ba ni khyim dag med pa'o //
analyzed: khyim gyis stong pa zhes bya ba ni khyim dag med pa'o //
translated: “Empty house” means no house.

original: ri sul zhes bya ba ni chu'i 'od pas bzos pa'i ri sul lo //🔽rtsva spyil @303a * //
analyzed: ri sul zhes bya ba ni chu'i 'od pas bzos pa'i ri sul lo // rtsva spyil @303a * //

original: zhes bya ba ni rtsva'i spyil po'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtsva'i spyil po'o //
translated: “Grass hut” means a hut of grass.

original: phyis zhes bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu'o //
analyzed: phyis zhes bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu'o //
translated: “Later” means after complete nirvana.

analyzed: ri rab kyi bang rim zhes bya ba ni ri rab las phyi rim 'thon pa bzhi yod pa ni ri rab kyi bang rim zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The so-called terraces of Meru are the four terraces that extend out from Meru.

original: gser gyi ri bdun zhes bya ba ni gnya' shing 'dzin dang / gshol mda' 'dzin dang / seng ldeng can dang / blta na sdug dang rta rna ri dang / rnam par 'dud dang / mu khyud 'dzin zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: gser gyi ri bdun zhes bya ba ni gnya' shing 'dzin dang / gshol mda' 'dzin dang / seng ldeng can dang / blta na sdug dang rta rna ri dang / rnam par 'dud dang / mu khyud 'dzin zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: The so-called seven golden mountains are Yugandhara, Īṣādhara, Khadiraka, Sudarśana, Aśvakarṇa, Vinataka, and Nimindhara.

original: mtsho chen po ma dros pa dang rdzing bu dal gyis 'bab na zhes bya ba ni de dag gi drung na gnas yod pa na'o //
analyzed: mtsho chen po ma dros pa dang rdzing bu dal gyis 'bab na zhes bya ba ni de dag gi drung na gnas yod pa na'o //
translated: The great lake Anavatapta and the pond called Anupa are located in front of them.

original: drangs zhes bya ba ni khyer ba'o //
analyzed: drangs zhes bya ba ni khyer ba'o //
translated: To carry means to take.

original: mi snang bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni lus mi snang bar byed pa na'o //
analyzed: mi snang bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni lus mi snang bar byed pa na'o //
translated: To make invisible means to make the body invisible.

original: lhung bzed thogs pa zhes bya ba ni bkur ba la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhung bzed thogs pa zhes bya ba ni bkur ba la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: To hold a begging bowl means to hold it for the purpose of receiving alms.

original: 'bras chan gyi gzegs ma gcig ces bya ba ni 'bru gcig go //
analyzed: 'bras chan gyi gzegs ma gcig ces bya ba ni 'bru gcig go //
translated: A single grain of cooked rice means a single grain.

original: smon lam log pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba log par bsngos pa'o //
analyzed: smon lam log pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba log par bsngos pa'o //
translated: “Wrong aspiration” means the perversion of the roots of virtue.

original: las shin tu chen po zhes bya ba ni bsags pa'o //
analyzed: las shin tu chen po zhes bya ba ni bsags pa'o //
translated: “Very great action” means accumulated action.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa dang dus dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa dang dus dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Complete” means the coming together of the conditions and the time.

original: kha cig na re shin tu chen po zhes bya ba ni bsams pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re shin tu chen po zhes bya ba ni bsams pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Some say: “Very great” means having the distinction of intention.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni bsags pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni bsags pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: “Complete” means accumulated.

original: lus brje ba zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: lus brje ba zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'o //
translated: “Change of body” means death.

original: sems 'di thag ring gyur pa ste zhes bya ba ni zlog pa'i mthu nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems 'di thag ring gyur pa ste zhes bya ba ni zlog pa'i mthu nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “This mind has gone far away” means the loss of the power to turn back.

original: de nyid du skyes zhes bya ba ni shi 'phos nas so //
analyzed: de nyid du skyes zhes bya ba ni shi 'phos nas so //
translated: “Born in that very place” means after death.

original: mu stegs can zhugs pa rab tu dbyung bar mi bya zhing de la sdom pa skye ba'i chos nyid med pa dang / de lta bu rab tu byung ba'i rtags can bsnyil bar bya ba'i byung ba'i mtha' bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mu stegs can zhugs pa rab tu dbyung bar mi bya zhing de la sdom pa skye ba'i chos nyid med pa dang / de lta bu rab tu byung ba'i rtags can bsnyil bar bya ba'i byung ba'i mtha' bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not proper to give going forth to tīrthikas, and it is not proper to give vows to them, because the nature of the arising of vows does not exist for them.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The Buddha, the Bhagavān, was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: zhag bri bar gyur nas zhes bya ba ni sun cu mi thub par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: zhag bri bar gyur nas zhes bya ba ni sun cu mi thub par gyur pa ste /
translated: Having become disgusted, means having become unable to bear it.

original: dgun dang so ga dbyar rnams kyi //
analyzed: dgun dang so ga dbyar rnams kyi //
translated: In winter, spring, and summer,

original: zla ba phyed dang gnyis 'das pa'i //
analyzed: zla ba phyed dang gnyis 'das pa'i //
translated: after two and a half months have passed,🔽the remaining half month

original: ltag ma zla ba phyed po dag / mkhas pas zhag ni da bri bar bya //
analyzed: ltag ma zla ba phyed po dag / mkhas pas zhag ni da bri bar bya //
translated: the wise should subtract from the days.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //🔽des pa zhes bya ba ni bgrungs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro // des pa zhes bya ba ni bgrungs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Because it is explained that way.🔽Gentle means having virtue.

original: 'grogs na bde ba zhes bya ba ni spro ring ba'o //
analyzed: 'grogs na bde ba zhes bya ba ni spro ring ba'o //
translated: Pleasant to be with means having a long temper.

original: ngang tshul ngan pa zhes bya ba ni spro thung ba yin gyi spyod pa nyams pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ngang tshul ngan pa zhes bya ba ni spro thung ba yin gyi spyod pa nyams pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The bad disposition is a short temper, not a degeneration of conduct.

original: tshul shing yang phyung bar gyur zhes @303b bya ba ni bgrang ba'i don gyi thur ma yang bor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul shing yang phyung bar gyur zhes @303b bya ba ni bgrang ba'i don gyi thur ma yang bor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The throwing out of the staff is the throwing out of the counting stick.

original: spang leb khri'u yang bsgyur bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi nang stan bting pa gnas nas bton par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: spang leb khri'u yang bsgyur bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi nang stan bting pa gnas nas bton par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The turning over of the board is the removal of the seat that has been set up for the fellow brahmacārin.

original: slong por yang khas phub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni khrims su bca' bas longs spyod pa nyams par byed cing zas kyi snod kyang nyams par byed pa'o //
analyzed: slong por yang khas phub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni khrims su bca' bas longs spyod pa nyams par byed cing zas kyi snod kyang nyams par byed pa'o //
translated: The covering of the begging bowl is the covering of the bowl of enjoyments by the vow, and the covering of the food vessel.

original: slong phor zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyi lhung bzed kyi ming ngo /
analyzed: slong phor zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyi lhung bzed kyi ming ngo /
translated: The begging bowl is the name of the heretic's bowl.

original: khar ba yang bor bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni khar pa yang gnas nas phyi rol du bor bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: khar ba yang bor bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni khar pa yang gnas nas phyi rol du bor bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The throwing out of the staff is the throwing out of the staff from the place.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi nang nas kyang phyung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de dag gi nang nas bskrad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi nang nas kyang phyung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de dag gi nang nas bskrad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: He will be expelled from the midst of the community of monks means that he will be driven out from their midst.

original: dge skos zhes bya ba ni gsar bu rgan po la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dge skos zhes bya ba ni gsar bu rgan po la sogs pa ste /
translated: The monk is the novice, the elder, and so on.

original: rdzas bsrung bar bskos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas bsrung bar bskos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is appointed to guard the goods.

original: bsngos pa zhes bya ba ni bgrangs pa na'o //
analyzed: bsngos pa zhes bya ba ni bgrangs pa na'o //
translated: The assigned is the counted.

original: 'dun pa zhes bya ba ni bsam pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa zhes bya ba ni bsam pa brjod pa'o //
translated: The intention is the expression of the thought.

original: rgyal mtshan 'di zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i dge slong gi rtags so //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan 'di zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i dge slong gi rtags so //
translated: The banner is the mark of a monk spoken by the Tathagata.

original: lta ba de la zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyi lta ba'o //
analyzed: lta ba de la zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyi lta ba'o //
translated: The view is the view of the tīrthikas.

analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyi gnas su'o //
translated: The there is the abode of the tīrthikas.

original: skya rangs 'char bar byed na zhes bya ba ni skya rengs dang po'o //
analyzed: skya rangs 'char bar byed na zhes bya ba ni skya rengs dang po'o //
translated: If he makes the dawn break, means the first dawn.

original: gang zag ma bsad pa rab tu dbyung bar mi bya ba dang / de la sdom pa skye ba'i chos nyid med pa dang de lta bu rab tu byung ba'i rtags can bsnyil bar bya ba'i byung ba'i mtha' bstan pa'i phyir /

translated: The chapter on the end of the eon demonstrates the non-issuing forth of those who have killed their mothers and the non-existence of the reality of the generation of vows in them, and the expulsion of those who have such characteristics of having gone forth.

original: khyim zhes bya ba ni khang pa'o //
analyzed: khyim zhes bya ba ni khang pa'o //
translated: “House” means a building.

translated: “The two, the mistress and the slave” means the two, the master and the servant.

analyzed: gnas skabs zhes bya ba ni chad pa'o //

translated: “Teaching” means

original: mngon par dga' ba'o //

translated: “delighting.”

analyzed: thabs zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
translated: “Means” means “cause.”

analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i thabs zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bsams pa'i don grub pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: “The means of deliverance” means the cause of accomplishing the intended goal.

original: dge ba yis ni 'gog byed de //
analyzed: dge ba yis ni 'gog byed de //
translated: “The good stops it”

original: zhes bya ba ni dge bas 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dge bas 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: means that the good will occur.

analyzed: de snang 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sdig pa bsrabs pa'i lus ni gsal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “It will appear” means that the body, in which the evil has been reduced, will become clear.

analyzed: rjes su 'jug par bya zhes bya ba ni dad par byas pa'o //

analyzed: dge ba'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni bsro gang byed du bcug pas so //

translated: “Celestial maiden” is goddess.

original: yongs su gnas pa bstan te zhes bya ba ni zhag lon te'o //
analyzed: yongs su gnas pa bstan te zhes bya ba ni zhag lon te'o //
translated: “Having shown the full ordination” is having the full ordination after one night.

original: rna cha gdub 'khor g-yo zhing dri ma med pa thogs te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rna cha gdub 'khor g-yo zhing dri ma med pa thogs te zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Wearing earrings and anklets that swing and are stainless” is as follows.

original: rna cha gdub 'khor zhes bya ba ni rna rgyan gdub 'khor can no //🔽g-yo zhing zhes bya ba ni yang ba'o //
analyzed: rna cha gdub 'khor zhes bya ba ni rna rgyan gdub 'khor can no // g-yo zhing zhes bya ba ni yang ba'o //
translated: “Earrings and anklets” are earrings and anklets.🔽“Swinging” is light.

original: dri ma med pa zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: dri ma med pa zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: “Stainless” is clear.

original: thogs te zhes bya ba ni des de nyid do //
analyzed: thogs te zhes bya ba ni des de nyid do //
translated: “Wearing” is having them.

original: thu ba zhes bya ba ni bla gos kyi grva'o //
analyzed: thu ba zhes bya ba ni bla gos kyi grva'o //
translated: The edge is the edge of the upper robe.

original: kha dog shin tu 'das pa zhes bya ba ni mi las shin tu 'das pa'i kha dog dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dog shin tu 'das pa zhes bya ba ni mi las shin tu 'das pa'i kha dog dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The very excellent color is because it has a color that is very excellent compared to that of humans.

original: mtshan mo la bab pa zhes bya ba ni nam sros pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo la bab pa zhes bya ba ni nam sros pa'o //
translated: The nightfall is the time when it is dark.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu mthob  zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu mthob  zhes bya ba la /
translated: The twenty peaks of the mountain of the view of the transitory collection is as follows.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i yul la bdag dang bdag gir shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i yul la bdag dang bdag gir shes pa'o //
translated: The view of the transitory collection is the perception of the five appropriated aggregates as an I and mine.

original: ri'i rtse mo zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba de nyid gzhig dka' ba'i phyir ri dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ri'i rtse mo zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba de nyid gzhig dka' ba'i phyir ri dang 'dra'o //
translated: The peaks are like mountains because that view of the transitory collection is difficult to destroy.

original: nyi shu zhes bya ba ni bdag gzugs yin te bdag po dang 'dra ba dang / bdag gzugs dang ldan te rgyan dang 'dra ba dang / gzugs bdag gi yin te bran dang 'dra ba dang / gzugs la bdag gnas te snod dang 'dra ba dang /
analyzed: nyi shu zhes bya ba ni bdag gzugs yin te bdag po dang 'dra ba dang / bdag gzugs dang ldan te rgyan dang 'dra ba dang / gzugs bdag gi yin te bran dang 'dra ba dang / gzugs la bdag gnas te snod dang 'dra ba dang /
translated: The twenty are as follows: The self is form, like a lord; the self possesses form, like an ornament; form is mine, like a servant; I abide in form, like a vessel; I am form, like a thief; I am without form, like space.

original: bdag tshor ba yin te bdag po dang 'dra ba dang / bdag tshor ba dang ldan te rgyan dang 'dra ba dang / tshor ba bdag gi yin te bran dang 'dra ba dang / tshor ba la bdag gnas te snod dang 'dra ba dang / bdag 'du shes yin @304b te bdag po dang 'dra ba dang /
analyzed: bdag tshor ba yin te bdag po dang 'dra ba dang / bdag tshor ba dang ldan te rgyan dang 'dra ba dang / tshor ba bdag gi yin te bran dang 'dra ba dang / tshor ba la bdag gnas te snod dang 'dra ba dang / bdag 'du shes yin @304b te bdag po dang 'dra ba dang /
translated: I am perception, like a master.🔽I possess perception, like an ornament.🔽Perception is mine, like a servant.🔽I abide in perception, like a vessel.🔽I am formation, like a master.

original: bdag 'du shes dang ldan te rgyan dang 'dra ba dang / 'du shes bdag gi yin te bran dang 'dra ba dang / 'du shes la bdag gnas te snod dang 'dra ba dang / bdag 'du byed yin te bdag po dang 'dra ba dang / bdag 'du byed dang ldan te rgyan dang 'dra ba dang /
analyzed: bdag 'du shes dang ldan te rgyan dang 'dra ba dang / 'du shes bdag gi yin te bran dang 'dra ba dang / 'du shes la bdag gnas te snod dang 'dra ba dang / bdag 'du byed yin te bdag po dang 'dra ba dang / bdag 'du byed dang ldan te rgyan dang 'dra ba dang /
translated: I possess formation, like an ornament.

original: 'du byed bdag gi yin te bran dang 'dra ba dang / 'du byed la bdag gnas te snod dang 'dra ba dang / bdag rnam par shes pa yin te bdag po dang 'dra ba dang / bdag rnam par shes pa dang 'dra ste rgyan dang 'dra ba dang /
analyzed: 'du byed bdag gi yin te bran dang 'dra ba dang / 'du byed la bdag gnas te snod dang 'dra ba dang / bdag rnam par shes pa yin te bdag po dang 'dra ba dang / bdag rnam par shes pa dang 'dra ste rgyan dang 'dra ba dang /
translated: The self is like consciousness, like an ornament.🔽Consciousness is mine, like a servant.🔽Consciousness is my abode, like a vessel.

original: rnam par shes pa bdag gi yin te bran dang 'dra ba dang / rnam par shes pa bdag la gnas te snod dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba bdag tu lta ba'i rnam pa nyi shu po dag go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bdag gi yin te bran dang 'dra ba dang / rnam par shes pa bdag la gnas te snod dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba bdag tu lta ba'i rnam pa nyi shu po dag go //
translated: These are the twenty aspects of the view of the self.

original: ye shes kyi rdo rje zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam ste mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa cig car 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rdo rje zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam ste mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa cig car 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The vajra of wisdom is the path of seeing, because it simultaneously conquers the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: 'o na bzod pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba 'joms kyi shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na bzod pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba 'joms kyi shes pa ma yin te /
translated: Well, if that is so, then patience conquers the afflicted view of the self, but knowledge does not.

original: srid rtse las skyes bzod pa yis //🔽gzhom bya mthong bas spang bya nyid //
analyzed: srid rtse las skyes bzod pa yis // gzhom bya mthong bas spang bya nyid //
translated: The Abhidharmakosa states, Patience born in the summit of existence🔽Conquers the objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: lhag skyes mthong dang sgom gnyis kyis //
analyzed: lhag skyes mthong dang sgom gnyis kyis //
translated: The rest are conquered by both seeing and meditation.

original: bzod pas gzhom min sgom kho nas //
analyzed: bzod pas gzhom min sgom kho nas //
translated: Not by forbearance, but only by meditation.🔽

original: zhes bshad na /
analyzed: zhes bshad na /
translated: They are not overcome by patience, but only by meditation.

original: ji ltar ye shes rdo rjes 'joms she na /
analyzed: ji ltar ye shes rdo rjes 'joms she na /
translated: How is it that they are overcome by the vajra of knowledge?

original: bden mod kyi 'on kyang bzod pa dag ni shes pa'i 'khor yin pas shes pa la nye bar gdags te /
analyzed: bden mod kyi 'on kyang bzod pa dag ni shes pa'i 'khor yin pas shes pa la nye bar gdags te /
translated: It is true, but patience is the retinue of knowledge, so it is figuratively designated as knowledge.

original: rgyal po'i 'khor rgyal po la nye bar gdags pa dang 'dra bas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rgyal po'i 'khor rgyal po la nye bar gdags pa dang 'dra bas nyes pa med do //
translated: Like the retinue of a king is figuratively designated as the king, there is no fault.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yang dag par so sor rtogs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa bzhi khong du chud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yang dag par so sor rtogs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa bzhi khong du chud par byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase causing the correct discernment of the four noble truths means causing the understanding of the four noble truths.

original: sngon gyi pha mes zhes bya ba ni mes po la sogs pa nye du sngon shi ba dag go //🔽mdza' ba shes zhes bya ba ni grogs po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi pha mes zhes bya ba ni mes po la sogs pa nye du sngon shi ba dag go // mdza' ba shes zhes bya ba ni grogs po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase former ancestors refers to relatives who have died before, such as grandparents.🔽The phrase friends and relatives refers to friends and so on.

original: rtsa lag ces bya ba ni mes po zhes bya ba la sogs pa nye du'o //
analyzed: rtsa lag ces bya ba ni mes po zhes bya ba la sogs pa nye du'o //
translated: The phrase kinsmen refers to relatives such as uncles.

original: bsgoms zhes bya ba ni yang dag par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgoms zhes bya ba ni yang dag par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase meditating means that they are not transformed.

original: bsgral zhes bya ba ni yang sogs par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgral zhes bya ba ni yang sogs par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Liberated” means that one does not return to the former state.

original: bskum zhes bya ba ni spang der 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskum zhes bya ba ni spang der 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Bent” means that one enters into the abandonment.

original: phye zhes bya ba ni der 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phye zhes bya ba ni der 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Opened” means that one goes there.

original: khyod mthus zhes bya ba ni khyod kyis phan btags pa'i mthus so //
analyzed: khyod mthus zhes bya ba ni khyod kyis phan btags pa'i mthus so //
translated: “By your power” means by the power of your assistance.

original: rab drag ces bya ba ni rab tu 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: rab drag ces bya ba ni rab tu 'jigs pa'o //
translated: “Very fierce” means very frightening.

original: nyes pa mang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni mtshon dang me dang tshe ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyes pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa mang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni mtshon dang me dang tshe ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyes pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Having many faults” means having faults such as weapons, fire, and disease.

original: ngan song shul zhes bya ba ni yang sos la sogs pa'i sgo'o //🔽bkag @305a * //
analyzed: ngan song shul zhes bya ba ni yang sos la sogs pa'i sgo'o // bkag @305a * //
translated: “Path to the lower realms” means the door to the Reviving Hell, etc.

original: ces bya ba ni bcad pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bcad pa'o //
translated: “Blocked” means closed.

original: bsod nams rab ldan pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu bzang ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams rab ldan pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu bzang ba'o //
translated: “Having much merit” means being very good.

original: mtho ris 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni rgyal chen bzhi pa la sogs pa'i mtho ris kyi lam mo //
analyzed: mtho ris 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni rgyal chen bzhi pa la sogs pa'i mtho ris kyi lam mo //
translated: “Path to the higher realms” means the path to the higher realms of the Four Great Kings, etc.

original: phye zhing zhes bya ba ni bstan zhing ngo //
analyzed: phye zhing zhes bya ba ni bstan zhing ngo //
translated: “Opened” means revealed.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i shul zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam mo ;
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i shul zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam mo ;
translated: The “other shore of nirvana” is the noble path.

original: ; thob par gyur zhes bya ba ni shes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ; thob par gyur zhes bya ba ni shes par gyur pa'o //
translated: “Having attained” means having known.

original: shin tu rnam dag ces bya ba ni bod pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: shin tu rnam dag ces bya ba ni bod pa'i tshig ste /
translated: “Extremely pure” is a Tibetan expression.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Bhagavān is so called because he has abandoned the afflictions along with their traces.

original: skyon bral zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: skyon bral zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'o //
translated: “Free from faults” means being without outflows.

original: dag pa zhes bya ba ni ma nor ba'o //
analyzed: dag pa zhes bya ba ni ma nor ba'o //
translated: “Pure” means being without error.

original: thob cing zhes bya ba ni rnyed cing ngo //
analyzed: thob cing zhes bya ba ni rnyed cing ngo //
translated: “Having attained” means having found.

original: go 'phang zhi ba zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste sdug bsngal zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go 'phang zhi ba zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste sdug bsngal zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “The state of peace” is nirvana, because it is the pacification of suffering.

original: 'phags pa dgyes pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams bzhad pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa dgyes pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams bzhad pa'o //
translated: “Delightful to the noble ones” means being delightful to the noble ones.

original: sdug bsngal rgya mtsho pha rol rgal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgya mtsho pha rol rgal bar 'gyur //
translated: “One will cross to the other shore of the ocean of suffering”

original: zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i cha las rgyal bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i cha las rgyal bar gyur pa ste /
translated: means that one will conquer the part of cyclic existence

original: srid pa bdun pa las med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa bdun pa las med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one will not have a seventh existence.

original: 'gro ba lha min mi dang lhas mchod pa //
analyzed: 'gro ba lha min mi dang lhas mchod pa //
translated: He is worshipped by gods, demigods, and men.

original: skye dang rga dang na 'chi bral ba po //
analyzed: skye dang rga dang na 'chi bral ba po //
translated: He is free from birth, old age, sickness, and death.

original: srid pa stong du mthong ba rab dkon pa //
analyzed: srid pa stong du mthong ba rab dkon pa //
translated: He is rarely seen in a thousand existences.

original: thub pa zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: thub pa zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
translated: The word “sage” is a vocative.

original: 'gro bar zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i 'khor bar ro //
analyzed: 'gro bar zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i 'khor bar ro //
translated: “In the world” means in the cyclic existence of the three realms.

original: 'dud byas zhes bya ba ni zhabs gnyis la phyag byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'dud byas zhes bya ba ni zhabs gnyis la phyag byas pa ste /
translated: “Bowing” means bowing to the two feet.

original: zhabs gnyis la yan lag lngas 'dud par byas nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhabs gnyis la yan lag lngas 'dud par byas nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that he bowed with his five limbs to the two feet.

original: do shal rab 'phyang bas zhes bya bas ni do shal dang se mo dos brgyan pa'i lus kyis so //
analyzed: do shal rab 'phyang bas zhes bya bas ni do shal dang se mo dos brgyan pa'i lus kyis so //
translated: “With a necklace hanging down” means with a body adorned with necklaces and bracelets.

original: dgra thul g-yas nas yongs su bskor byas te //
analyzed: dgra thul g-yas nas yongs su bskor byas te //
translated: “Circumambulating to the right of the Conqueror”

original: zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yas phyogs nas song ba ste g-yas phyogs nas bskor zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
