analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yas phyogs nas song ba ste g-yas phyogs nas bskor zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: means going to the right of the Blessed One, the meaning being that he circumambulated to the right.

original: mkha' la song zhes bya ba ni bar snang la song zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mkha' la song zhes bya ba ni bar snang la song zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Ascending into the sky” means ascending into the air, the meaning being that he went into the air.

original: tshong pa khe spogs rnyed pa lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dga' ba'i khyad par thob pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: tshong pa khe spogs rnyed pa lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dga' ba'i khyad par thob pa'i dpe'o //
translated: The phrase like a merchant who has gained a profit and so on are examples of the attainment of a special joy.

original: cha lugs gang gis zhes bya ba ni rna cha gdub 'khor g-yo zhing dri ma med pa thogs te ;
analyzed: cha lugs gang gis zhes bya ba ni rna cha gdub 'khor g-yo zhing dri ma med pa thogs te ;
translated: The phrase in whatever attire refers to the wearing of earrings and bracelets that are moving and spotless.

original: do shal dang se mo dos brgyan pa'i lus kyis zhes sngar bstan pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: do shal dang se mo dos brgyan pa'i lus kyis zhes sngar bstan pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The phrase with a body adorned with necklaces and bracelets is taught by the previous phrase itself.

original: khar phor zhes bya ba ni khar ba las byas pa'i snod do //
analyzed: khar phor zhes bya ba ni khar ba las byas pa'i snod do //
translated: The word goblet refers to a vessel made of horn.

original: kye ma sangs rgyas kye ma chos kye ma dge 'dun kye ma chos kyi legs pa gsungs pa nyid ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun dang bstan pa'i chos @305b kyi legs par gsungs pa thun mong pa spyir phan 'dogs pa nyid do /
analyzed: kye ma sangs rgyas kye ma chos kye ma dge 'dun kye ma chos kyi legs pa gsungs pa nyid ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun dang bstan pa'i chos @305b kyi legs par gsungs pa thun mong pa spyir phan 'dogs pa nyid do /
translated: The phrase alas, Buddha! alas, Dharma! alas, Saṅgha! alas, the well-spoken Dharma! refers to the common, general benefit of the Buddha, Dharma, Saṅgha, and the well-spoken Dharma.

original: mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word alas means wonderful!

original: chad du brjod pa zhes bya ba ni thun mong gi yon tan spyir bstod pa'o //
analyzed: chad du brjod pa zhes bya ba ni thun mong gi yon tan spyir bstod pa'o //
translated: The word praise refers to the common, general praise of good qualities.

original: rangs zhes bya ba ni bzhin rab tu dang bas so //
analyzed: rangs zhes bya ba ni bzhin rab tu dang bas so //
translated: Joy means a very clear face.

original: mgu zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: mgu zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Delight means obtaining the desired result.

original: ; mchog tu dga' ba zhes bya ba ni skad rab tu gsal bas so //
analyzed: ; mchog tu dga' ba zhes bya ba ni skad rab tu gsal bas so //
translated: Supreme joy means a very clear voice.

original: dri ba'i lan gdab pa'o zhes bya ba ni dris par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dri ba'i lan gdab pa'o zhes bya ba ni dris par bstan pa'o //
translated: The answer to the question means what was asked.

original: dus ma yin gyis zhes bya ba ni de ni skye bo mang po med la /
analyzed: dus ma yin gyis zhes bya ba ni de ni skye bo mang po med la /
translated: Not the right time means that there are not many people there.

original: dge 'dun gyi nang na skye bo mang po yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi nang na skye bo mang po yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the Sangha there are many people.

original: skabs de zhes bya ba ni mkhan po dge ba'i sems kyis dus la bab nas rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi nang du skyes shing 'phags pa'i bden pa mthong bar gyur pa'i skabs de'o //
analyzed: skabs de zhes bya ba ni mkhan po dge ba'i sems kyis dus la bab nas rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi nang du skyes shing 'phags pa'i bden pa mthong bar gyur pa'i skabs de'o //
translated: That occasion means that when the preceptor's virtuous mind was timely, he was born among the Caturmaharajakayika gods and saw the noble truths.

original: gang zag pha bsad pa rab tu dbyung bar mi bya de la sdom pa skye ba'i chos nyid med pa dang / de lta bur rab tu byung ba'i rtags can bsnyil bar bya ba'i mtha' bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag pha bsad pa rab tu dbyung bar mi bya de la sdom pa skye ba'i chos nyid med pa dang / de lta bur rab tu byung ba'i rtags can bsnyil bar bya ba'i mtha' bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The person who has killed his father is not to be ordained, because he lacks the nature to generate vows.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The Buddha, the Bhagavat, was staying in Shravasti, in the Jeta Grove, in the garden of Anathapindika.

original: tshig gi don gzhan ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig gi don gzhan ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the words is the same as before.

original: sdom la / dgra bcom bsad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar rab tu 'byung ba'i gzhi'i spyi sdom las dgra bcom ba bsad pa dang zhes smos pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: sdom la / dgra bcom bsad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar rab tu 'byung ba'i gzhi'i spyi sdom las dgra bcom ba bsad pa dang zhes smos pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The summary verse says: “Killing an arhat, and so on,” which is connected to the summary verse of the general basis for ordination mentioned earlier, which says “killing an arhat.”

original: gang zag dgra bcom pa bsad pa rab tu dbyung bar mi bya zhing de la sdom pa skye ba'i chos nyid med pa dang / de lta bu rab tu byung ba'i rtags can bsnyil bar bya ba'i byung ba'i mtha' bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zag dgra bcom pa bsad pa rab tu dbyung bar mi bya zhing de la sdom pa skye ba'i chos nyid med pa dang / de lta bu rab tu byung ba'i rtags can bsnyil bar bya ba'i byung ba'i mtha' bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not proper to give the going forth to a person who has killed an arhat, and it is not proper to give the vows to him, because he lacks the nature to generate the vows.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The Buddha, the Bhagavan, was staying in Shravasti, in the Jeta Grove, in the garden of Anathapindika.

original: ko sa lar byung ba zhes bya ba ni yul ko sa lar skyes pa'o //
analyzed: ko sa lar byung ba zhes bya ba ni yul ko sa lar skyes pa'o //
translated: The one who was born in Kosala means the one who was born in the country of Kosala.

original: gzhon nu'i dpe'i mdo sde zhes bya ba ni rgyal po chen po bzhi po 'di dag ni gzhon ni khyad du gsad par mi bya zhing gzhon nu zil gyis mnan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu'i dpe'i mdo sde zhes bya ba ni rgyal po chen po bzhi po 'di dag ni gzhon ni khyad du gsad par mi bya zhing gzhon nu zil gyis mnan par mi bya'o //
translated: The Sutra of the Example of the Youth means O great king, you should not despise the youth, you should not overpower the youth.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: rgyal po chen po rgyal rigs gzhon nu khyad du gsad par mi bya zhing gzhon nu zil gyis mnan par mi bya ba dang / rgyal po chen po brang 'gro gzhon nu khyad du gsad par mi bya zhing /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po rgyal rigs gzhon nu khyad du gsad par mi bya zhing gzhon nu zil gyis mnan par mi bya ba dang / rgyal po chen po brang 'gro gzhon nu khyad du gsad par mi bya zhing /
translated: Great King, you should not disregard or overpower a young householder.

original: gzhon nu zil gyis mnan par mi bya ba dang / rgyal po chen po @306a * //🔽me chung du khyad du gsad par mi bya zhing me chung du zil gyis mnan par mi bya ba dang / rgyal po chen po dge slong gzhon nu khyad du gsad par mi bya zhing /
analyzed: gzhon nu zil gyis mnan par mi bya ba dang / rgyal po chen po @306a * // me chung du khyad du gsad par mi bya zhing me chung du zil gyis mnan par mi bya ba dang / rgyal po chen po dge slong gzhon nu khyad du gsad par mi bya zhing /
translated: Great King, you should not disregard or overpower a young monk.🔽Great King, you should not disregard or overpower a small fire.

original: gzhon nu zil gyis mnan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu zil gyis mnan par mi bya'o //
translated: Great King, you should not disregard or overpower a young monk.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyal po chen po dge slong gzhon nu yin yang de ni rdzu 'phrul che zhing mthu che ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhon nu las dpe blangs pa'i mdo sde ste /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po dge slong gzhon nu yin yang de ni rdzu 'phrul che zhing mthu che ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhon nu las dpe blangs pa'i mdo sde ste /
translated: Great King, even though a monk is young, he has great magical power and great might.”

original: de nyid gzhung 'di las dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyi gzhi'i skabs nas 'og nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid gzhung 'di las dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyi gzhi'i skabs nas 'og nas 'byung ngo //
translated: This is explained below in the section on schism in the Sangha.

original: btul zhes bya ba ni 'dul bar byas pa ste /
analyzed: btul zhes bya ba ni 'dul bar byas pa ste /
translated: “Subdued” means made to submit.

original: dkon mchog gsum la dad par byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la dad par byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means “made to have faith in the Three Jewels.”

original: sa mtshams kye bar zhes bya ba ni mtshams kyi bar ro //
analyzed: sa mtshams kye bar zhes bya ba ni mtshams kyi bar ro //
translated: “Within the boundary” means within the boundary.

original: sel ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni dpung dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: sel ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni dpung dang bcas pa'o //
translated: “Along with the army” means along with the troops.

original: bya ma rta zhes bya ba ni nyan rna ste bya ra ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bya ma rta zhes bya ba ni nyan rna ste bya ra ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Watchmen” are spies, that is, people who keep watch.

original: btang snyoms zhes bya ba ni brtsal ba chung ngu'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms zhes bya ba ni brtsal ba chung ngu'o //
translated: “Indifference” means a small amount of effort.

original: ma bsams par zhes bya ba ni so sor ma brtags par ro //🔽skra yegs zhes bya ba ni skra 'greng ba dang / skra 'phyar bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ma bsams par zhes bya ba ni so sor ma brtags par ro // skra yegs zhes bya ba ni skra 'greng ba dang / skra 'phyar bar gyur pa'o //
translated: “Without thinking” means without examining.🔽“Hair bristling” means hair standing on end.

original: ku co 'don zhes bya ba ni du ba'i sgra 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: ku co 'don zhes bya ba ni du ba'i sgra 'byin pa'o //
translated: “Shouting” means making a sound like “ha ha.”

original: bag yangs su zhes bya ba ni bag tsha ba med par ro //
analyzed: bag yangs su zhes bya ba ni bag tsha ba med par ro //
translated: “Carefree” means without fear.

original: gson por bzung ste zhes bya ba ni srog dang ldan bzhin du bzung ste'o //
analyzed: gson por bzung ste zhes bya ba ni srog dang ldan bzhin du bzung ste'o //
translated: Holding means holding while alive.

original: lam po che zhes bya ba ni shing rta'i lam mo //
analyzed: lam po che zhes bya ba ni shing rta'i lam mo //
translated: A highway is a road for carts.

original: srang zhes bya ba ni lam dog pa'am tshong 'dus kyi dbus so //
analyzed: srang zhes bya ba ni lam dog pa'am tshong 'dus kyi dbus so //
translated: A lane is a narrow road or the center of a marketplace.

original: rjes su sgrogs shing zhes bya ba ni gang de dag bya ba ma yin pa byed pa de dag la chad pa 'di lta bu bya'o zhes thams cad du go bar byed cing ngo //
analyzed: rjes su sgrogs shing zhes bya ba ni gang de dag bya ba ma yin pa byed pa de dag la chad pa 'di lta bu bya'o zhes thams cad du go bar byed cing ngo //
translated: Proclaiming means making it known everywhere that those who do what should not be done will be punished in such and such a way.

original: gsad pa zhes bya ba ni gsad pa'i gnas te dur khrod la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsad pa zhes bya ba ni gsad pa'i gnas te dur khrod la sogs pa'o //
translated: A place of execution is a place of execution, such as a charnel ground.

original: rgud pa zhes bya ba ni dpal med pa'o //
analyzed: rgud pa zhes bya ba ni dpal med pa'o //
translated: A degraded state is a lack of glory.

original: 'byor ba zhes bya ba ni phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byor ba zhes bya ba ni phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: A prosperous state is excellence.

original: ci'i phyir 'byor pa kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba'i gnas yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'byor pa kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba'i gnas yin zhe na /
translated: Why is prosperity a basis for becoming disgusted?

original: rgyal po dang rkun po la sogs pa dang thun mong yin pas gnod pa dang / mi brtan pa nyid du kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba dang / rang gi las kyis 'phangs pas gzhan la bsgyur du med pa'i phyir las la kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de dag kyang snyems pa rnams dang /
analyzed: rgyal po dang rkun po la sogs pa dang thun mong yin pas gnod pa dang / mi brtan pa nyid du kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba dang / rang gi las kyis 'phangs pas gzhan la bsgyur du med pa'i phyir las la kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de dag kyang snyems pa rnams dang /
translated: Since they are shared with kings, thieves, and so on, they are a source of harm, they are unstable and thus a source of weariness, and since they are projected by one's karma, they cannot be transferred to others and thus are a source of weariness.

original: zhum pa rnams kun du skyo ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //🔽gang zag dge 'dun gyi dbyin byas pa rab tu dbyung bar mi bya zhing de la sngom pa skye ba'i chos nyid med pa dang / de lta bu rab tu dbyung ba'i rtags can bsnyil bar bya ba bstan pa'i @306b phyir gang gis sngon rab tu byung ba na /
analyzed: zhum pa rnams kun du skyo ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro // gang zag dge 'dun gyi dbyin byas pa rab tu dbyung bar mi bya zhing de la sngom pa skye ba'i chos nyid med pa dang / de lta bu rab tu dbyung ba'i rtags can bsnyil bar bya ba bstan pa'i @306b phyir gang gis sngon rab tu byung ba na /
translated: Thus, they are a source of weariness for the proud and the weary.🔽To demonstrate that a person who has split the Saṅgha should not be ordained and that it is not possible for vows to arise in such a person, the following verse is stated:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun bye ba de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun bye ba de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The Buddha said, In the past, when I was a monk named Sūrata, I split the Saṅgha of the Tathāgata's disciples.

original: 'di ni byung ba'i mtha' las bcas pa ni ma yin gyi zhus pa'i skabs nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni byung ba'i mtha' las bcas pa ni ma yin gyi zhus pa'i skabs nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is not a case of the conclusion of an event, but rather of the conclusion of a question.

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen zhes bya ba ni lha sbyin dang sbom dga' mo lta bus dge 'dun brgyad la sogs pa gnyis su phye ba ste de byas nas sdom pa btang ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen zhes bya ba ni lha sbyin dang sbom dga' mo lta bus dge 'dun brgyad la sogs pa gnyis su phye ba ste de byas nas sdom pa btang ste /
translated: A schism of the Saṅgha is when eight or more fully ordained monks are divided into two factions, such as Devadatta and Thullanandā, and then the vows are relinquished.

original: bsams nas yang rab tu 'byung bar 'dod na de rab tu dbyung ba dang rdzogs par bsnyen par mi bya zhing de la sdom pa skye ba'i chos nyid med pa dang / de lta bu rab tu byung ba'i rtags can bsnyil bar gsungs so //
analyzed: bsams nas yang rab tu 'byung bar 'dod na de rab tu dbyung ba dang rdzogs par bsnyen par mi bya zhing de la sdom pa skye ba'i chos nyid med pa dang / de lta bu rab tu byung ba'i rtags can bsnyil bar gsungs so //
translated: If one who has done this wishes to go forth again, one should not give them going forth or full ordination, and it is said that the nature of the vows not arising in such a person is like expelling one who has gone forth.

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen ni khyim pas byed par mi nus pas 'dir sngon rab tu byung ba na zhes smos te /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen ni khyim pas byed par mi nus pas 'dir sngon rab tu byung ba na zhes smos te /
translated: Since a schism of the Saṅgha cannot be done by a layperson, here it says, “If they were previously ordained.”

original: skyes pa rab tu 'byung ba la bar chad 'di dri bar bya'i //
analyzed: skyes pa rab tu 'byung ba la bar chad 'di dri bar bya'i //
translated: This impediment to a man going forth should be asked about.

original: bud med la ni dri mi dgos te /
analyzed: bud med la ni dri mi dgos te /
translated: But it need not be asked of a woman.

original: bud med sngon rab tu byung ba la lan gnyis su rab tu 'byung ba bkag zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bud med sngon rab tu byung ba la lan gnyis su rab tu 'byung ba bkag zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has already been prohibited that a woman who has previously gone forth may go forth a second time.

original: gang zag de bzhin gshegs pa lang na sems kyis khrag phyung ba rab tu dbyung bar mi bya zhing de la sngom pa skye ba'i chos nyid med pa dang / de lta bu rab tu byung ba'i rtags can bsnyil bar bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zag de bzhin gshegs pa lang na sems kyis khrag phyung ba rab tu dbyung bar mi bya zhing de la sngom pa skye ba'i chos nyid med pa dang / de lta bu rab tu byung ba'i rtags can bsnyil bar bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one should not go forth and that the quality of being a monk does not arise in that person who has shed the blood of a Tathagata with evil intent,

original: gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa las ngan sems kyis khrag phyung bde zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa las ngan sems kyis khrag phyung bde zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the Buddha said, “One who has shed the blood of a Tathagata with evil intent...”

original: 'di yang byung ba'i mtha' las bcas pa ni ma yin gyi zhus pa'i skabs nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang byung ba'i mtha' las bcas pa ni ma yin gyi zhus pa'i skabs nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: This was not established in the chapter on origins, but was explained in the chapter on questions.

original: ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba zhes bya ba ni bsad pa'i bsam phas ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba ste /
analyzed: ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba zhes bya ba ni bsad pa'i bsam phas ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba ste /
translated: Shed the blood of a Tathagata with evil intent means to shed the blood of a Tathagata with evil intent through the motivation to kill.

original: 'di ni khyim pas kyang byar rung bas 'dir sngon rab tu byung ba na zhes ma smos te /
analyzed: 'di ni khyim pas kyang byar rung bas 'dir sngon rab tu byung ba na zhes ma smos te /
translated: Since this is also suitable for a layperson, here it does not say, “If he was previously a monk.”

original: skyes pa dang bud med gang gis de byas pa rab tu dbyung bar mi bya rdzogs par bsnyen par mi bya zhing de la sngom pa skye ba'i chos nyid med pa dang / de lta bu rab tu byung ba'i rtags can bsnyil bar gsungs te /
analyzed: skyes pa dang bud med gang gis de byas pa rab tu dbyung bar mi bya rdzogs par bsnyen par mi bya zhing de la sngom pa skye ba'i chos nyid med pa dang / de lta bu rab tu byung ba'i rtags can bsnyil bar gsungs te /
translated: And it is said that such a person who has the signs of going forth should be expelled.

original: 'di ni skyes pa dang bud med gnyis la dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni skyes pa dang bud med gnyis la dri bar bya'o //
translated: This should be asked of both men and women.

original: gang zag pham par gyur pa bzhi las ltung ba gang yang rung ba byung ba rab tu dbyung bar mi bya zhing de la sdom pa skye ba'i chos nyid med pa dang / de lta bu rab tu byung ba'i rtags can bsnyil bar bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zag pham par gyur pa bzhi las ltung ba gang yang rung ba byung ba rab tu dbyung bar mi bya zhing de la sdom pa skye ba'i chos nyid med pa dang / de lta bu rab tu byung ba'i rtags can bsnyil bar bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that a person who has any of the four defeats should not be allowed to go forth, and that it is not the nature of the training to arise in them, and that such a person who has the signs of going forth should be expelled,

original: gang sngon rab tu byung ba na pham par 'gyur ba bzhi las ltung ba gang yang rung ba byung ba de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang sngon rab tu byung ba na pham par 'gyur ba bzhi las ltung ba gang yang rung ba byung ba de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it says, “Whoever, when previously going forth, had any of the four defeats,” and so on.

original: 'di yang byung ba'i mtha' las bcas pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di yang byung ba'i mtha' las bcas pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not a rule that was made at the end of the council,

original: zhus pa'i @307a * //
analyzed: zhus pa'i @307a * //
translated: but was asked about.

original: skabs nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: skabs nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained in the context of the Vinaya.

original: gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba smos pa ni gcig gis kyang skye ba'i chos nyid med pa yin no zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba smos pa ni gcig gis kyang skye ba'i chos nyid med pa yin no zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: The term “any” indicates that even one of these is sufficient to prevent the quality of being a monk.🔽If a monk who has previously gone forth commits a defeating offense and then disrobes, if he later wishes to go forth again, he should not be given the going forth or the ordination. The quality of being a monk does not arise in him.

original: 'di yang skyes pas sngon rab tu byung bas de byas nas babs te yang rab tu 'byung bar 'dod na de rab tu dbyung ba dang / rdzogs par bsnyen par mi bya zhing de la sngom pa skye ba'i chos nyid med pa dang / de lta bu rab tu byung ba'i rtags can bsnyil bar gsungs pas skyes pa rab tu 'byung ba la bar chad 'di 'dri bar bya'i //
analyzed: 'di yang skyes pas sngon rab tu byung bas de byas nas babs te yang rab tu 'byung bar 'dod na de rab tu dbyung ba dang / rdzogs par bsnyen par mi bya zhing de la sngom pa skye ba'i chos nyid med pa dang / de lta bu rab tu byung ba'i rtags can bsnyil bar gsungs pas skyes pa rab tu 'byung ba la bar chad 'di 'dri bar bya'i //
translated: The Buddha has stated that a man who has the signs of having gone forth should not be expelled. Therefore, this question should be asked of a man who is going forth.

original: bud med la ni dri mi dgos te bud med sngon rab tu byung ba lan gnyis su rab tu 'byung ba bkag zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bud med la ni dri mi dgos te bud med sngon rab tu byung ba lan gnyis su rab tu 'byung ba bkag zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not necessary to ask this question of a woman, because a woman who has gone forth previously is not allowed to go forth a second time.

original: bud med pham par 'gyur ba thun mong ma yin pa bzhi las gang yang rung ba byung ba mtshan gyur nas yang rab tu 'byung bar 'dod na de ni sngom pa'i zhing yin pas rab tu dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: bud med pham par 'gyur ba thun mong ma yin pa bzhi las gang yang rung ba byung ba mtshan gyur nas yang rab tu 'byung bar 'dod na de ni sngom pa'i zhing yin pas rab tu dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: If a woman who has committed any of the four defeats unique to women, and who has changed her sex, wishes to go forth, she should be given the full ordination, because she is a suitable vessel for the vows.

original: gang zag rgyu las bzlog pa'i chad pas khas mi len pa dag rab tu dbyung ba dang rdzogs par bsnyen par mi bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zag rgyu las bzlog pa'i chad pas khas mi len pa dag rab tu dbyung ba dang rdzogs par bsnyen par mi bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The following verse was taught to show that one should not give the full ordination to those who are expelled from the order for reasons of state.🔽One should not give the full ordination to a person who has been expelled from the order,

original: gang zag ma mthong ba gnas nas phyung ba babs pa zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang zag ma mthong ba gnas nas phyung ba babs pa zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: who has been gored by an ox, and so on.

original: dge slong ltung ba ma mthong bas gnas nas phyung ba dang phyir mi 'chos pas gnas nas phyung ba dang / sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa mi gtong bas gnas nas phyung ba babs pa zhig rgyu gang gis sngon gnas nas phyung ba'i rgyu de las bzlog pa'i chad pa khas mi len pa yang rab tu 'byung bar 'dod na rab tu dbyung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong ltung ba ma mthong bas gnas nas phyung ba dang phyir mi 'chos pas gnas nas phyung ba dang / sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa mi gtong bas gnas nas phyung ba babs pa zhig rgyu gang gis sngon gnas nas phyung ba'i rgyu de las bzlog pa'i chad pa khas mi len pa yang rab tu 'byung bar 'dod na rab tu dbyung bar mi bya'o //
translated: A monk who has been expelled for not seeing an offense, for not correcting himself after being expelled, or for not giving up a sinful view, should not be allowed to go forth again if he does not accept the punishment that was the cause of his expulsion.

original: khas len na ni rab tu dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: khas len na ni rab tu dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: But if he accepts it, he should be allowed to go forth.

original: rdzogs par bsnyen na bzod par gsol zin pa yin pas yang bzod par gsol mi dgos so //
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen na bzod par gsol zin pa yin pas yang bzod par gsol mi dgos so //
translated: If he is fully ordained, he has already asked for forbearance, so he does not need to ask for it again.

original: gal te rdzogs par bsnyen nas khas mi len pa ni tshogs pa yod na yang chad pas bcad do //
analyzed: gal te rdzogs par bsnyen nas khas mi len pa ni tshogs pa yod na yang chad pas bcad do //
translated: If he is fully ordained but does not accept the punishment, he is still subject to it, even if he is in a group.

original: gal te ma mthong ngo zhes brdzun zer na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ma mthong ngo zhes brdzun zer na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he lies about not seeing it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ma mthong bas gnas nas phyung ba gsum ji lta ba bzhin du nan tur gyi las bsdigs pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ma mthong bas gnas nas phyung ba gsum ji lta ba bzhin du nan tur gyi las bsdigs pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The verse that summarizes the chapter is:🔽The one with a withered hand, the one with a club foot, the one with goiters, the one with scabies, the one with leprosy, the one with mild leprosy, the one with mild scabies, the one with elephantiasis, the one with ring-worm, the one with blisters, the one who is insane, the one who is deranged, the one who speaks falsely, the one who is whipped, the one who is whipped and then released, the one who is expelled for not seeing, and the one who is expelled for not making amends.

original: sngom la / lag rdum dag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar rab tu byung ba'i gzhi'i spyi sdom pa las lag rdum gyi sde tshan yang dag par bsdus pa yin zhes smos pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: sngom la / lag rdum dag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar rab tu byung ba'i gzhi'i spyi sdom pa las lag rdum gyi sde tshan yang dag par bsdus pa yin zhes smos pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The one with a withered hand and so on is included in the section on the one with a withered hand in the general summary of the chapter on going forth.

original: de la gang gi lag pa mkhrig ma phan chad chad pa de dag ni lag rdum dag go //🔽gang dag gi rkang pa long bu man chad chad pa nga dag ni rkang rdum @307b dag go //
analyzed: de la gang gi lag pa mkhrig ma phan chad chad pa de dag ni lag rdum dag go // gang dag gi rkang pa long bu man chad chad pa nga dag ni rkang rdum @307b dag go //
translated: The one with a withered hand is the one whose hand is cut off from the wrist down.🔽The one with a club foot is the one whose foot is cut off from the ankle down.

original: gang dag gi lag pa'i sor mo sbrul gyi gdengs ka 'dra ba de dag ni lag sor zlum por 'jas pa dag go //
analyzed: gang dag gi lag pa'i sor mo sbrul gyi gdengs ka 'dra ba de dag ni lag sor zlum por 'jas pa dag go //
translated: The one with a round hand and foot is the one whose fingers and toes are like a snake’s hood.

original: gang dag gi mchu gnyis med pa de dag ni mchu med dag go //
analyzed: gang dag gi mchu gnyis med pa de dag ni mchu med dag go //
translated: The one without lips is the one who has no upper or lower lips.

original: gang gi lus la rma mtshan dag yod pa de dag ni lus la rma mtshan can dag ste /
analyzed: gang gi lus la rma mtshan dag yod pa de dag ni lus la rma mtshan can dag ste /
translated: Those who have marks on their bodies are called those who have marks on their bodies.

original: snag tsha la sogs pas lag pa la bris pa ni lus la rma mtshan can yin te /
analyzed: snag tsha la sogs pas lag pa la bris pa ni lus la rma mtshan can yin te /
translated: Those who have written on their hands with ink, etc., are those who have marks on their bodies.

original: khab la sogs pas gtsags shing khyi rjes la sogs pa'i mngon mtshan dag gis mtshan btab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khab la sogs pas gtsags shing khyi rjes la sogs pa'i mngon mtshan dag gis mtshan btab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are marked with the signs of a needle, etc., and with the signs of a dog's foot, etc.

original: lcag la sogs pas gzhus pa'i rma mtshan yang yin no //
analyzed: lcag la sogs pas gzhus pa'i rma mtshan yang yin no //
translated: They also have marks of wounds from being whipped with a whip, etc.

original: rgas pas sbyor mi bzod pa dag ni rgan ches pa dag go //
analyzed: rgas pas sbyor mi bzod pa dag ni rgan ches pa dag go //
translated: Those who are too old to be able to engage in sexual union are called those who are too old.

original: lo bco lnga lon pa bya rog skrod mi nus pa dag dang ; bya rog skrod nus pa lo bdun ma lon pa dag ni gzhon ches pa dag go //
analyzed: lo bco lnga lon pa bya rog skrod mi nus pa dag dang ; bya rog skrod nus pa lo bdun ma lon pa dag ni gzhon ches pa dag go //
translated: Those who are too young to be able to drive away crows, and those who are able to drive away crows but are less than seven years old, are called those who are too young.

original: rkang pa 'theng zhing leg leg par 'gro ba ni theng ba'o //
analyzed: rkang pa 'theng zhing leg leg par 'gro ba ni theng ba'o //
translated: Those who walk with a limp and a hobble are called those who are lame.

original: brla'i phyogs rlung bya rgod 'gros kyis kun du nyams par gyur pa ni smad 'chal lo //
analyzed: brla'i phyogs rlung bya rgod 'gros kyis kun du nyams par gyur pa ni smad 'chal lo //
translated: Those whose thighs are completely ruined by the wind called vulture gait are called those with a crippled leg.

original: mig ya gcig pa ni zhar pa'o //
analyzed: mig ya gcig pa ni zhar pa'o //
translated: Those who have only one eye are called those who are one-eyed.

original: gang gi mkhrig ma'i phyogs na mtshan ma tsam gyi lag pa yod cing cung zad kyang byed mi nus pa ni lag sor rdum po'o //
analyzed: gang gi mkhrig ma'i phyogs na mtshan ma tsam gyi lag pa yod cing cung zad kyang byed mi nus pa ni lag sor rdum po'o //
translated: The one who has a hand with only a mark of a hand on the wrist and is not able to do anything is a cripple.

original: brang dang rgal tshigs zhoms pa ni rgur po'o //
analyzed: brang dang rgal tshigs zhoms pa ni rgur po'o //
translated: The one who has a bent chest and spine is a hunchback.

original: ha cang lus chung bar grags pa ni mi'u chung ngo //
analyzed: ha cang lus chung bar grags pa ni mi'u chung ngo //
translated: The one who is known to have a very small body is a dwarf.

original: gang gi lkog ma la lba ba yod pa de ni lba ba can no //
analyzed: gang gi lkog ma la lba ba yod pa de ni lba ba can no //
translated: The one who has a goiter on the throat is a goitered person.

original: smra mi nus pa ni lkugs pa'o //
analyzed: smra mi nus pa ni lkugs pa'o //
translated: The one who is unable to speak is a mute.

original: don dang bcas pa'i sgra thos par mi nus pa ni 'on pa'o ;
analyzed: don dang bcas pa'i sgra thos par mi nus pa ni 'on pa'o ;
translated: The one who is unable to hear meaningful sounds is deaf.

original: / gang lag pa gnyis lag rten la brten nas gzugs bzhis 'phye ba ni rten 'phye'o //
analyzed: / gang lag pa gnyis lag rten la brten nas gzugs bzhis 'phye ba ni rten 'phye'o //
translated: The one who walks with the help of two sticks in the four postures is a cripple.

original: mi gnyis pa ni grum po zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: mi gnyis pa ni grum po zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: The one who is not a man is also called a eunuch.

original: gang gi rkang pa la nad kyi rigs rkang ba ma yod pa de ni rkang ba ma mo //
analyzed: gang gi rkang pa la nad kyi rigs rkang ba ma yod pa de ni rkang ba ma mo //
translated: The one who has a type of disease in the feet called elephantiasis is a leper.

original: bud med dag shas cher bsten pas mthu dang gzi brjid zad cing lus mi bde ba bud med kyis dub pa dag ni bud med kyis dub ma dag go //
analyzed: bud med dag shas cher bsten pas mthu dang gzi brjid zad cing lus mi bde ba bud med kyis dub pa dag ni bud med kyis dub ma dag go //
translated: Those who are exhausted by women, who have lost their strength and splendor by relying too much on women, and whose bodies are unwell, are those exhausted by women.

original: de bzhin du mi bzod pa'i khur thogs pa'i phyir khur gyis dub pa dag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi bzod pa'i khur thogs pa'i phyir khur gyis dub pa dag go //
translated: Likewise, they are exhausted by the burden of intolerance.

original: lam du 'gro ba drags pa'i phyir lam gyis dub ba rnams so //
analyzed: lam du 'gro ba drags pa'i phyir lam gyis dub ba rnams so //
translated: They are exhausted by the path because they travel too far on the path.

original: ya za ma lug ces bya ba ni gang dag la ji ltar zos pa ma zhu bar thur du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ya za ma lug ces bya ba ni gang dag la ji ltar zos pa ma zhu bar thur du 'byung ba'o //
translated: They are called “those with loose bowels” because their food is digested too quickly.

original: gzhan dag ni 'di skad zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'di skad zer te /
translated: Others say:

original: gang gi rkang pa lcags sgrog gis nyams pa lcags sgrog las bkrol yang bcings pa bzhin du 'gro ba ni sgrog bkrol zhes bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gang gi rkang pa lcags sgrog gis nyams pa lcags sgrog las bkrol yang bcings pa bzhin du 'gro ba ni sgrog bkrol zhes bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Those whose legs are fettered by iron chains are called “those whose fetters are removed” even though they are not freed from the chains, because they are freed from the fetters that bind their legs.

original: de la dang po ni kha zas la sogs pa thur du 'dzag pa de ni ya za ma lug go //🔽phyogs phyi ma la ni lcags sgrog gi 'ching ba las @308a * //
analyzed: de la dang po ni kha zas la sogs pa thur du 'dzag pa de ni ya za ma lug go // phyogs phyi ma la ni lcags sgrog gi 'ching ba las @308a * //
translated: In the first case, “those with loose bowels” means that their food and so on is digested too quickly.

original: bkrol bas sgrog bkrol zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bkrol bas sgrog bkrol zhes bya'o //
translated: In the latter case, “those whose fetters are removed” means that they are freed from the fetters that bind their legs.

original: yang na bkrol yang lcags sgrog tu bcug pa bzhin du rkang pa khris khris por 'gro ba'i phyir sgrog bkrol zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na bkrol yang lcags sgrog tu bcug pa bzhin du rkang pa khris khris por 'gro ba'i phyir sgrog bkrol zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, they are called “those whose fetters are removed” because their legs move slowly, as if they were fettered, even though they are freed from the fetters.

original: rta gam pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag lang tsho la ma bab pa kho nar nad la sogs pas de ltar nyams par gyur cing te por rgas pas nyams pa bzhin du bya ba cung zad kyang byed mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: rta gam pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag lang tsho la ma bab pa kho nar nad la sogs pas de ltar nyams par gyur cing te por rgas pas nyams pa bzhin du bya ba cung zad kyang byed mi nus pa ste /
translated: The so-called “castrated” are those who, without having reached the age of puberty, have become impaired by disease, etc., and are thus unable to perform any function, just like those who are old.

original: byung ba nyid nas de dag gi lang tshe nyams par gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byung ba nyid nas de dag gi lang tshe nyams par gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are said to be “impaired from birth.”

original: de lta bu'i zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de lta bu'i'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de lta bu'i'o //
translated: “Such” means of that kind.

original: mi rnams ni zhes bya ba ni lag rdum la sogs pa'i mi rnams so //
analyzed: mi rnams ni zhes bya ba ni lag rdum la sogs pa'i mi rnams so //
translated: “Humans” means human beings.

original: drang srong chen pos zhes bya ba ni de ni drang srong yang yin la chen po yang yin pas drang srong chen po ste des so //
analyzed: drang srong chen pos zhes bya ba ni de ni drang srong yang yin la chen po yang yin pas drang srong chen po ste des so //
translated: “The great sage” is the one who is both a sage and great, and he did this.

original: dgag pa mdzad ces bya ba ni rab tu dbyung ba dang rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i phyir bkag pa'o //
analyzed: dgag pa mdzad ces bya ba ni rab tu dbyung ba dang rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i phyir bkag pa'o //
translated: “He prohibited” means he prohibited going forth and full ordination.

original: 'di dag gis mtshon pa rab tu 'byung ba'i gzhi'i skabs su 'dul ba phran tshegs la sogs pa las skra ser la sogs pa dang ; sen po gcig pa dang / rgyal pos bkrabs pa la sogs pa dang / rgyal pos ma gnang ba yul thag mi ring ba dang /
analyzed: 'di dag gis mtshon pa rab tu 'byung ba'i gzhi'i skabs su 'dul ba phran tshegs la sogs pa las skra ser la sogs pa dang ; sen po gcig pa dang / rgyal pos bkrabs pa la sogs pa dang / rgyal pos ma gnang ba yul thag mi ring ba dang /
translated: These and other faults are illustrated by the Vinaya Ksudraka Collection, which states that those with yellow hair and so on, those with one toenail, those appointed by the king and so on, those not permitted by the king and those not living far away,

original: chom rkun par grags pa dang / phung khrol ba dang / lham mkhan dang / gdol ba dang / g-yung po la sogs pa dang mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan pa dang / mtshan lan gsum gyur pa dang /
analyzed: chom rkun par grags pa dang / phung khrol ba dang / lham mkhan dang / gdol ba dang / g-yung po la sogs pa dang mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan pa dang / mtshan lan gsum gyur pa dang /
translated: those renowned as thieves, those who are corrupt, cobblers, untouchables, eunuchs and so on, those of nonhuman birth, those of Kuru in the north and those with three sexual organs,

original: skyes pa 'dra ba'i bud med dang / bud med 'dra ba'i skyes pa dang / sdig sdig lta bu'i mtshan nyid dang / gling gzhan nas skyes pa tshul byed mi 'dra ba la sogs pa rigs dang lus la skyon chags pa dag ni rab tu dbyung bar yang mi bya la /
analyzed: skyes pa 'dra ba'i bud med dang / bud med 'dra ba'i skyes pa dang / sdig sdig lta bu'i mtshan nyid dang / gling gzhan nas skyes pa tshul byed mi 'dra ba la sogs pa rigs dang lus la skyon chags pa dag ni rab tu dbyung bar yang mi bya la /
translated: those who are female but resemble males, those who are male but resemble females, those with characteristics resembling those of sinners, those born in other continents who pretend to be of other races and so on, those with faults in their lineage and body should not be fully ordained.

original: rab tu byung na yang nye bar gzhag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung na yang nye bar gzhag par mi bya'o //
translated: Even if they are ordained, they should not be admitted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽mdzes pa rab tu dbyung ba dang // yongs su dag pa rdzogs pa bsnyen par //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / mdzes pa rab tu dbyung ba dang // yongs su dag pa rdzogs pa bsnyen par //
translated: Why is that?🔽The perfect Buddha knows well🔽the admission of the beautiful,🔽the complete admission of the pure,

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas kyis rab mkhyen te //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas kyis rab mkhyen te //
translated: and the admission of those with faults.🔽He has declared the truth

original: bden pa'i mtshan gyis bka' stsal to //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bden pa'i mtshan gyis bka' stsal to // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: by the truth of his words.🔽This is the section on those to be admitted.

original: bsdu bar bya ba'i skabs so zhes bya ba ni rigs dang lus la skyon chags pa ma yin pa rab tu dbyung bar bya ba'i skabs te /
analyzed: bsdu bar bya ba'i skabs so zhes bya ba ni rigs dang lus la skyon chags pa ma yin pa rab tu dbyung bar bya ba'i skabs te /
translated: Those with faults in their lineage or body should not be admitted.

original: rigs la skyon chags pa ni lham mkhan dang / gdol pa dang / g-yung po'i rigs so //
analyzed: rigs la skyon chags pa ni lham mkhan dang / gdol pa dang / g-yung po'i rigs so //
translated: Those with faults in their lineage are those of the cobbler, caṇḍāla, or putravella lineages.

original: lus la skyon chags pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: lus la skyon chags pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those with faults in their body are of two types:

original: dbyibs las dang / kha dog las so //
analyzed: dbyibs las dang / kha dog las so //
translated: those with faults in their shape and those with faults in their color.

original: de la dbyibs las skyon chags pa ni lag rdum la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la dbyibs las skyon chags pa ni lag rdum la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those with faults in their shape are those with crippled hands and so on.

original: kha dog las skyon @308b chags pa ni lus rma mtshan can la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog las skyon @308b chags pa ni lus rma mtshan can la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those with faults in their color are those with leprosy and so on.

original: rab tu 'byung ba'i gzhi rgya cher 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rab tu 'byung ba'i gzhi rgya cher 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: The Extensive Explanation of the Foundation for the Novitiate is completed.

original: // / de ltar rab tu 'byung ba'i gzhi rgya cher bshad nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar rab tu 'byung ba'i gzhi rgya cher bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the foundation for the novitiate in an extensive way,

original: da ni gso sbyong gi gzhi bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni gso sbyong gi gzhi bshad par bya'o //
translated: now the foundation for the purification and restoration of the vows will be explained.

original: de'i phyir gso sbyong gi gzhi'i spyi sdom la zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gso sbyong gi gzhi'i spyi sdom la zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The general summary of the foundation for the purification and restoration of the vows.”

original: 'dis ni gso sbyong gi gzhi thams cad sdud par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni gso sbyong gi gzhi thams cad sdud par byed do //
translated: This includes all the foundations for the purification and restoration of the vows.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gso sbyong ni rnam pa gnyis su gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gso sbyong ni rnam pa gnyis su gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One taught the purification and restoration of the vows in two ways:

original: zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong dang / mthun pa'i gso sbyong ngo //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong dang / mthun pa'i gso sbyong ngo //
translated: the purification and restoration of the vows for tranquility and the purification and restoration of the vows for concord.

original: de la gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang / brjod par bya ba nyung ba'i phyir je dang por zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong rnam par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang / brjod par bya ba nyung ba'i phyir je dang por zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong rnam par bshad par bya'o //
translated: Among those, because it is the main one and because there is less to be said, first the purification and restoration of the vows for tranquility will be explained.🔽Therefore, it is said,

original: de'i phyir sdom pa ;
analyzed: de'i phyir sdom pa ;
translated: “The summary.”

original: mu stegs can dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mu stegs can dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “The tīrthikas” and so forth.

original: 'di ni gso sbyong gi gzhi'i spyi sdom las mu stegs can dang zhes sngar smos pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni gso sbyong gi gzhi'i spyi sdom las mu stegs can dang zhes sngar smos pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa yin par sbyar ro //
translated: This is the verse of summary that was mentioned earlier in the chapter on the basis of the poṣadha, beginning with “tīrthikas.🔽”

original: nang par nang par zhing zhes bya ba ni nyi ma re re zhing ngam nang par sngar ro //🔽lta dang bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: nang par nang par zhing zhes bya ba ni nyi ma re re zhing ngam nang par sngar ro // lta dang bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir //
translated: “Every day” means every day, or in the morning.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyag bya ba dang / de'i lung rjes su bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyag bya ba dang / de'i lung rjes su bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “In order to see and honor” means in order to bow down to them and to practice their scriptures.

original: yid du 'thad pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi dus thams cad du yon tan dag yang dag par rjes su dran par bya'o //
analyzed: yid du 'thad pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi dus thams cad du yon tan dag yang dag par rjes su dran par bya'o //
translated: “What is pleasing” means that one should recollect their good qualities at all times.

original: kun dga' ra ba zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can dag gi 'dug gnas so //
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can dag gi 'dug gnas so //
translated: “Monastery” means the dwelling place of the tīrthikas.

original: 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni rkub tshos bzhag nas rnal 'byor la 'dug ste rkub chos bzhag ste 'dug pas ting nge 'dzin sgom par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni rkub tshos bzhag nas rnal 'byor la 'dug ste rkub chos bzhag ste 'dug pas ting nge 'dzin sgom par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Sitting” means sitting down on one’s haunches, practicing yoga, and cultivating samādhi by sitting down on one’s haunches.

original: bya ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun tshogs pa'i gsol ba dang / gsol ba dang gnyis dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las dang dge ba'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: bya ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun tshogs pa'i gsol ba dang / gsol ba dang gnyis dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las dang dge ba'i bya ba'o //
translated: Action means the virtuous actions of the Saṅgha, such as the four types of legal procedures: the one-person procedure, the two-person procedure, the many-person procedure, and the legal procedure consisting of a motion.

original: gso sbyong zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa dang // mu stegs can gyi gso sbyong ngo //
analyzed: gso sbyong zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa dang // mu stegs can gyi gso sbyong ngo //
translated: Poṣadha means the recitation of the Prātimokṣa Sūtra and the non-Buddhist poṣadha.

original: yod ces bya ba ni byed pa'o //
analyzed: yod ces bya ba ni byed pa'o //
translated: Existence means performance.

original: mngon par bstod par yang mi byed ces bya ba ni bsngags pa brjod par yang mi byed pa ste skyon chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par bstod par yang mi byed ces bya ba ni bsngags pa brjod par yang mi byed pa ste skyon chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should not praise means one should not speak praise, because of having faults.

original: phyir mi bzlog par yang mi byed ces bya ba ni phyir 'gog par yang mi byed pa ste dbye ba ma yin par nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir mi bzlog par yang mi byed ces bya ba ni phyir 'gog par yang mi byed pa ste dbye ba ma yin par nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should not oppose means one should not oppose, because of not being certain about the division.

original: bdag cag la yang zhes bya ba ni bstan pa la ste /
analyzed: bdag cag la yang zhes bya ba ni bstan pa la ste /
translated: For us too means for the teaching.

original: dge slong la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge slong la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: For the monk is the meaning.

original: bca' bar gsol zhes bya ba ni rnam par gzhag par gsol ba'o //
analyzed: bca' bar gsol zhes bya ba ni rnam par gzhag par gsol ba'o //
translated: To request means to request the establishment.

original: tron bya bar zhes bya ba ni rjes su bsgrub par ro //
analyzed: tron bya bar zhes bya ba ni rjes su bsgrub par ro //
translated: The word should means should practice.

original: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin te lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'o //🔽rkang @309a * //🔽pa'i mthil yan chad ces bya ba ni rkang mthil gnyis yan chad nas so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin te lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'o // rkang @309a * // pa'i mthil yan chad ces bya ba ni rkang mthil gnyis yan chad nas so //
translated: The word yoga means meditative concentration, such as the applications of mindfulness to the body.🔽The word limbs means the parts of the body.🔽The word from means from the soles of the feet up to the crown of the head.

original: glad pa'i skra man chad ces bya ba ni skras mchon pa'i glad pa man chad do //
analyzed: glad pa'i skra man chad ces bya ba ni skras mchon pa'i glad pa man chad do //
translated: The word to means up to the hair and nails.

original: pags pa la thug pa'i zhes bya ba ni pags pa'i mthi'i'o //
analyzed: pags pa la thug pa'i zhes bya ba ni pags pa'i mthi'i'o //
translated: The word skin means the surface of the skin.

original: bar du zhes bya ba ni chu zheng gnyis kar ro //
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba ni chu zheng gnyis kar ro //
translated: The word in between means in all directions.

original: ji ltar gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rtag tu mi gtsang ba'i gzhi nyid du rnam par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rtag tu mi gtsang ba'i gzhi nyid du rnam par gnas pa'o //
translated: The word as it is placed means as it is always placed as the basis of impurity.

original: ji ltar byas pa zhes bya ba ni zas dang skom gyis glo bur du mi gtsang ba bsags pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar byas pa zhes bya ba ni zas dang skom gyis glo bur du mi gtsang ba bsags pa'o //
translated: The word as it is made means as it is temporarily filled with impurity by food and drink.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir lus 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir lus 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, In this body there is...

original: de dag ni nang gi so so'i bdag nyid la chags pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / rang gi lus kyi skyon la so sor brtag pa'i phyir dang por bstan to //
analyzed: de dag ni nang gi so so'i bdag nyid la chags pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / rang gi lus kyi skyon la so sor brtag pa'i phyir dang por bstan to //
translated: They are taught first because they are the basis for attachment to one's own self, and because one should examine the faults of one's own body.

original: spyod yul du zhugs na yang zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms la 'gro ba na yang ngo //
analyzed: spyod yul du zhugs na yang zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms la 'gro ba na yang ngo //
translated: Even when engaged in the range of activity means even when going for alms.

original: 'khrul pa zhes bya ba ni shugs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa zhes bya ba ni shugs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Errant means having momentum.

original: lhan cig phrad ces bya ba ni 'dom pa'am thug pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig phrad ces bya ba ni 'dom pa'am thug pa'o //
translated: Meeting means encountering or colliding.

original: 'gyel zhes bya ba ni lus thams cad 'gyel pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyel zhes bya ba ni lus thams cad 'gyel pa'o //
translated: Falling means falling with the whole body.

original: bub ces bya ba ni lus phyed bub pa'o //🔽spyod yul du zhugs pas rnal 'byor bsgom par mi bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni goms par byed pa bkag pa yin gyi gdul ba'i don du rdzu 'phrul rnam par 'phrul pa la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir sems rtse gcig pa nyid mngon du bya ba ni bkag
analyzed: bub ces bya ba ni lus phyed bub pa'o // spyod yul du zhugs pas rnal 'byor bsgom par mi bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni goms par byed pa bkag pa yin gyi gdul ba'i don du rdzu 'phrul rnam par 'phrul pa la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir sems rtse gcig pa nyid mngon du bya ba ni bkag
translated: Sliding means sliding with half the body.

original: pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pa ma yin te /
translated: This statement, One should not cultivate yoga when engaged in the range of activity, prohibits the practice of yoga, but not the cultivation of one-pointedness of mind in order to demonstrate miracles, magical emanations, etc., for the sake of disciples.

original: de la skyon chags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la skyon chags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no fault in that.

original: sgo gang dang khyams su bsgom par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'du ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: sgo gang dang khyams su bsgom par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'du ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir bkag pa yin te /
translated: One should not meditate in a doorway or courtyard. This is prohibited because these are places for gathering.

original: sgo bcad na ni sgo gang dang khyams su mngon par 'du ba nyid rgyun chad par 'gyur bas der rnal 'byor bsgom pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sgo bcad na ni sgo gang dang khyams su mngon par 'du ba nyid rgyun chad par 'gyur bas der rnal 'byor bsgom pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: However, there is no fault in meditating there, since the gathering in the doorway and courtyard is interrupted when the door is closed.

original: gnas khang ni rnam par g-yeng ba yin la /
analyzed: gnas khang ni rnam par g-yeng ba yin la /
translated: A house is a distraction.

original: dgon pa ni gtum po'i gnas yin pa dang / grong dang nye ba ni gya tshom pa dag gi gnas yin pas de dag tu bsgom pa dgag pa mdzad do //
analyzed: dgon pa ni gtum po'i gnas yin pa dang / grong dang nye ba ni gya tshom pa dag gi gnas yin pas de dag tu bsgom pa dgag pa mdzad do //
translated: A forest is a place for fierce people. A village is a place for the frivolous. Therefore, meditation in these places is prohibited.

original: yal ga zhes bya ba ni shing ljon pa'i mgo lcogs so //
analyzed: yal ga zhes bya ba ni shing ljon pa'i mgo lcogs so //
translated: A branch is the top of a tree.

original: seg ces bya ba ni smyig ma la sogs pa'i thags mgru bzhi'o //
analyzed: seg ces bya ba ni smyig ma la sogs pa'i thags mgru bzhi'o //
translated: A weaving shed is a place with four corners for weaving bamboo and so on.

original: re lde zhes bya ba ni de nyid khrun ring po'o //
analyzed: re lde zhes bya ba ni de nyid khrun ring po'o //
translated: A fence is a long weaving shed.

original: ma tu lung ga zhes bya ba ni khang lung ngo //
analyzed: ma tu lung ga zhes bya ba ni khang lung ngo //
translated: A cave is a hollow in a tree.

original: spong khang zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan sgom pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: spong khang zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan sgom pa'i gnas so //
translated: A hut is a place for practicing concentration.

original: khang pa gnyis kyi bar du srang btod pa zhes bya ba ni ngos ya gcig tu yang gnas khang gcig brtsigs shing bar du khyams rgyud mo'i spang @309b btod pa'o //🔽gnas khang bcu'am bcu gnyis kyi srang btod pa zhes bya ba ni ngos ya gcig tu yang gnas khang lnga brtsigs ya ngos ya gcig tu yang gnas khang lngar brtsigs shing bar du mtshams rgyud mo'i srang btod pa dang / ngos ya gcig tu gnas khang drug brtsigs la /
analyzed: khang pa gnyis kyi bar du srang btod pa zhes bya ba ni ngos ya gcig tu yang gnas khang gcig brtsigs shing bar du khyams rgyud mo'i spang @309b btod pa'o // gnas khang bcu'am bcu gnyis kyi srang btod pa zhes bya ba ni ngos ya gcig tu yang gnas khang lnga brtsigs ya ngos ya gcig tu yang gnas khang lngar brtsigs shing bar du mtshams rgyud mo'i srang btod pa dang / ngos ya gcig tu gnas khang drug brtsigs la /
translated: The one with a street between two houses is one where a house is built on one side and a courtyard is built between them.

original: ngos ya gcig tu yang gnas khang drug brtsigs shing bar du 'khyams rgyud mo'i srang btod pa ste /
analyzed: ngos ya gcig tu yang gnas khang drug brtsigs shing bar du 'khyams rgyud mo'i srang btod pa ste /
translated: The one with a street between ten or twelve houses is one where five houses are built on one side, five on the other side, and a courtyard is built between them, or where six houses are built on one side and six on the other side, and a courtyard is built between them.

original: gnyis pa ni chung tshad do //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni chung tshad do //
translated: The second is the small size.

original: bzhi pa yan chad bcu pa man chad ni 'bring tshad do //
analyzed: bzhi pa yan chad bcu pa man chad ni 'bring tshad do //
translated: The fourth up to the tenth is the medium size.

original: bcu gnyis pa ni che tshad do //
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa ni che tshad do //
translated: The twelfth is the large size.

original: sbyang zhes bya ba ni 'bru la sogs pa'i sgo dang skar khung med pa'o //
analyzed: sbyang zhes bya ba ni 'bru la sogs pa'i sgo dang skar khung med pa'o //
translated: The one called “unheated” is one without doors or windows for grain and so on.

original: sgo glegs zhes bya ba ni spang leb ces bya ba'i shing ste /
analyzed: sgo glegs zhes bya ba ni spang leb ces bya ba'i shing ste /
translated: The door-bolt is a piece of wood called a “threshold.”

original: des sgo dang skar khung gcod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: des sgo dang skar khung gcod par byed pa'o //
translated: It is used to close doors and windows.

original: lag gzungs zhes bya ba ni sgo glegs nang du 'dren pa lcags las byas pa'o //
analyzed: lag gzungs zhes bya ba ni sgo glegs nang du 'dren pa lcags las byas pa'o //
translated: The door-bolt-receiver is an iron piece used to hold the door-bolt inside.

original: ras ma zhes bya ba ni gos kyi dum bu'o //
analyzed: ras ma zhes bya ba ni gos kyi dum bu'o //
translated: The cloth is a piece of cloth.

original: gong du sum cha bor ba zhes bya ba ni rtsig ngos kyi gong gi cha sum cha bor zhing 'og tu sum gnyis lus pa'i phyogs su'o //
analyzed: gong du sum cha bor ba zhes bya ba ni rtsig ngos kyi gong gi cha sum cha bor zhing 'og tu sum gnyis lus pa'i phyogs su'o //
translated: “Having left one-third of the wall above” means that one-third of the wall above is left, and two-thirds below.

original: rgya mtsho'i rnam pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni dbyibs rgya mtsho'i rnam pa 'dra ba ste byin gyis yangs pa'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i rnam pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni dbyibs rgya mtsho'i rnam pa 'dra ba ste byin gyis yangs pa'o //
translated: “Like the shape of the ocean” means that the shape is like the ocean, with a wide base.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir phyi rub la nang yangs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir phyi rub la nang yangs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it says “narrow outside, wide inside.”

original: de'i phyi rol gyi kha zhum la nang logs yangs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol gyi kha zhum la nang logs yangs pa'o //
translated: The outside is narrow, and the inside is wide.

original: skar khung dra ba can zhes bya ba ni bya rgya can no //
analyzed: skar khung dra ba can zhes bya ba ni bya rgya can no //
translated: The window-lattice is a net.

original: tre ma bu gzhes bya ba ni srog chags kyi bye brag phra mo zhig go //
analyzed: tre ma bu gzhes bya ba ni srog chags kyi bye brag phra mo zhig go //
translated: Tremabu means a certain kind of small animal.

original: tre la ta zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rigs chen po'o //
analyzed: tre la ta zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rigs chen po'o //
translated: Trelaṭa means a large species of that animal.

original: sgo glegs zhes bya ba ni skar khung gcod pa'i spang leb bo //
analyzed: sgo glegs zhes bya ba ni skar khung gcod pa'i spang leb bo //
translated: A door-bolt is a wooden bar that closes off a window.

original: 'phred gtan zhes bya ba ni sgo bcad pa'i sgo gtan gyi shing ring po 'phred du bsnyal te pha tog tshu tog rtsig pa'i sbubs su gzhug pa ste /
analyzed: 'phred gtan zhes bya ba ni sgo bcad pa'i sgo gtan gyi shing ring po 'phred du bsnyal te pha tog tshu tog rtsig pa'i sbubs su gzhug pa ste /
translated: A crossbar is a long piece of wood that is laid across the door when it is closed, and is inserted into sockets in the door frame.

original: sgo gtan zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: sgo gtan zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: It is also called a door-bolt.

original: gnam gzer zhes bya ba ni sgo'i ya phugs dang 'brel pa gzer bu la sogs pa ste rnam gtan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnam gzer zhes bya ba ni sgo'i ya phugs dang 'brel pa gzer bu la sogs pa ste rnam gtan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: A door-hinge is a pin and so forth that connects the door to the door frame. It is synonymous with the word “hinge.”

original: 'khor gtan zhes bya ba ni sgo glegs bcad pa'i thabs su gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: 'khor gtan zhes bya ba ni sgo glegs bcad pa'i thabs su gyur pa yin te /
translated: A door-pivot is a device that is used to close a door.

original: sgo glegs kyi dkyil gyi phyogs su shing gi gtan bu khru gang gi tshad tsam gdags shing sgo skyes la de'i gzungs lcags kyu'am bu gu btod do //
analyzed: sgo glegs kyi dkyil gyi phyogs su shing gi gtan bu khru gang gi tshad tsam gdags shing sgo skyes la de'i gzungs lcags kyu'am bu gu btod do //
translated: A wooden bolt one cubit long is inserted into the center of the door, and a hook or a pin is attached to the door-jamb.

original: gtan bu de 'khor lo bzhin du bskor nas gzungs der gzhug par bya ste /
analyzed: gtan bu de 'khor lo bzhin du bskor nas gzungs der gzhug par bya ste /
translated: The hole is turned like a wheel and the container is inserted into it.

original: des na 'khor gtan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na 'khor gtan zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called a revolving container.

original: dbyug gu skam kha zhes bya ba ni dbyug gu ra rkang 'dra ba kha brag ste des skar khung 'phred gtan 'dzud pa dang 'byin par @310a * //
analyzed: dbyug gu skam kha zhes bya ba ni dbyug gu ra rkang 'dra ba kha brag ste des skar khung 'phred gtan 'dzud pa dang 'byin par @310a * //
translated: A dry bamboo stick is a bamboo stick that is split at one end. It is used to insert and remove a crossbar in a window.

original: byed do // sa'i stegs bu dag bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dug par bya ba'i ched dus las byas pa'i stegs bu dag bya ba'o //
analyzed: byed do // sa'i stegs bu dag bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dug par bya ba'i ched dus las byas pa'i stegs bu dag bya ba'o //
translated: One should make platforms on the ground means one should make platforms that are made of wood for the purpose of sitting on them.

original: mkhrang bar gyur nas zhes bya ba ni 'og nas sra bar gyur nas so //
analyzed: mkhrang bar gyur nas zhes bya ba ni 'og nas sra bar gyur nas so //
translated: When it has become hard means when it has become solid below.

original: khri'u bya'o zhes bya ba ni yang 'dug par bya ba'i ched du'o //
analyzed: khri'u bya'o zhes bya ba ni yang 'dug par bya ba'i ched du'o //
translated: One should make a bench means again for the purpose of sitting on it.

original: kho ra khor yug tu khru bzhis 'khor ba zhes bya ba ni khri'u gru bzhi ngos re la khru re'i tshad du bya ba'o //
analyzed: kho ra khor yug tu khru bzhis 'khor ba zhes bya ba ni khri'u gru bzhi ngos re la khru re'i tshad du bya ba'o //
translated: It is surrounded on all sides by four cubits means the four sides of the bench are one cubit each.

original: de thags mas bla bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni khri'u de ni steng thags mas dra bar bla bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de thags mas bla bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni khri'u de ni steng thags mas dra bar bla bar bya ba'o //
translated: It is covered with a net on top means that bench is covered with a net on top.

original: thags rgyu rung bar grags pa lda bsten pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thags rgyu rung bar grags pa lda bsten pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to make a suitable cloth for the mat,

original: mun dza'i dang / sha na'i dang / gres ma'i dang / ras ma'i dang / pa phra mo'i 'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mun dza'i dang / sha na'i dang / gres ma'i dang / ras ma'i dang / pa phra mo'i 'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he said, “a cloth of silk, cotton, wool, linen, or coarse wool.”

original: 'di dag gis thag bu la sogs pa bkag pa ni ma yin par shes par bya'o //🔽der stan nang tshangs can dag gding bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni khri'u de'i steng du ras ba la la sogs pa brdzangs pa'i stan nang tshangs can dag gding bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gis thag bu la sogs pa bkag pa ni ma yin par shes par bya'o // der stan nang tshangs can dag gding bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni khri'u de'i steng du ras ba la la sogs pa brdzangs pa'i stan nang tshangs can dag gding bar bya ba'o //
translated: It should be understood that these do not prohibit mats made of straw and so forth.🔽“One should spread a mat with a fringe” means that one should spread a mat with a fringe made of cloth and so forth on top of that bench.

original: srid du khru bzhi pa zheng du khru do yod pa gnyis bltab tu byas te drub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni stan nang tshangs can gyi rgyu de rked bltab tu byas na gru bzhi'i ngos re la khru do do yod par bya zhing de khri'u gru bzhi
analyzed: srid du khru bzhi pa zheng du khru do yod pa gnyis bltab tu byas te drub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni stan nang tshangs can gyi rgyu de rked bltab tu byas na gru bzhi'i ngos re la khru do do yod par bya zhing de khri'u gru bzhi
translated: “Two cubits long and one cubit wide, folded in half and sewn” means that if the material for the mat is folded in half, each of the four sides of the square should be one cubit. That mat should be folded in half and sewn.

original: ngos ri la khru re yod pa'i steng du bting na kho ra khor yug tu mtho re lhag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngos ri la khru re yod pa'i steng du bting na kho ra khor yug tu mtho re lhag par bya ba'o //
translated: If it is spread on a mountain one cubit high, it will be one cubit higher all around.

original: de'i nang du shing bal gyis dgong bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni stan nang tshangs can de'i nang du'o //
analyzed: de'i nang du shing bal gyis dgong bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni stan nang tshangs can de'i nang du'o //
translated: It should be filled with cotton wool inside that,🔽There are five kinds of cotton wool,

original: shing bal dag ni lnga ste zhes bya ba ni grags pa bsten pa'i phyir de dag smos par zad kyi grangs de dag tu chad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shing bal dag ni lnga ste zhes bya ba ni grags pa bsten pa'i phyir de dag smos par zad kyi grangs de dag tu chad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: he mentions them just to rely on what is well known, but they are not limited to those numbers.

original: des ni shing ba la gzhan dag gis bkang na yang rung ba kho na'o //🔽mdo mdor srubs bya rog rkang gis gzungs gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba de dag ni shing bal de dag phyogs gcig tu mi 'chug cing stan nang tshangs can gyi phyogs thams cad du snyoms par bya ba'i phyir steng gi mdo mdor sbubs bya rog gi rkang pa
analyzed: des ni shing ba la gzhan dag gis bkang na yang rung ba kho na'o // mdo mdor srubs bya rog rkang gis gzungs gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba de dag ni shing bal de dag phyogs gcig tu mi 'chug cing stan nang tshangs can gyi phyogs thams cad du snyoms par bya ba'i phyir steng gi mdo mdor sbubs bya rog gi rkang pa
translated: It is suitable to fill it with other cotton wool as well.🔽Here and there, a crow's foot should be inserted,🔽Those are for preventing those cotton wool from bunching up in one place and for making the cushion even in all directions.

original: 'dra ba dag gis gzungs gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dra ba dag gis gzungs gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that crow's foot-like holes should be made here and there on the top.

original: gdos bu zhes bya ba ni gnyid sel bar byed pa shing la sogs pa las byas pa'i gdos bu'o //
analyzed: gdos bu zhes bya ba ni gnyid sel bar byed pa shing la sogs pa las byas pa'i gdos bu'o //
translated: A pillow is a pillow made of wood, etc., for removing sleepiness.

original: dbyug gus gzugs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spong ba pa yur na spong ba'i zhal ta bas dbyug gus gzugs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbyug gus gzugs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spong ba pa yur na spong ba'i zhal ta bas dbyug gus gzugs par bya ba'o //
translated: One should be massaged with a stick means that when a monk is sick, a novice should massage him with a stick.

original: smyug gu'i bcad 'phro lta bu zhes bya ba ni bsegs bcad pa'o //
analyzed: smyug gu'i bcad 'phro lta bu zhes bya ba ni bsegs bcad pa'o //
translated: Like the cut of a bamboo means like a diagonal cut.

original: bre'i bcad 'phro lta bu zhes bya ba ni bre zhes bya ba gzhal snod kyi rnam pa de'i zhabs ltar mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: bre'i bcad 'phro lta bu zhes bya ba ni bre zhes bya ba gzhal snod kyi rnam pa de'i zhabs ltar mnyam pa'o //
translated: Like the cut of a winnowing basket means like the base of a winnowing basket, which is a type of measuring vessel.

original: ras ma dag gis dkris nas zhes bya ba ni @310b bre'i bcad 'phro ltar byas pa de yang ras ma dag gis dkri bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: ras ma dag gis dkris nas zhes bya ba ni @310b bre'i bcad 'phro ltar byas pa de yang ras ma dag gis dkri bar bya ba'o //
translated: Having wrapped it with strips of cloth means that having made it like the cut of a winnowing basket, it should be wrapped with strips of cloth.

original: dal bus khad kyis gzugs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ci nas kyang de'i sems gnas pa nyid 'drogs par mi 'gyur ba de ltar dal bus gzugs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dal bus khad kyis gzugs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ci nas kyang de'i sems gnas pa nyid 'drogs par mi 'gyur ba de ltar dal bus gzugs par bya ba'o //
translated: One should massage it slowly and gradually means that one should massage it slowly and gradually so that the mind of the sick person does not become agitated.

original: pho long 'phang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni spong ba pa yur ba las spong ba pa'i zhal ta bas pho long zhes bya ba skud pa la sogs pa'i tshogs zlum po 'phang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: pho long 'phang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni spong ba pa yur ba las spong ba pa'i zhal ta bas pho long zhes bya ba skud pa la sogs pa'i tshogs zlum po 'phang bar bya ba'o //
translated: The ball is a round mass of thread, etc., which is thrown by the caretaker of the monastery, who is a monk, when he sees a monk who is a wanderer.

original: 'khyams nas zhes bya ba ni mi snang nas so //🔽thag gus btags te 'phang bar bya zhing de nas yang phyir drang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni spong ba'i zhal ta bas pho long de yang phyir drang bar bya ba'i phyir thag gu phra mo ring pos btags te 'phang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'khyams nas zhes bya ba ni mi snang nas so // thag gus btags te 'phang bar bya zhing de nas yang phyir drang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni spong ba'i zhal ta bas pho long de yang phyir drang bar bya ba'i phyir thag gu phra mo ring pos btags te 'phang bar bya ba'o //
translated: The wandering monk is one who is not visible.🔽The ball is thrown by the caretaker of the monastery, who is a monk, with a long, thin thread, so that the wandering monk can pull it back.

original: mdun du mar me gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'on kyang yur na spong ba'i zhal ta bas de'i mdun du mar me gzhag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mdun du mar me gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'on kyang yur na spong ba'i zhal ta bas de'i mdun du mar me gzhag par bya ba'o //
translated: A lamp should be placed in front of him means that the caretaker of the monastery should place a lamp in front of the wandering monk.

original: rkang pa gcig brkyang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'on kyang gnyid ma sangs na rkang pa ya gcig kyang brkyang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la 'on kyang gnyid ma sangs na'o//
analyzed: rkang pa gcig brkyang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'on kyang gnyid ma sangs na rkang pa ya gcig kyang brkyang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la 'on kyang gnyid ma sangs na'o//
translated: “One should stretch out one foot” means that if one still does not wake up, one should stretch out the other foot.

original: langs te bcag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'on kyang gnyid ma sangs na langs te 'chag sar phan tshun bcag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: langs te bcag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'on kyang gnyid ma sangs na langs te 'chag sar phan tshun bcag par bya ba'o //
translated: “One should get up and walk around” means that if one still does not wake up, one should get up and walk around in the place where one is staying.

original: 'tham nas zhes bya ba ni dge slong spong ba pa mun khung na 'chag pa lam mi rtsol zhing 'tham na'o //🔽phreng thag la 'ju bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'chags mgo mjug slebs pa'i phreng thag thang chad bar tu brgyangs pa de lta bu la lag pas 'ju zhing bcag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'tham nas zhes bya ba ni dge slong spong ba pa mun khung na 'chag pa lam mi rtsol zhing 'tham na'o // phreng thag la 'ju bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'chags mgo mjug slebs pa'i phreng thag thang chad bar tu brgyangs pa de lta bu la lag pas 'ju zhing bcag par bya ba'o //
translated: “One should hold on to something” means that if one is a monk who practices meditation and is walking in the dark, one should hold on to something in order to avoid stumbling.🔽“One should hold on to a rope” means that if one is tired from walking back and forth on a rope that has been stretched out, one should hold on to it with one’s hand and walk around.

original: lag pas chang brgyud byed nas zhes bya ba ni phreng thag la chang bas mkhyud de brgyud cing 'chag pa na chang la nod nas so //
analyzed: lag pas chang brgyud byed nas zhes bya ba ni phreng thag la chang bas mkhyud de brgyud cing 'chag pa na chang la nod nas so //
translated: “One should hold on to a bamboo pole” means that if one is tired from walking back and forth on a bamboo pole that has been stretched out, one should hold on to it with one’s hand and walk around.

original: sbu bu bskon la skud pas btags pa la 'jus ste gdags par bya ba'i zhes bya ba ni phreng thag la sbu bu bskon pa la thag gus btags pa la 'jus te bcag par bya'o //
analyzed: sbu bu bskon la skud pas btags pa la 'jus ste gdags par bya ba'i zhes bya ba ni phreng thag la sbu bu bskon pa la thag gus btags pa la 'jus te bcag par bya'o //
translated: One should break wind while holding a tube and grasping a thread attached to it means that one should break wind while holding a tube and grasping a thread attached to it.

original: mchil lham can gyis bcag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni mchil lham dang bcas par bcag par byed pa na sgra 'byung bas spong ba gzhan la gnod pa dang ma gus pa'i tshul yin pas dgag pa mdzad de //
analyzed: mchil lham can gyis bcag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni mchil lham dang bcas par bcag par byed pa na sgra 'byung bas spong ba gzhan la gnod pa dang ma gus pa'i tshul yin pas dgag pa mdzad de //
translated: One should not break wind while wearing sandals means that when one breaks wind while wearing sandals, a sound occurs, and it is disrespectful to others and harmful, so it is prohibited.

original: 'di ni spong ba pa nyi tsher ma zad kyi gzhan thams cad kyis kyang mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni spong ba pa nyi tsher ma zad kyi gzhan thams cad kyis kyang mi bya'o //
translated: This is not only a partial prohibition, but it is also prohibited by all others.

original: rdul gyi rkang pa ma rung nas zhes bya ba ni 'chag pa'i tshe rkang pa gnyis la rdul gos shing rkang pa rdul can gyis skyil mo krung bcas pa na gos ma rung bar gyur nas so //
analyzed: rdul gyi rkang pa ma rung nas zhes bya ba ni 'chag pa'i tshe rkang pa gnyis la rdul gos shing rkang pa rdul can gyis skyil mo krung bcas pa na gos ma rung bar gyur nas so //
translated: If the feet are dirty means that when one walks, dust sticks to both feet, and when one sits cross-legged with dusty feet, the robes become soiled.

original: par tang gding bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'chag sar thags ma khra bo gding bar bya ba @311a * //
analyzed: par tang gding bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'chag sar thags ma khra bo gding bar bya ba @311a * //
translated: One should spread a partaṇḍa means that one should spread a variegated cloth on the walking path.

original: ste ; 'dir par tang zhes smos pa ni g-yam po dang stan gzhan dag gi dpe yin no //
analyzed: ste ; 'dir par tang zhes smos pa ni g-yam po dang stan gzhan dag gi dpe yin no //
translated: The word “etc.” in the text refers to other kinds of seats.

original: snum par gyur nas zhes bya ba ni rkang pa bkrus nas 'bru mar la sogs pas ha cang snum por byas pas 'chags stan la sogs pa snum par gyur nas so //
analyzed: snum par gyur nas zhes bya ba ni rkang pa bkrus nas 'bru mar la sogs pas ha cang snum por byas pas 'chags stan la sogs pa snum par gyur nas so //
translated: “Having anointed” means that after washing the feet, one should not anoint them excessively with oil, etc., and then sit on the seat.

original: spang ba pas zhag gsum zhing rkang pa gnyis bsku bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni zhag gsum zhing gsum zhing rkang pa gnyis bsku bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: spang ba pas zhag gsum zhing rkang pa gnyis bsku bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni zhag gsum zhing gsum zhing rkang pa gnyis bsku bar bya ba'o //
translated: “One should anoint the feet three times a day” means that one should anoint the feet three times a day.
