original: 'dir bsku ba tsam du gsung bar zad kyi 'bru mar la sogs pas ha cang snum par bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsku ba tsam du gsung bar zad kyi 'bru mar la sogs pas ha cang snum par bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, the text merely mentions anointing, but one should not anoint excessively with oil, etc.

original: 'di ltar deng sang yang yul dbus na dang por rkang pa gnyis bskru zhing phyis cung zad tsam skud par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar deng sang yang yul dbus na dang por rkang pa gnyis bskru zhing phyis cung zad tsam skud par byed de /
translated: For, even today, in the Middle Country, one washes the feet first and then anoints them a little.

original: des na gsol ba snum po nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gsol ba snum po nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the feet do not become excessively oily.

original: de dag der mi shong nas zhes bya ba ni spong ba pa de dag spong khang der mi shong nas so //
analyzed: de dag der mi shong nas zhes bya ba ni spong ba pa de dag spong khang der mi shong nas so //
translated: If they do not fit there, means if those ascetics do not fit in that place of renunciation.

original: steng du rim khang gnyis pa bya'o zhes bya ba ni spong khang mo che'am yang thog bya ba'o //
analyzed: steng du rim khang gnyis pa bya'o zhes bya ba ni spong khang mo che'am yang thog bya ba'o //
translated: One should make a second story above, means one should make a second story of the great place of renunciation or the upper story.

original: thems skas bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dzegs pa'i phyir der thems skas bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽kha khyir gyis bskor bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mi dag mi ltung bar bya ba'i phyir them skas la kha khyer gyis bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: thems skas bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dzegs pa'i phyir der thems skas bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // kha khyir gyis bskor bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mi dag mi ltung bar bya ba'i phyir them skas la kha khyer gyis bskor bar bya'o //
translated: One should make a staircase, means one should make a staircase there for climbing, that is the meaning.🔽One should surround it with a parapet, means one should surround the staircase with a parapet to prevent people from falling.

original: lcags kyi gzer ba dag gis gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni kha khyer de mi 'khrul bar bya'i phyir lcags kyi gzer bu dag gis gdab par bya ba'o //
analyzed: lcags kyi gzer ba dag gis gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni kha khyer de mi 'khrul bar bya'i phyir lcags kyi gzer bu dag gis gdab par bya ba'o //
translated: One should drive in iron pegs, means one should drive in iron pegs to prevent the parapet from moving.

original: phyi rol du spong khang chen po bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'on kyang mi song na spong khang gi phyi rol du spong khang chen po'am gnas khang gi tshar dag brtsigs par ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du spong khang chen po bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'on kyang mi song na spong khang gi phyi rol du spong khang chen po'am gnas khang gi tshar dag brtsigs par ba'o //
translated: The phrase outside, a large place for the practice of austerities means that if one does not go there, one should build a large place for the practice of austerities or a dwelling outside the door of the monastery.

original: sgo sprod ces bya ba ni sgo byang bstan du 'bab pa'o //🔽sgo bsnol ma zhes bya ba ni sgo gzung ba'o //
analyzed: sgo sprod ces bya ba ni sgo byang bstan du 'bab pa'o // sgo bsnol ma zhes bya ba ni sgo gzung ba'o //
translated: The phrase a door means a door that is well-constructed.🔽The phrase a double door means a door with two panels.

original: sgo la gang bya'o zhes bya ba ni spong khang la sgo gang bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgo la gang bya'o zhes bya ba ni spong khang la sgo gang bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase a door-panel means a door-panel for the place of practice of austerities.

original: phug kyang bya'o zhes bya ba ni de'i nye 'khor gyi ched dus phug la sogs pa yang bya ba'o //
analyzed: phug kyang bya'o zhes bya ba ni de'i nye 'khor gyi ched dus phug la sogs pa yang bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase a cave means that for the sake of the vicinity of the place of practice of austerities, a cave and so forth should be made.

original: sgo drung du snam bu'am ras dpyangs te nyal bar bya zhes bya ba ni gnyid bro bsang bar mi nus na 'byor gyi gnas der sgo bcad de nyal ba la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sgo drung du snam bu'am ras dpyangs te nyal bar bya zhes bya ba ni gnyid bro bsang bar mi nus na 'byor gyi gnas der sgo bcad de nyal ba la nyes pa med do //
translated: The phrase having hung a cloth or a piece of cotton at the door, one should sleep means that if sleepiness is overwhelming and one is unable to dispel it, then there is no offense in sleeping in that place after closing the door.

original: sgo bcad pa 'di ni gzhan dag ma dad par 'gyur ba dang tho 'chams pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgo bcad pa 'di ni gzhan dag ma dad par 'gyur ba dang tho 'chams pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This closing of the door is for the sake of preventing others from losing faith and for the sake of preventing the occurrence of gossip.

original: spang ba'i zhal ta byed pa bsgo bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni dge slong spong ba rnams kyi phyir zhal te byed pa na spong ba'i zhal te byed pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: spang ba'i zhal ta byed pa bsgo bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni dge slong spong ba rnams kyi phyir zhal te byed pa na spong ba'i zhal te byed pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The service of relinquishment is the service for the sake of the monks who are relinquishing.

original: dge 'dun gyi gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis bsko bar bya'o //
translated: He should be appointed by the Saṅgha through a two-part formal procedure.

original: 'dun pas 'gro ba zhes @311b bya ba ni sred pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: 'dun pas 'gro ba zhes @311b bya ba ni sred pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: Going out of desire means going out of craving.

original: zhe sdang gis 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni khon gyi rgyus so //
analyzed: zhe sdang gis 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni khon gyi rgyus so //
translated: Going out of hatred means going out of resentment.

original: gti mug gis 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni mi shes pas so //
analyzed: gti mug gis 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni mi shes pas so //
translated: Going out of delusion means going out of ignorance.

original: 'jigs pas 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni skrag pa ston pas so //
analyzed: 'jigs pas 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni skrag pa ston pas so //
translated: Going out of fear means going out of intimidation.

original: spong ba la tron byas pa dang ma byas pa mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni brjed ngas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spong ba la tron byas pa dang ma byas pa mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni brjed ngas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not knowing whether the service of relinquishment has been done or not means forgetting.

original: spong ba'i zhal ta byed pa'i kun du spyod pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni spong khang du chag chag gdab pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spong ba'i zhal ta byed pa'i kun du spyod pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni spong khang du chag chag gdab pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The rules for the conduct of the one who performs the service of relinquishment are sprinkling and so forth in the relinquishment house.

original: gand'i brdung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor gyi gnas der spong ba dag bsdu ba'i phyir gand'i brdung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gand'i brdung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor gyi gnas der spong ba dag bsdu ba'i phyir gand'i brdung bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase one should beat the gandi means that one should beat the gandi in order to assemble the renunciants in that place of yoga.

original: dngags nas zhes bya ba ni skrag nas so //
analyzed: dngags nas zhes bya ba ni skrag nas so //
translated: The phrase having announced means having frightened.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba la tron mdzad kyi zhes bya ba ni tho 'tshams pa la brtson par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba la tron mdzad kyi zhes bya ba ni tho 'tshams pa la brtson par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase one should protect those who are being harmed means that one should strive to help those who are being harmed.

original: gand'i brdung ba'i brtsis mgo ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: gand'i brdung ba'i brtsis mgo ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The head count of the gandi beatings is of five types.

original: de dag brdung ba'i gnas ni khang steng la sogs pa phyogs mthon po dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag brdung ba'i gnas ni khang steng la sogs pa phyogs mthon po dag yin no //
translated: The places where they are beaten are high places such as the roof of a house.

original: dge 'dun bsdu ba'i gand'i de ni rgyud gsum dang tog gsum mo zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa chen po'i tshe dge 'dun thams cad bsdu ba'i phyir gand'i brdung ba la ni bzlas pa'i rgyud lan gsum brdung zhing mjug tu tog sgra chen po yang lan gsum bya'o
analyzed: dge 'dun bsdu ba'i gand'i de ni rgyud gsum dang tog gsum mo zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa chen po'i tshe dge 'dun thams cad bsdu ba'i phyir gand'i brdung ba la ni bzlas pa'i rgyud lan gsum brdung zhing mjug tu tog sgra chen po yang lan gsum bya'o
translated: The gandi for assembling the saṃgha is the three-stringed and three-clappered one. The phrase at the time of the great assembly, in order to assemble the entire saṃgha, the gandi is beaten three times with the string, and at the end, a loud sound is made three times means that at the time of the great assembly, the gandi is beaten three times with the string, and at the end, a loud sound is made three times.

original: // las kyi gand'i de ni rgyud gcig dang tog gsum mo zhes bya ba ni las bya ba'i don du gand'i brdung ba la ni bzlas pa'i rgyud lan gcig brdung zhing mjug tu tog sgra chen po lan gsum bya ba'o //
analyzed: // las kyi gand'i de ni rgyud gcig dang tog gsum mo zhes bya ba ni las bya ba'i don du gand'i brdung ba la ni bzlas pa'i rgyud lan gcig brdung zhing mjug tu tog sgra chen po lan gsum bya ba'o //
translated: The staff-beat for work is the staff-beat for the purpose of work. For that, one cycle of recitation is struck and at the end, three loud claps are made.

original: kha cig la ni rgyud gsum dang tog gnyis so zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig la ni rgyud gsum dang tog gnyis so zhe'o //
translated: Some say: Three cycles and two claps.🔽The staff-beat for death is a secret.

original: shi ba'i gand'i de ni byi bo'o zhes bya ba ni shi ba'i phyir 'du zhing khyogs phrag pas 'degs pa la sogs pa'i don du gand'i brdung ba ni byi bo ste /
analyzed: shi ba'i gand'i de ni byi bo'o zhes bya ba ni shi ba'i phyir 'du zhing khyogs phrag pas 'degs pa la sogs pa'i don du gand'i brdung ba ni byi bo ste /
translated: The staff-beat for death is the staff-beat for the purpose of gathering for the sake of death, for carrying the bier on the shoulder, and so on. It is a secret.

original: rgyud nyi tshe brdung zhing mjug tu to mi brdung ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyud nyi tshe brdung zhing mjug tu to mi brdung ba yin no //
translated: Only a limited cycle is struck and at the end, no claps are made.

original: kha cig las ni rgyud gcig dang tog gcig go zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig las ni rgyud gcig dang tog gcig go zhe'o //
translated: Some say: One cycle and one clap.🔽The staff-beat for renunciation is the khakkhara.

original: spong ba'i gand'i de ni 'khar gsil lo zhes bya ba ni dge slong spong ba pa la 'du ba'i 'khar gsil gyis gand'i byas te 'khar gsil bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: spong ba'i gand'i de ni 'khar gsil lo zhes bya ba ni dge slong spong ba pa la 'du ba'i 'khar gsil gyis gand'i byas te 'khar gsil bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The staff-beat for renunciation is the staff-beat for the purpose of gathering renunciate monks. It is the khakkhara. It is the meaning of the words: “The khakkhara is to be struck.”

original: kha cig las ni gand'i de chung du zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig las ni gand'i de chung du zhe'o //
translated: Some say: The small drum is for the small community.🔽The drum is beaten as much as is necessary for the harm to cease.🔽This means that the drum is beaten as much as is necessary to stop the harm of thieves, etc.🔽The drum is beaten as much as is necessary to stop the harm of thieves, etc.🔽The drum is beaten as much as is necessary to stop the harm of thieves, etc.

original: gnod pa byung ba'i gand'i ni ji tsam gyis chog pa'o zhes bya ba ni chom rkun la sogs pa gnod pa byung ba'o tshe gand'i brdung ba ni ji tsam gyis chog pa de tsam gyis brdung bar bya ste nam zhi bar gyur gyi bar du brdung ngo zhes🔽bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: zan gyi phyir 'du ba'i don tu ni gand'i dang gand'i chung ngu gnyis ka brdung ste / sngar gand'i chu ngu @312a * //

analyzed: brdung la khang skyong dang gtsang sbyor la sogs pas sangs rgyas mchod pa dang / lhung bzed bkru ba la sogs pa'i las byas nas de'i 'og tu gdugs tshod la bab pa'i tshe gand'i chen po brdung zhing dge 'dun thams cad zan gyi phyir 'dul bar bya'o //
translated: The drum is beaten as much as is necessary to stop the harm of thieves, etc.🔽The drum is beaten as

original: 'dus pa che ba'i tshe gand'i brdungs bas go bar mi 'gyur ba lta na dung bsgril te bud pa dang rda bo che dag kyang brdung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa che ba'i tshe gand'i brdungs bas go bar mi 'gyur ba lta na dung bsgril te bud pa dang rda bo che dag kyang brdung bar bya'o //
translated: If the assembly is large and the signal of the gong is not understood, then a conch shell is to be blown and a large drum is to be beaten.

original: gand'i brdungs par mi 'gro bar mi bya zhing mi myur bar yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: gand'i brdungs par mi 'gro bar mi bya zhing mi myur bar yang mi bya'o //
translated: The signal of the gong is not to be made too late, nor too early.

original: dus rting la thug pa zhes bya ba ni gdugs tshod la bab la thug pa'o //
analyzed: dus rting la thug pa zhes bya ba ni gdugs tshod la bab la thug pa'o //
translated: The time is called “late” when the time for the meal is near.

original: ci bder byed nas zhes bya ba ni spong ba'i zhal te byed bas dge slong rnams bsod snyoms la sogs pa la yang sbyar ba'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa dag dang ci bder spyod cig ces brjod pa'o //
analyzed: ci bder byed nas zhes bya ba ni spong ba'i zhal te byed bas dge slong rnams bsod snyoms la sogs pa la yang sbyar ba'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa dag dang ci bder spyod cig ces brjod pa'o //
translated: “As is convenient” is an allowance. When the monks are engaged in alms-begging, etc., one should say, “Venerable Ones, do what is convenient.”

original: de dge 'dun las 'thob pa zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi nang du zan za ba'o //
analyzed: de dge 'dun las 'thob pa zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi nang du zan za ba'o //
translated: “Obtained from the Saṅgha” means eating in the midst of the Saṅgha.

original: rgyun chags gsum pa gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'gyes kar dkon mchog gsum gyi rgyud dang / mdo sde'i rgyud dang / bsngo ba'i rgyud chags gsum gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun chags gsum pa gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'gyes kar dkon mchog gsum gyi rgyud dang / mdo sde'i rgyud dang / bsngo ba'i rgyud chags gsum gdon par bya'o //
translated: “The three continuous recitations are to be done” means that at the time of the break-up, the three continuous recitations of the Three Jewels, the Sūtra Basket, and the dedication are to be done.

original: de yang dper na kun du rgyu dag gi ril pa'i gzhi shing bu gsum la brten ba dang 'dra bar dam pa'i chos gdon pa'i gzhi ni rgyun chags gsum po 'di yin pas de'i phyir rgyun chags gsum zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang dper na kun du rgyu dag gi ril pa'i gzhi shing bu gsum la brten ba dang 'dra bar dam pa'i chos gdon pa'i gzhi ni rgyun chags gsum po 'di yin pas de'i phyir rgyun chags gsum zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For example, just as the three sticks of a bundle of sticks rest on the ground, so too, these three are the basis for the proclamation of the true Dharma. Therefore, they are called the three proclamations.

original: ran phar gdon par bya'o /🔽zhes bya ba ni ha cang mang ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ran phar gdon par bya'o / zhes bya ba ni ha cang mang ba yang ma yin te /
translated: One should proclaim them in a moderate way.

original: ha cang nyung ba yang ma yin par ci ran cig gdong par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ha cang nyung ba yang ma yin par ci ran cig gdong par bya ba'o //
translated: This means that one should proclaim them in a moderate way, neither too much nor too little.🔽One should explain the benefits of generosity.

original: yon bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyun chags gsum pa bton pa'i 'og tu sbyin pa'i phan yon bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: yon bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyun chags gsum pa bton pa'i 'og tu sbyin pa'i phan yon bshad par bya'o //
translated: This means that after proclaiming the three proclamations, one should explain the benefits of generosity.🔽If such conditions arise,

original: gal te rkyen de lta bu byung na zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong gi tshul dang srog dang tshangs par spyod par bar chad du 'gyur ba la sogs pa zhig byung na'o //
analyzed: gal te rkyen de lta bu byung na zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong gi tshul dang srog dang tshangs par spyod par bar chad du 'gyur ba la sogs pa zhig byung na'o //
translated: means if conditions arise that would obstruct the way of life of a monk, his life, or his pure conduct, and so on.

original: lde mig ces bya ba ni lde mig khyog po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lde mig ces bya ba ni lde mig khyog po la sogs pa'o //
translated: A key means a crooked key, and so on.

original: de ni 'dug pa'o zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong ngo /🔽// / bam po bcu gnyis pa /
analyzed: de ni 'dug pa'o zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong ngo / // / bam po bcu gnyis pa /
translated: That is the sitting purification.

original: da ni gso sbyong gi gzhi las mthun pa'i gso sbyong gi skabs brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni gso sbyong gi gzhi las mthun pa'i gso sbyong gi skabs brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the section on the purification of concordance with the basis of purification should be explained.

original: de la dad por mthun pa'i gso sbyong gi gnas la blo mthun par bya ba'i zhal las bstan pa'i phyir bya ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la dad por mthun pa'i gso sbyong gi gnas la blo mthun par bya ba'i zhal las bstan pa'i phyir bya ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In that regard, in order to teach the concordance of the mind with the basis of purification of concordance, it is said, What is the act?

original: gsol ba zhes bya ba ni la gang la gsol ba 'ba' zhig byed pa ste /
analyzed: gsol ba zhes bya ba ni la gang la gsol ba 'ba' zhig byed pa ste /
translated: The term request refers to an act that is done only by request.

original: 'di lta ste gsang ste ston par bsko ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste gsang ste ston par bsko ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: For example, appointing someone to teach in secret, and so on.

original: @312b gsol ba dang gnyis zhes bya ba ni las gang la las brjod pa gcig dang / gsol ba dang gnyis byed pa ste /
analyzed: @312b gsol ba dang gnyis zhes bya ba ni las gang la las brjod pa gcig dang / gsol ba dang gnyis byed pa ste /
translated: The term request and two refers to an act that is done with one announcement of the act and two requests.

original: 'di la ste gso sbyong gi gnas la blo mthun par bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la ste gso sbyong gi gnas la blo mthun par bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: For example, the concordance of the mind with the basis of purification, and so on.

original: gsol ba dang bzhi'i las zhes bya ba ni las gang la las brjod pa gsum dang gsol ba dang bzhi byed pa ste /
analyzed: gsol ba dang bzhi'i las zhes bya ba ni las gang la las brjod pa gsum dang gsol ba dang bzhi byed pa ste /
translated: The rite of proposal and four proclamations is a rite in which the proclamation of the action and the proposal are performed four times.

original: 'di lta ste rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the rite for the full ordination and so on.

original: gso sbyong zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims gso zhing sbyong ba ste gso bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gso sbyong zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims gso zhing sbyong ba ste gso bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Purification of the moral discipline is purification of the moral discipline.

original: zla ba phyed phyed cing gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bcu bzhi pa'am bco lnga pa'i dus su'o //🔽so sor thar pa'i mod gdon pa gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems drang por bsgrub pa la sogs pa dang rgyu 'gal ba bzlog pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang tshul khrims gso bar byed pa yod pa de dag bsal ba'i phyir so sor
analyzed: zla ba phyed phyed cing gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bcu bzhi pa'am bco lnga pa'i dus su'o // so sor thar pa'i mod gdon pa gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems drang por bsgrub pa la sogs pa dang rgyu 'gal ba bzlog pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang tshul khrims gso bar byed pa yod pa de dag bsal ba'i phyir so sor
translated: It should be performed every half month, on the fourteenth or fifteenth day.🔽The recitation of the Prātimokṣa should be recited.🔽The moral discipline is purified by other methods as well, such as by a sincere mind and so on, and by the reversal of the causes of downfalls and so on.

original: thar pa'i mdo gdon par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thar pa'i mdo gdon par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The recitation of the Prātimokṣa is recited in order to eliminate those.

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The recitation of the Prātimokṣa is of five types:

original: gleng gzhi gdon pa dang pham par 'gyur pa gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang / ril gyis gdon pa'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi gdon pa dang pham par 'gyur pa gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang / ril gyis gdon pa'o //
translated: The recitation of the nidana, the recitation of the defeat, the recitation of the residual faults, the recitation of the undetermined, and the recitation of the whole.

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa mi dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyi las yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa mi dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyi las yin no //
translated: The elder of the Saṅgha should recite the Prātimokṣa Sūtra every half month - this is the duty of the elder of the Saṅgha to recite the Prātimokṣa Sūtra.

original: des mi nus na gnas brtan gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: des mi nus na gnas brtan gnyis pa'o //
translated: If he is unable, then the second elder.

original: nges kyang mi nus na gsum pa'o //
analyzed: nges kyang mi nus na gsum pa'o //
translated: If he too is unable, then the third.

original: des kyang mi nus na res kyis bya'o //
analyzed: des kyang mi nus na res kyis bya'o //
translated: If he too is unable, then by turns.

original: res bab pas mi nus na gzhan la bcol bar bya'o //
analyzed: res bab pas mi nus na gzhan la bcol bar bya'o //
translated: If the one whose turn it is is unable, he should request another.

original: bcol te ma btub na dge 'dun gyis bcol bar bya'o //
analyzed: bcol te ma btub na dge 'dun gyis bcol bar bya'o //
translated: If requested, but still unable, then the Saṅgha should request.

original: 'don pa rdugs na gzhan gyis gdon no //
analyzed: 'don pa rdugs na gzhan gyis gdon no //
translated: If the recitation is interrupted, it should be continued by another.

original: dam dum 'dzin pa nyid yin na ji snyed kyis gzhung srong ba dag gis gzhung bsrang ste gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa skabs 'og nas kyang byung ngo //
analyzed: dam dum 'dzin pa nyid yin na ji snyed kyis gzhung srong ba dag gis gzhung bsrang ste gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa skabs 'og nas kyang byung ngo //
translated: If it is a matter of memorization, then one should recite the text by straightening out the text as much as one can.

original: gso sbyong gi gnas la bo mthun par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas gang du gso sbyong mngon du byed pa'i gnas de ni gso sbyong gi gnas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gso sbyong gi gnas la bo mthun par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas gang du gso sbyong mngon du byed pa'i gnas de ni gso sbyong gi gnas zhes bya ste /
translated: The phrase one should agree upon the site for the observance day means that the site where the observance day is performed is called the site for the observance day.

original: gnas der gso sbyong bya bar dge 'dun gyis gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis blo mthun par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas der gso sbyong bya bar dge 'dun gyis gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis blo mthun par bya ba'o //
translated: The Saṃgha should agree upon that site by means of a proposal and a single proclamation.

original: gso sbyong gi gnas ji lta bu de la blo mthun par bya zhe na /🔽de'i phyi gnas thams cad grub pa'am byas pa'am zin pa nang mtshams dang phyi rol nye 'khor 'dom gang dan bcas pa dge 'dun gyis @313a * //
analyzed: gso sbyong gi gnas ji lta bu de la blo mthun par bya zhe na / de'i phyi gnas thams cad grub pa'am byas pa'am zin pa nang mtshams dang phyi rol nye 'khor 'dom gang dan bcas pa dge 'dun gyis @313a * //
translated: How should one agree upon the site for the observance day?

original: gso sbyong gi gnas su 'dod pa gang yin pa de la blo mthun par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gso sbyong gi gnas su 'dod pa gang yin pa de la blo mthun par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /

original: gnas thams cad grub pa zhes bya ba ni 'chags pa'i bskal ba'i tshe rang grub pa'am de'i 'og tu tib chad pa la sogs pas rab grub pas te dper na bya sgrubs la sogs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: gnas thams cad grub pa zhes bya ba ni 'chags pa'i bskal ba'i tshe rang grub pa'am de'i 'og tu tib chad pa la sogs pas rab grub pas te dper na bya sgrubs la sogs pa lta bu ste /
translated: All abodes are established by nature means that at the time of the formation of the world, they are established by nature or they are established by the wind mandala and so on that arise after that.

original: gzhan gyi brtsal ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi brtsal ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not dependent on the effort of others because they are like the celestial mansion of Brahma and so on.

original: byas pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i gnas byed pas mngon par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: byas pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i gnas byed pas mngon par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Established by humans means that humans establish them.

original: zin pa zhes bya ba byed pa'i gnas la sogs pa rung ba'o //
analyzed: zin pa zhes bya ba byed pa'i gnas la sogs pa rung ba'o //
translated: Possessing a boundary means that they are suitable as the site of an action and so on.

original: nad mtshams dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni nang na chu la sogs pa'i bar chad med pa ste /
analyzed: nad mtshams dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni nang na chu la sogs pa'i bar chad med pa ste /
translated: Possessing an inner boundary means that they are not obstructed by water and so on.

original: mtshams gcig dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshams gcig dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Possessing a single boundary means that they are not obstructed by other abodes.

original: phyi rol nye 'khor 'dom gang dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du gyur pa'i nye 'khor 'dom gad tsam dan bcas pa gad yin pa ste /
analyzed: phyi rol nye 'khor 'dom gang dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du gyur pa'i nye 'khor 'dom gad tsam dan bcas pa gad yin pa ste /
translated: Possessing an external boundary one fathom in extent means that they are not obstructed by other abodes one fathom outside.

original: de dag gis ni gso sbyong gi gnas rnam pa thams cad yongs su grub pa bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni gso sbyong gi gnas rnam pa thams cad yongs su grub pa bstan to //
translated: These passages teach the complete procedure for the rite of purification and restoration.

original: ci dge 'dun mi 'dod bzhin du yang de la blo mthun par bya'am zhen ma yin te /
analyzed: ci dge 'dun mi 'dod bzhin du yang de la blo mthun par bya'am zhen ma yin te /
translated: But is it possible for the Saṅgha to agree to something that it does not want?

original: de'i phyir dge 'dun gso sbyong gi gnas su 'dod pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge 'dun gso sbyong gi gnas su 'dod pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: No, it is not. Therefore, the text says, “The Saṅgha is in agreement about the site for the rite of purification and restoration.”

original: las brjod pa'i skabs su ni gnas thams cad grub pa'am lags pa'am bgyi pa zhes tshigs gsum char smos par mi bya bar de gsum las gang yin pa gcig brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: las brjod pa'i skabs su ni gnas thams cad grub pa'am lags pa'am bgyi pa zhes tshigs gsum char smos par mi bya bar de gsum las gang yin pa gcig brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the section on the announcement of the legal procedure, one should not say all three phrases: “The site is complete,” “The site is suitable,” or “The site is prepared.” One should say whichever of the three is appropriate.

original: dgag dbye zhes bya ba ni dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i dge slong rnams kyis mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dgos pa'i gnas gsum gyis gleng pa'i skabs 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: dgag dbye zhes bya ba ni dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i dge slong rnams kyis mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dgos pa'i gnas gsum gyis gleng pa'i skabs 'byed pa'o //
translated: The text says, “The announcement of the lifting of restrictions,” because the monks who have undertaken the rainy season retreat lift the restrictions on the three topics of discussion: what has been seen, what has been heard, and what is suspected.

original: mi mthun par byed ces bya ba ni kha skong ba dag ma tshogs pa dang 'dun pa la sogs pa ma blangs par las byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun par byed ces bya ba ni kha skong ba dag ma tshogs pa dang 'dun pa la sogs pa ma blangs par las byed pa'o //
translated: The text says, “They act in a way that is not in agreement,” because they perform the legal procedure without the required number of monks being present, without a motion, etc., having been carried out, and without the consent of the monks present.

original: sdom la ka phi na dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gso sbyong gi gzhi'i spyi sdom las ka phi na zhes smos pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa'i yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: sdom la ka phi na dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gso sbyong gi gzhi'i spyi sdom las ka phi na zhes smos pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa'i yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The summary is “Kāpīlava, etc.” The summary verse of the summary of the basis of the purification of the moralities is “Kāpīlava, etc.”

original: sde can ma'i bug ces bya ba ni gtsug lag gi ming ste /
analyzed: sde can ma'i bug ces bya ba ni gtsug lag gi ming ste /
translated: The “cave of the one with the matted hair” is the name of a monastery.

original: sde can mas byed du bcug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sde can mas byed du bcug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it was constructed by the one with the matted hair.

original: gso sbyong gcig pa'i gnas kyi sdom pas zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gcig tu 'du zhing gso sbyong bya ba ni sdom pas te nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gso sbyong gcig pa'i gnas kyi sdom pas zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gcig tu 'du zhing gso sbyong bya ba ni sdom pas te nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The summary of the purification of the moralities of the same place of purification” means the summary of the experience of the purification of the moralities in the same assembly.

original: bya ba dag ces bya ba ni nges pa nyid du gnas pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba dag ces bya ba ni nges pa nyid du gnas pa ste /
translated: “The actions” means the definite abodes.

original: gsol ba la sogs pa'i las so //
analyzed: gsol ba la sogs pa'i las so //
translated: The actions of the request, etc.

original: byed pa dag ces bya ba ni dus gzhan na @313b 'byung ba yongs su gnas pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa dag ces bya ba ni dus gzhan na @313b 'byung ba yongs su gnas pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The activities” means the activities of the other times, such as the full ordination.

original: rtag tu dag pa zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi kun du spyod pa rtag tu dag pa ste nyes pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtag tu dag pa zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi kun du spyod pa rtag tu dag pa ste nyes pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Always pure” means that the conduct of body, speech, and mind is always pure, which is to say, without fault.

original: snying po ste zhes bya ba ni snying po dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: snying po ste zhes bya ba ni snying po dang ldan pa ste /
translated: “Essence” means endowed with essence.

original: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽rtag du dag pa gso sbyong yin //
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // rtag du dag pa gso sbyong yin //
translated: “Pure morality” means the same as “pure morality.”🔽“Always pure” is purification.

original: zhes bya ba ni rtag tu rgyud dag pa ni gso sbyong yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtag tu rgyud dag pa ni gso sbyong yin no //
translated: “Always pure” means that the stream is always pure, which is to say, purified.

original: gtsang ma'i las ni dag gyur pa //
analyzed: gtsang ma'i las ni dag gyur pa //
translated: “Pure action” is pure.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims la kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //🔽de yin brtul zhugs 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims la kha na ma tho ba med pa'o // de yin brtul zhugs 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: “Pure action” means that morality is without fault.

original: zhes bya ba ni spong ba'i mtshan nyid bdun gyi tshul khrims 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni spong ba'i mtshan nyid bdun gyi tshul khrims 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tha tshig go //
translated: “That is the practice that is accomplished” means that the morality of the seven characteristics of abandonment is accomplished.

original: dag cing zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag cing zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Pure” means that by nature it is without fault.

original: mchog tu dag pa zhes bya ba ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog tu dag pa zhes bya ba ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Supreme purity means that there is no natural offense.

original: ma byung ngam zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: ma byung ngam zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
translated: Not arisen is a question.

original: mi 'gro bar ma byed par zhes bya ba ni mnan pa'i phyir dgag pa gnyis smos so //
analyzed: mi 'gro bar ma byed par zhes bya ba ni mnan pa'i phyir dgag pa gnyis smos so //
translated: Not going is a prohibition, expressed by the double negative, in order to emphasize it.

original: mtshams chen po bcad par rjes su gnang ngo zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong la sogs pa'i gnas gcig tu bsdu ba'i phyir dpag tshad phyed dang gsum tshun chad kyi mtha' tshun chad du gsol ba dang gnyis kyis mtshams gcad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtshams chen po bcad par rjes su gnang ngo zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong la sogs pa'i gnas gcig tu bsdu ba'i phyir dpag tshad phyed dang gsum tshun chad kyi mtha' tshun chad du gsol ba dang gnyis kyis mtshams gcad par bya ba'o //
translated: Permission to cut the great boundary means that within a distance of one and a half yojanas, the boundary should be cut by two requests, in order to gather into one place for the poṣadha, etc.

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni dus thung ngur gnas pa phyir nang gi rgyus mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni dus thung ngur gnas pa phyir nang gi rgyus mi shes pa'o //
translated: Dwelling means dwelling for a short time, not known by internal causes.

original: gnyug mar gnas pa zhes bya ba ni dus yun ring du gnas pa phyi nang gis rgyus shes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyug mar gnas pa zhes bya ba ni dus yun ring du gnas pa phyi nang gis rgyus shes pa'o //
translated: Permanent dwelling means dwelling for a long time, known by internal and external causes.

original: brtan po zhes bya ba ni brtan pa ste bcos ma ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brtan po zhes bya ba ni brtan pa ste bcos ma ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Firm means stable, not artificial, is what is meant.

original: mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni mngon mtshan no //
analyzed: mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni mngon mtshan no //
translated: Signs are the marks.

original: gzugs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should investigate means one should examine.

original: mtshams bcad pa'i las ni mtshams brtag pa'i phyir byed pa yin pas de'i phyir mtshan ma ma btsugs na mtshams ma brtags pa yin pas de'i phyir mtshan ma brtan po gzungs par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mtshams bcad pa'i las ni mtshams brtag pa'i phyir byed pa yin pas de'i phyir mtshan ma ma btsugs na mtshams ma brtags pa yin pas de'i phyir mtshan ma brtan po gzungs par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The rite of establishing the boundary is done in order to examine the boundary. Therefore, if the sign is not established, the boundary is not examined. Therefore, it is said, One should firmly establish the sign.

original: brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsgrag par bya'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsgrag par bya'o //
translated: One should announce means one should proclaim.

original: nang du zhes bya ba ni de tshun chad du'o //
analyzed: nang du zhes bya ba ni de tshun chad du'o //
translated: Inside means within that.

original: gnas bsdu bzhi bya ba ni gso sbyong la sogs pa'i las lhan cig tu bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnas bsdu bzhi bya ba ni gso sbyong la sogs pa'i las lhan cig tu bya ba ste /
translated: The four activities of gathering the saṅgha are the activities of poṣadha and so on that are done together.

original: des na mtshams de'i nang na gnas pa'i dge slong rnams las kyi gnas su ma tshogs sam /
analyzed: des na mtshams de'i nang na gnas pa'i dge slong rnams las kyi gnas su ma tshogs sam /
translated: Therefore, if one does those activities without all the monks who are within that boundary having gathered,

original: de dag gi 'dun pa ma blangs par byed na mi mthun par byed pa yin pas las mi 'chags so //
analyzed: de dag gi 'dun pa ma blangs par byed na mi mthun par byed pa yin pas las mi 'chags so //
translated: or without taking their consent, one does not do them in harmony, so the activity is not accomplished.

original: dge slong rnams @314a * //
analyzed: dge slong rnams @314a * //
translated: The monks

original: bde ba la reg par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni las 'grub pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba la reg par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni las 'grub pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “He abides in the attainment of happiness” means that his actions are accomplished and he is free from wrongdoing.

original: grong dang grong gi nye 'khor ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni mtshams chen po de'i nang na grong dang grong gi nye 'khor gang dag yod pa de dag mtshams kyi khongs su ma brtsi bar khol du dbyung bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: grong dang grong gi nye 'khor ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni mtshams chen po de'i nang na grong dang grong gi nye 'khor gang dag yod pa de dag mtshams kyi khongs su ma brtsi bar khol du dbyung bar bya ba'o //
translated: “Except for the village and the vicinity of the village” means that the villages and the vicinity of the villages that exist within that great boundary are not counted as part of the boundary, but are set aside separately.

original: des na grong dang grong gi nye 'khor snga na yod na yang de mtshams su mi 'gyur la phyis brtsigs na yang mtshams su ma gtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na grong dang grong gi nye 'khor snga na yod na yang de mtshams su mi 'gyur la phyis brtsigs na yang mtshams su ma gtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if the village and the vicinity of the village existed before, they are not included in the boundary. If they are built later, they are not included in the boundary.

original: dgon pa la thug pa zhes bya ba ni dpag tshad phyed dang gsum gyi mtha' tshun chad do //
analyzed: dgon pa la thug pa zhes bya ba ni dpag tshad phyed dang gsum gyi mtha' tshun chad do //
translated: “Up to the wilderness” means up to a distance of one and a half krośas.

original: gnas la thug pa zhes bya ba na gtsug lag khang la thug pa'o //
analyzed: gnas la thug pa zhes bya ba na gtsug lag khang la thug pa'o //
translated: “Up to the monastery” means up to the temple.

original: skyo bar gyur ces bya ba ni gnod par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: skyo bar gyur ces bya ba ni gnod par gyur pa'o //
translated: “If they become weary” means if they become harmed.

original: mtshams chen po'i nang du dge slong thams cad kyis chos gos dag dang mi 'bral ba'i gnang ba sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mtshams der gal te chos gos dag dang mi 'bral ba'i gnang ba byas par gyur na /
analyzed: mtshams chen po'i nang du dge slong thams cad kyis chos gos dag dang mi 'bral ba'i gnang ba sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mtshams der gal te chos gos dag dang mi 'bral ba'i gnang ba byas par gyur na /
translated: This means that if permission not to be separated from the robes is given in that boundary,

original: gzod chog gos dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur ba yin gyi mtshams bcad pa tsam gyis 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzod chog gos dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur ba yin gyi mtshams bcad pa tsam gyis 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: then one will not be separated from the robes. It does not mean that one will not be separated by merely the boundary being drawn.

original: stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni chos gos stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni chos gos stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Together with the upper robe and the lower robe means together with the upper robe and the lower robe of the Dharma robe.

original: snam sbyar med par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snam sbyar med par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means without the patched robe.

original: bzhi yi tshogs kyis las bya ba //
analyzed: bzhi yi tshogs kyis las bya ba //
translated: The rite is performed by a group of four.

original: zhes bya ba ni pham par 'gyur ba'i nye pa sbom po yang bshags pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni pham par 'gyur ba'i nye pa sbom po yang bshags pa'o //
translated: This means confessing the serious offense that is close to a defeating offense.

original: lnga yin tshogs kyis las bya ba //
analyzed: lnga yin tshogs kyis las bya ba //
translated: The rite is performed by a group of five.

original: zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba'i nyes pa sbom po lci ba bshags pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba'i nyes pa sbom po lci ba bshags pa'o //
translated: This is the confession of the serious and grave offense that is a partial defeat of the monastic community.🔽Some say: The act is performed by a group of four when it is the observance-day ceremony.

original: kha cig na re bzhi'i tshogs kyis las bya ba ni gso sbyong las so //
analyzed: kha cig na re bzhi'i tshogs kyis las bya ba ni gso sbyong las so //
translated: The act is performed by a group of five when it is the ceremony for ending the rainy season retreat.🔽The act is performed by a group of ten when it is the ceremony for full ordination in the central region.🔽The act is performed by a group of twenty when it is the ceremony for full ordination in the border regions.🔽The act is performed by a group of more than twenty when it is the ceremony for full ordination in the very remote regions.🔽The act is performed by a group of four when it is the observance-day ceremony.

original: lnga'i tshogs kyis las bya ba ni dgag dbye'i las so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: lnga'i tshogs kyis las bya ba ni dgag dbye'i las so zhes zer ro //
translated: The act is performed by a group of five when it is the ceremony for ending the rainy season retreat.

original: bcu yin tshogs kyis las bya ba //🔽zhes bya ba ni yul dbus rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i las so //
analyzed: bcu yin tshogs kyis las bya ba // zhes bya ba ni yul dbus rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i las so //
translated: The act is performed by a group of ten when it is the ceremony for full ordination in the central region.🔽The act is performed by a group of twenty when it is the ceremony for full ordination in the border regions.🔽The act is performed by a group of more than twenty when it is the ceremony for full ordination in the very remote regions.🔽The act is performed by a group of four when it is the observance-day ceremony.🔽The act is performed by a group of five when it is the ceremony for ending the rainy season retreat.🔽The act is performed by a group of ten when it is the ceremony for full ordination in the central region.🔽The act is performed by a group of twenty when it is the ceremony for full ordination in the border regions.🔽The act is performed by a group of more than twenty when it is the ceremony for full ordination in the very remote regions.

original: mtshams bu chung zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor ba ste /
analyzed: mtshams bu chung zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor ba ste /
translated: The act is performed by a group of four when it is the observance-day ceremony.🔽The act is performed by a group of five when it is the ceremony for ending the rainy season retreat.

original: de'i phyir mtshams bu chung bcad cing dkyil 'khor par blo mthun par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshams bu chung bcad cing dkyil 'khor par blo mthun par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The act is performed by a group of ten when it is the ceremony for full ordination in the central region.🔽The act is performed by a group of twenty when it is the ceremony for full ordination in the border regions.

original: je dang por mtshams chen po dgrol bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma bag yangs su ma byas par bcad par gzhan mi 'chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: je dang por mtshams chen po dgrol bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma bag yangs su ma byas par bcad par gzhan mi 'chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The act is performed by a group of more than twenty when it is the ceremony for full ordination in the very remote regions.

original: srol btod pa zhes bya ba ni rol la sogs pa'i srol @314b btod pa'o //
analyzed: srol btod pa zhes bya ba ni rol la sogs pa'i srol @314b btod pa'o //
translated: The act is performed by a group of four when it is the observance-day ceremony.🔽The act is performed by a group of five when it is the ceremony for ending the

original: mtshan pa brtan po gzugs par bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhir seng ldeng gi phur bu btab pa'am srad bu bres pa'am rdo bzhags pa'am srol btod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma brtan po de shes pa'i dge slong yul de na gnas pa'am /
analyzed: mtshan pa brtan po gzugs par bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhir seng ldeng gi phur bu btab pa'am srad bu bres pa'am rdo bzhags pa'am srol btod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma brtan po de shes pa'i dge slong yul de na gnas pa'am /
translated: The firm signs are the four directions, which are marked by iron spikes, or by a rope, or by stones, or by a trench, and so on.

original: gnyug mar gnas pa rnams kyis dang por brtag cing mtshan ma gzugs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyug mar gnas pa rnams kyis dang por brtag cing mtshan ma gzugs par bya ba'o //
translated: The firmly established signs are the signs which are known by the monks who live in that place, or by the resident monks, and which are examined first.

original: mtshan ma brtan po brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma de dag brtags shing btsugs pa'i 'og tu dge 'dun gyis mtshan ma brtan po de dag brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma brtan po brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma de dag brtags shing btsugs pa'i 'og tu dge 'dun gyis mtshan ma brtan po de dag brjod par bya'o //
translated: The firmly established signs should be announced means that after those signs have been examined and established, the Saṅgha should announce those firm signs.

original: de'i 'og tu dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhi'i mtshan ma brtan po de dag brjod pa'i 'og tu mtshams bcad pa'i las bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhi'i mtshan ma brtan po de dag brjod pa'i 'og tu mtshams bcad pa'i las bya ba'o //
translated: After that, the rite should be performed by one monk who has made a proposal means that after those firm signs in the four directions have been announced, the rite of establishing the boundary should be performed.

original: mtshams bu chung bcad par chos gos dag dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnang ba'i sbyin par bya'am zhe na /
analyzed: mtshams bu chung bcad par chos gos dag dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnang ba'i sbyin par bya'am zhe na /
translated: If one wishes to perform the rite of giving permission to leave the small boundary without being separated from one's robes,

original: 'di la nges pa med de /
analyzed: 'di la nges pa med de /
translated: then there is no certainty about this.🔽Because it says in the Questions of Upāli:

original: 'di ltar zhus pa las btsun pas mtshams bu chung ngu yang chos gos dag dang mi 'bral bar blo mthun par bgyi'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhus pa las btsun pas mtshams bu chung ngu yang chos gos dag dang mi 'bral bar blo mthun par bgyi'am /
translated: “Venerable One, should one agree to not be separated from one’s robes within the small boundary?”

original: gal te 'dod na blo mthun par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽de'i 'og tu mtshams chen po bcad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sngar mtshams bu chung ma bcad par chen pos bcad nas de'i 'og tu mtshams bu chung gcod par 'dod na mtshams chen po sngar bcad pa bkrol la mtshams bu chung bcad par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te 'dod na blo mthun par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro // de'i 'og tu mtshams chen po bcad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sngar mtshams bu chung ma bcad par chen pos bcad nas de'i 'og tu mtshams bu chung gcod par 'dod na mtshams chen po sngar bcad pa bkrol la mtshams bu chung bcad par bya'o //
translated: “If one wishes, one should agree.”🔽After that, one should cut the large boundary.🔽If one wishes to cut the small boundary after first cutting the large boundary without cutting the small boundary, then one should release the previously cut large boundary and cut the small boundary.

original: mtshams bu chung bcad nas yang mtshams chen po bcad par 'dod na de'i 'og tu yang mtshams chen po gcad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtshams bu chung bcad nas yang mtshams chen po bcad par 'dod na de'i 'og tu yang mtshams chen po gcad par bya ba'o //
translated: If one wishes to cut the large boundary after cutting the small boundary, then one should cut the large boundary after that.

original: de'i 'og tu mtshams chen po'i nang du dge slong thams cad kyis chos gos dag dang mi 'bral ba'i gnad ba sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mtshams bu chung bcad pa'i 'og tu mtshams chen po phyis bcad pa der yang gnang ba byas na chos gos dang
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mtshams chen po'i nang du dge slong thams cad kyis chos gos dag dang mi 'bral ba'i gnad ba sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mtshams bu chung bcad pa'i 'og tu mtshams chen po phyis bcad pa der yang gnang ba byas na chos gos dang
translated: After that, in the great boundary, all monks should be given permission not to be separated from their robes.

original: 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba de bya ba'o //🔽btsun pa las bgyid pa gcig gis gsol ba gcig dang / las brjod pa gcig gis mtshams kyi sgo nang dang slad rol dang bcas pa bsgyur ba dang / skyed par rung ngam zhes zhus pa dang / lan stsal ba'i skabs kyis ni mtshams chen po dang mtshams bu chung gnyis las byed pa gcig gis gsol ba gcig dang /
analyzed: 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba de bya ba'o // btsun pa las bgyid pa gcig gis gsol ba gcig dang / las brjod pa gcig gis mtshams kyi sgo nang dang slad rol dang bcas pa bsgyur ba dang / skyed par rung ngam zhes zhus pa dang / lan stsal ba'i skabs kyis ni mtshams chen po dang mtshams bu chung gnyis las byed pa gcig gis gsol ba gcig dang /
translated: This means that if permission is given in the great boundary that is later cut, even if the small boundary is cut first, one will not be separated from one's robes.🔽Venerable, is it permissible for a single monk to transform and create both the inner and outer boundaries of the great boundary and the small boundary with a single announcement and a single proclamation of the rite?

original: las brjod pa gcig gis cig car dgrol du yang ring la cig car gcad du yang rung bar ston to //
analyzed: las brjod pa gcig gis cig car dgrol du yang ring la cig car gcad du yang rung bar ston to //
translated: The answer shows that it is permissible for a single monk to simultaneously release both the great boundary and the small boundary with a single announcement and a single proclamation of the rite, and it is also permissible to simultaneously cut both.

original: del mtshams kyi sgo nang dan sa cas pa @315a * //
analyzed: del mtshams kyi sgo nang dan sa cas pa @315a * //
translated: The first is the one that is the basis of the name “intermediate state.”🔽

original: zhes bya ba ni mtshams bu chung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mtshams bu chung ngo //
translated: The small boundary is the boundary of a small enclosure.

original: mtshams kyi sgo slad rol dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni mtshams chen po'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi sgo slad rol dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni mtshams chen po'o //
translated: The large boundary is the boundary of a large enclosure.

original: bskyud pa zhes bya ba ni mtshams bu chung bcad pa'o //
analyzed: bskyud pa zhes bya ba ni mtshams bu chung bcad pa'o //
translated: The small boundary is cut off by the cutting ceremony.

original: skyed pa zhes bya ba ni mtshams chen po bcad pa ste /
analyzed: skyed pa zhes bya ba ni mtshams chen po bcad pa ste /
translated: The large boundary is cut off by the cutting ceremony.

original: des na gal te mtshams che chung gnyis ka dus gcig tu bskyung ba dang ; skyed par byed na yang mi rigs pa med do //
analyzed: des na gal te mtshams che chung gnyis ka dus gcig tu bskyung ba dang ; skyed par byed na yang mi rigs pa med do //
translated: Therefore, if both the small and large boundaries are cut off and created at the same time, there is no error.

original: de ltar byas te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni las byed pa gcig gis gsol ba gcig dang las brjod pa gcig gis mtshams che chung gnyis dus gcig tu dgrol ba dang dus gcig tu gcad pa'i las ston to //
analyzed: de ltar byas te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni las byed pa gcig gis gsol ba gcig dang las brjod pa gcig gis mtshams che chung gnyis dus gcig tu dgrol ba dang dus gcig tu gcad pa'i las ston to //
translated: Thus, etc. shows that the two boundaries, small and large, are released and cut off at the same time by one action, one request, and one announcement of the action.

original: mtshams gnyis kar dge 'dun bkod de zhes bya ba ni mtshams che chung gnyis kar ro //
analyzed: mtshams gnyis kar dge 'dun bkod de zhes bya ba ni mtshams che chung gnyis kar ro //
translated: The Sangha is arranged in both boundaries means in both the small and large boundaries.

original: shing la sogs pas mnan nas zhes bya ba ni de dag gis mnan na mtshams gcig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir de skad gsungs so //
analyzed: shing la sogs pas mnan nas zhes bya ba ni de dag gis mnan na mtshams gcig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir de skad gsungs so //
translated: If it is pressed down by wood and so forth, means that if it is pressed down by those, it becomes one boundary.

original: 'di la gal te 'dod na bskyed par yang bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la gal te 'dod na bskyed par yang bya'o //
translated: If one wishes, it should be extended in this case.

original: gal te mi 'dod na bskyung bar yang bya'o zhes bya ba ni las byed pa gcig gis gsol ba gcig dang / las byed pa gcig gis mtshams che chung gnyis ka dus gcig tu gcad par dang dgrol bar bya ba 'di la gal te 'dod na de ltar bya'i gal te mi 'dod na de ltar mi bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te mi 'dod na bskyung bar yang bya'o zhes bya ba ni las byed pa gcig gis gsol ba gcig dang / las byed pa gcig gis mtshams che chung gnyis ka dus gcig tu gcad par dang dgrol bar bya ba 'di la gal te 'dod na de ltar bya'i gal te mi 'dod na de ltar mi bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: If one does not wish, it should be reduced, means that if one wishes, one should do it in this way: one who performs the rite makes one request, and one who performs the rite cuts off both the large and small boundaries at the same time, and if one does not wish, one should not do it in that way.

original: rtsigs pas bskor ba yin na rtsig pa mtshams yin zhes bya ba ni mtshams ma bcad pa'i gnas gang yin pa der las bya ba'i yul la gtsug lag khang gi rtsig pa nyid mtshams yin no /
analyzed: rtsigs pas bskor ba yin na rtsig pa mtshams yin zhes bya ba ni mtshams ma bcad pa'i gnas gang yin pa der las bya ba'i yul la gtsug lag khang gi rtsig pa nyid mtshams yin no /
translated: If it is surrounded by walls, the wall is the boundary, means that in a place where the boundary has not been cut off, the wall of the monastery itself is the boundary in the place where the rite is performed.

original: rtsig pas ma bskor nas wa kha nas chu 'dzag pa gang du bab pa tshun chad ces bya ba ni mtshams ma bcad pa'i gnas rtsig pas ma bskor ba la mi wa kha nas chu 'dzag pa'i sna gang du 'dzag pa tshun chad las la mtshams yin pa
analyzed: rtsig pas ma bskor nas wa kha nas chu 'dzag pa gang du bab pa tshun chad ces bya ba ni mtshams ma bcad pa'i gnas rtsig pas ma bskor ba la mi wa kha nas chu 'dzag pa'i sna gang du 'dzag pa tshun chad las la mtshams yin pa
translated: The place where the water falls is the boundary of the action.🔽The monks who are staying there should perform the poṣadha, the pravāraṇa, and the karman of one motion, the karman of one motion and one announcement, and the karman of one motion and three announcements.

original: bstab to // dge slong de na 'khod pa rnams kyis der 'dug ste gso sbyong bya zhing dgag dbye dang gsol ba dang / gsol ba dang gnyis dang gsol ba dang bzhi'i las bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni las kyi gzhi spyir bstan pa las brgya rtsa gcig po dag gtso cher smos par zad kyis 'dir las brgya rtsa gcig po gnyi tshe bzung par ma zad de 'dul ba dang ldan
analyzed: bstab to // dge slong de na 'khod pa rnams kyis der 'dug ste gso sbyong bya zhing dgag dbye dang gsol ba dang / gsol ba dang gnyis dang gsol ba dang bzhi'i las bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni las kyi gzhi spyir bstan pa las brgya rtsa gcig po dag gtso cher smos par zad kyis 'dir las brgya rtsa gcig po gnyi tshe bzung par ma zad de 'dul ba dang ldan
translated: This teaches in general the basis of the action, and the one hundred and one are mentioned as the most important.

original: pa'i las thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i las thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, not only are the one hundred and one actions mentioned, but all actions possessing the vinaya should be understood as included.

original: chos gos dang mi 'bral ba'i mtshams ni ma gtogs te /
analyzed: chos gos dang mi 'bral ba'i mtshams ni ma gtogs te /
translated: The boundary of not being separated from the robes is excluded.

original: de ni sngar las kyis mtshams bcad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sngar las kyis mtshams bcad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the boundary that is set by karma.

original: nye 'khor mtha' tshun chad de zhes bya ba ni grong la @315b ni grong gi nye 'khor gyi mtha' tshun chad mtshams yin pa'o //
analyzed: nye 'khor mtha' tshun chad de zhes bya ba ni grong la @315b ni grong gi nye 'khor gyi mtha' tshun chad mtshams yin pa'o //
translated: Up to the edge of the surrounding area means that for a village, the edge of the surrounding area is the boundary.

original: rgyang grags kyi mtha' tshun chad de zhes bya ba ni dgon pa la ni phyogs su rgyang grags kyi mtha' chung chad mtshams yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyang grags kyi mtha' tshun chad de zhes bya ba ni dgon pa la ni phyogs su rgyang grags kyi mtha' chung chad mtshams yin pa'o //
translated: Up to the edge of a krośa means that for a wilderness, the edge of a krośa in each direction is the boundary.

original: btsun pa gso sbyong gi las su mchis zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos ma yin pa dang mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyis ston to //
analyzed: btsun pa gso sbyong gi las su mchis zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos ma yin pa dang mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyis ston to //
translated: Venerable, the poṣadha rite is being performed means that the characteristics of what is Dharma and what is not Dharma, and what is in accordance and what is not in accordance, are taught.

original: chos ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni gdon par bya ba dang / de'i tshad dang dus dang / 'don par byed pa rnams de kho na bzhin nye bar gzung ba ste /
analyzed: chos ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni gdon par bya ba dang / de'i tshad dang dus dang / 'don par byed pa rnams de kho na bzhin nye bar gzung ba ste /
translated: By what is not Dharma means that what is to be recited, its measure, time, and the reciters are taken up just as they are.

original: de la gdon par bya ba de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo la gzhan phran tshegs la sogs pa 'don pa'o //
analyzed: de la gdon par bya ba de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo la gzhan phran tshegs la sogs pa 'don pa'o //
translated: Not reciting the text as it should be recited is, for example, reciting the Pratimokṣa Sūtra in the Śrāvaka tradition, but not reciting the Kṣudraka Āgama and so on.

original: de'i tshad de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni gleng gzhi mi 'don zhing lhag ma rnams kyang thos pa bsgrubs pas sgrub bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshad de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni gleng gzhi mi 'don zhing lhag ma rnams kyang thos pa bsgrubs pas sgrub bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: Not reciting the measure as it should be recited is not reciting the nidāna and not reciting the remainder by establishing the hearing.

original: de'i dus de khon bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni gso sbyong gi dus las gzhan pa'i dus su byad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dus de khon bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni gso sbyong gi dus las gzhan pa'i dus su byad pa'o //
translated: Not reciting the time as it should be recited is performing the poṣadha at a time other than the poṣadha time.

original: 'don par byed pa de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni gang zag gang dag gi dbang du gso sbyong byed pa rdzogs par bsnyen pa dang bcas pa lta ba dang tshul khrims dag gis ris mthun pa de dag la gzhan bas byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'don par byed pa de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni gang zag gang dag gi dbang du gso sbyong byed pa rdzogs par bsnyen pa dang bcas pa lta ba dang tshul khrims dag gis ris mthun pa de dag la gzhan bas byed pa'o //
translated: Not reciting the reciter as it should be recited is performing the poṣadha under the influence of certain individuals who are fully ordained, but not others, who are of the same class in terms of view and ethics.

original: yang na gang gdon par bya ba dag /
analyzed: yang na gang gdon par bya ba dag /
translated: Or, those who should recite the text

original: ji snyed gdon par bya ba dang / gang gi tshe gdon par bya ba dang / gang dag gis gdon pa bya ba de dag yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: ji snyed gdon par bya ba dang / gang gi tshe gdon par bya ba dang / gang dag gis gdon pa bya ba de dag yongs su spangs te /
translated: He who, having abandoned the time when the debt is to be paid, the debtors, and the creditors,

original: gdon par bya ba dang tshad dang dus dang gdon par byed pa gzhan nyid nye bar 'dzin par byed pa de ni 'dir mi 'chags par byed pa yin pa chos ma yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gdon par bya ba dang tshad dang dus dang gdon par byed pa gzhan nyid nye bar 'dzin par byed pa de ni 'dir mi 'chags par byed pa yin pa chos ma yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: takes up the debt, the measure, the time, and the other creditors, is here called a non-repayer, and is to be known as unrighteous.

original: de las bzlog pa ni chos kyis byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni chos kyis byed pa yin no //
translated: The opposite of that is the righteous one.

original: mi mthun par byed pa zhes bya ba ni las kyi mtshams su gtogs pa'i dge slong rnams lus sam 'dun bas ma 'dus pa dang gsol ba ma brjod par 'don pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun par byed pa zhes bya ba ni las kyi mtshams su gtogs pa'i dge slong rnams lus sam 'dun bas ma 'dus pa dang gsol ba ma brjod par 'don pa'o //
translated: The one who acts in a way that is not in accordance with the rules is a monk who is not in agreement with the body or the intention, or who does not recite the invitation formula, among the monks who are included in the boundary of the ritual.

original: de la bzlog pa ni mthun par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la bzlog pa ni mthun par byed pa yin no //
translated: The opposite of that is the one who acts in accordance with the rules.

original: btsun pa so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa du mchis zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa rnam pa ltan ston te /
analyzed: btsun pa so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa du mchis zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa rnam pa ltan ston te /
translated: How many Prātimokṣas are there? This shows the types of Prātimokṣa recitation.

original: gleng gzhi gdon ba dang / pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang / ril gyi gdon pa'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi gdon ba dang / pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang / ril gyi gdon pa'o //
translated: The first is the confession of the basis, the second is the confession of the defeat, the third is the confession of the remainder of the community, the fourth is the confession of the undetermined, and the fifth is the confession of the whole.

original: sngom la / gnas dang dbyar snga phyi ma dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa mi sngar spyi sdom las gnas dang zhes smos pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa yin bar @316a * //
analyzed: sngom la / gnas dang dbyar snga phyi ma dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa mi sngar spyi sdom las gnas dang zhes smos pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa yin bar @316a * //
translated: The verse summary says: “Place, summer, earlier and later, and so on.” The verse summary of the general summary in the earlier part says “place” and so on.🔽This is applied.

original: sbyar ro // che ge mo zhig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa snang ngo zhes bya ba ni kha ton du thon pa ste /
analyzed: sbyar ro // che ge mo zhig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa snang ngo zhes bya ba ni kha ton du thon pa ste /
translated: “So and so” and so on appears. This is recited aloud.

original: bzlas pa'i phyir lan gnyis su smos so //
analyzed: bzlas pa'i phyir lan gnyis su smos so //
translated: It is mentioned twice for the sake of repetition.

original: gnas bstabs pa zhes bya ba ni gnas khang las mi dbral ba'o //
analyzed: gnas bstabs pa zhes bya ba ni gnas khang las mi dbral ba'o //
translated: “To be assigned to a place” means not to be separated from the dwelling place.

original: gnas mal bstabs pa zhes bya ba ni mal cha dang stan la sogs pa las mi dbral ba'o //
analyzed: gnas mal bstabs pa zhes bya ba ni mal cha dang stan la sogs pa las mi dbral ba'o //
translated: “To be assigned to a bed and seat” means not to be separated from bedding, cushions, and so on.

original: las bstabs pa zhes bya ba ni las su mi bsko ba'o //
analyzed: las bstabs pa zhes bya ba ni las su mi bsko ba'o //
translated: “To be assigned to work” means not to be appointed to work.

original: rnyed pa bstabs pa zhes bya ba ni las su bskos pa'i rnyed pa dbang ba de las ma byas kyang sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa bstabs pa zhes bya ba ni las su bskos pa'i rnyed pa dbang ba de las ma byas kyang sbyin pa'o //
translated: “Offering of acquisition” means giving from the acquisition that one has the right to, even if one has not yet used it.

original: bsnyen bkur ba bstabs pa zhes bya ba ni de'i bsnyen bkur ba las su mi bskos ba'o //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur ba bstabs pa zhes bya ba ni de'i bsnyen bkur ba las su mi bskos ba'o //
translated: “Offering of service” means from the service of that.

original: dbyar sda ma zhes bya ba ni dbyar zla 'bring po'i tshes bcu drug go //
analyzed: dbyar sda ma zhes bya ba ni dbyar zla 'bring po'i tshes bcu drug go //
translated: “Earlier rainy season” means the sixteenth day of the middle month of the rainy season.

original: gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid la zhes bya ba ni dbyar snga ma nye bar bsgrub pa dbyar zla 'bring po tshes bco lnga la'o //
analyzed: gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid la zhes bya ba ni dbyar snga ma nye bar bsgrub pa dbyar zla 'bring po tshes bco lnga la'o //
translated: “On that very fifteenth day of the purification and restoration” means the fifteenth day of the middle month of the rainy season, which is the establishment of the earlier rainy season.

original: dbyar phyi ma zhes bya ba ni dbyar zla tha chungs tshes bcu drug go //
analyzed: dbyar phyi ma zhes bya ba ni dbyar zla tha chungs tshes bcu drug go //
translated: “Later rainy season” means the sixteenth day of the last month of the rainy season.

original: gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid la nye ba ni dbyar phyi ma nye bar bsgrub pa dbyar zla tha chungs tshes bco lnga la'o //
analyzed: gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid la nye ba ni dbyar phyi ma nye bar bsgrub pa dbyar zla tha chungs tshes bco lnga la'o //
translated: “On that very fifteenth day of the purification and restoration” means the fifteenth day of the last month of the rainy season, which is the establishment of the later rainy season.

original: zla ba gnyis zhes bya ba ni dbyar zla tha chungs nya nas ston zla ra ba'i nya'i bar gyi zla ba gcig dang / ston zla ra ba nya nas ston zla 'bring po nya'i bar gyi zla ba gcig go //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis zhes bya ba ni dbyar zla tha chungs nya nas ston zla ra ba'i nya'i bar gyi zla ba gcig dang / ston zla ra ba nya nas ston zla 'bring po nya'i bar gyi zla ba gcig go //
translated: Two months means one month from the full moon of the last summer month up to the full moon of the first autumn month, and one month from the full moon of the first autumn month up to the full moon of the middle autumn month.

original: so sor brtags te zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dbyar nye bar bsgrub pa ni gnyis bka' stsal gyi /
analyzed: so sor brtags te zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dbyar nye bar bsgrub pa ni gnyis bka' stsal gyi /
translated: Having examined means having examined, thinking, “The Blessed One has declared two rainy seasons,

original: gsum pa ni med pas dgag dbye snga ma shos nyid btsal bar bya'o snyam du so sor brtags te'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni med pas dgag dbye snga ma shos nyid btsal bar bya'o snyam du so sor brtags te'o //
translated: but there is no third, so the earlier invitation should be sought.”

original: gso sbyong gzhan la zhes bya ba ni ston zla 'bring po gnas stong gi gso sbyong la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: gso sbyong gzhan la zhes bya ba ni ston zla 'bring po gnas stong gi gso sbyong la sogs pa la'o //
translated: In another purification ceremony means in the purification ceremony of the empty period of the middle autumn month, and so on.

original: mdo sde 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don gyi sgo dad tshig gi sgo nas 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don gyi sgo dad tshig gi sgo nas 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Upholding the sutras and so on means upholding them in terms of meaning and words.

original: don du zhes bya ba ni ched du'o //
analyzed: don du zhes bya ba ni ched du'o //
translated: For the sake of means for the purpose of.

original: khyams zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi sgo'i bar gyi bang rim mo //
analyzed: khyams zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi sgo'i bar gyi bang rim mo //
translated: The courtyard means the platform between the door of the temple and the outside.

original: ngag gi bshes pa'i tshig gis zhes bya ba ni byon pa legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig snyan pas so //
analyzed: ngag gi bshes pa'i tshig gis zhes bya ba ni byon pa legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig snyan pas so //
translated: With words of welcome means with pleasant words such as Welcome!

original: khrus bya zhes bya ba ni bsku mnye dang dril phyi bya zhing dus dang mthun pa'i chus khrus bya ba'o //
analyzed: khrus bya zhes bya ba ni bsku mnye dang dril phyi bya zhing dus dang mthun pa'i chus khrus bya ba'o //
translated: Bathing means massaging and rubbing, and bathing with water that is appropriate to the season.

original: dge 'dun la yang snum bag gi rnyed pa dbul bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir dge 'dun la yang snum bag gi rnyed pa dbul bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la yang snum bag gi rnyed pa dbul bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir dge 'dun la yang snum bag gi rnyed pa dbul bar bya ba'o //
translated: And one should offer to the Saṅgha the gift of oil-cake means that for that purpose one should offer to the Saṅgha the gift of oil-cake.

original: tshes mnyan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni der thams cad kyi spro ba bskyed par bya zhing seng ge'i khri bshams pa la sogs pa thams cad kyis brjod par mi bya ste ca cor 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshes mnyan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni der thams cad kyi spro ba bskyed par bya zhing seng ge'i khri bshams pa la sogs pa thams cad kyis brjod par mi bya ste ca cor 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One should listen to the recitation of the scriptures means that there one should not speak at all, such as by arranging the lion-seat and so on, in order to encourage everyone, because it would be noisy.

original: la la zhig ces bya ba @316b dge slong phrag dog can la la zhig go //
analyzed: la la zhig ces bya ba @316b dge slong phrag dog can la la zhig go //
translated: One who is jealous means a jealous monk.

original: rab tu 'byung ba dag tu 'dra na zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa'i cho gas rab tu byung ba dag tu 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu 'byung ba dag tu 'dra na zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa'i cho gas rab tu byung ba dag tu 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If they are equal in being renunciates means that they are equal in being renunciates through the rite as it has been taught.

original: ston pa 'das pa'i gsung rab la zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pas bstan pa'i chos la ste /
analyzed: ston pa 'das pa'i gsung rab la zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pas bstan pa'i chos la ste /
translated: In the scriptures of the Teacher who has passed into nirvāṇa means in the teachings of the Bhagavān who has gone to parinirvāṇa.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung ba la ltos nas ston pa 'das pa'i zhes gsungs kyi zhal bzhugs pa'i dus la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung ba la ltos nas ston pa 'das pa'i zhes gsungs kyi zhal bzhugs pa'i dus la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: With regard to what will occur in the future, it is said the Teacher who has passed into nirvāṇa, but it is not with regard to the time when he was present.

original: 'di ni ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni nye bar btags pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni nye bar btags pa'o //
translated: This is the Teacher means that it is a designation.

original: 'di ni rten te zhes bya ba ni 'di las bya ba dang / bya ba ma yin pa yongs su shes pa 'grub pa'i phyir rten min no ;
analyzed: 'di ni rten te zhes bya ba ni 'di las bya ba dang / bya ba ma yin pa yongs su shes pa 'grub pa'i phyir rten min no ;
translated: This is the basis means that it is not the basis because the understanding of what should and should not be done is accomplished from this.

original: ; rnam pa gang gis kyang gnang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni ye mi gnang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: ; rnam pa gang gis kyang gnang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni ye mi gnang bar bya ba'o //
translated: One should not allow it in any way means that it should not be allowed at all.

original: gnas brtan dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan nyid so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnas brtan dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan nyid so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon par byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase together with the elder means that the elder of the saṃgha himself recites the Sūtra on Individual Liberation.

original: so sor thar pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni gsar bu so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon par byed pa'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni gsar bu so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon par byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase together with the individual liberation means that the novice recites the Sūtra on Individual Liberation.

original: des na 'dir don 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na 'dir don 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning here is as follows:

original: gang na gnas brtan nyid so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa der 'gro bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang na gnas brtan nyid so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa der 'gro bar bya ba'o //
translated: One should go to the place where the elder himself recites the Sūtra on Individual Liberation.

original: gang na gsar bu so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa der ni 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang na gsar bu so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa der ni 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not go to the place where the novice recites the Sūtra on Individual Liberation.

original: gnas brtan so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa med na ni gang na so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa der yang 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas brtan so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa med na ni gang na so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa der yang 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: If there is no elder who recites the Sūtra on Individual Liberation, then one should go to the place where the Sūtra on Individual Liberation is recited.

original: kha cig na re gnas brtan nyid dang bcas pa so sor thar pa dang bcas zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan nyid kyang yod cing de nyid so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re gnas brtan nyid dang bcas pa so sor thar pa dang bcas zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan nyid kyang yod cing de nyid so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don par byed pa yin te /
translated: Some say: Together with the elder and together with the individual liberation means that the elder of the saṃgha himself exists and recites the Sūtra on Individual Liberation.

original: de sa na gang na gnas brtan kyang yod cing de nyid so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don par yang byed pa der 'gro bar bya'i nge gnyis yang gyur par ni 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: de sa na gang na gnas brtan kyang yod cing de nyid so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don par yang byed pa der 'gro bar bya'i nge gnyis yang gyur par ni 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes zer te /
