translated: There, even if there is an elder, he should recite the Pratimoksa Sutra. He should go there, but not if there are two of them.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni spyod pa bzang po dang ldan pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni spyod pa bzang po dang ldan pa nyid bstan to //
translated: He should go to one who is endowed with morality, etc. This shows that he should go to one who has good conduct.🔽If he goes elsewhere, if the disciple goes elsewhere than where the preceptor, etc.

original: de las gzhan du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni mkhan po la sogs pas bsgo ba de las gzhan du slob ma la sogs pa 'gro na'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni mkhan po la sogs pas bsgo ba de las gzhan du slob ma la sogs pa 'gro na'o //
translated: have directed him to go.

original: bro 'tshal ba zhes bya ba ni nad yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bro 'tshal ba zhes bya ba ni nad yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If he is sick, because he has a disease.

original: sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni nad ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni nad ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: If he is suffering, because a disease is the cause of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of “if he is endowed with suffering.”

original: bro tshabs che ba zhes bya ba ni nad shin tu tshabs chen po dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: bro tshabs che ba zhes bya ba ni nad shin tu tshabs chen po dang ldan pa ste /
translated: If he is seriously ill, if he is endowed with a very serious disease.

original: khril nyal ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khril nyal ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of “if he is lying down.”

original: de'i yongs su dag pa blang bar @317a * //
analyzed: de'i yongs su dag pa blang bar @317a * //
translated: One should take up its purification.

original: bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang lta ba phun sum tshogs pa gnyis kyis gso sbyong nyams su myong bar rung ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang lta ba phun sum tshogs pa gnyis kyis gso sbyong nyams su myong bar rung ba nyid yin la /
translated: One is fit to experience the poṣadha through the perfection of morality and the perfection of view.

original: tshul khrims dang lta ba phun sum tshogs pa mtshams kyi nang na gnas pa dag gis las nyams su myong bar rung gi gzhan gyis mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang lta ba phun sum tshogs pa mtshams kyi nang na gnas pa dag gis las nyams su myong bar rung gi gzhan gyis mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One who is fit to experience the poṣadha through the perfection of morality and the perfection of view is within the boundary.

original: de'i phyir 'og nas kyang 'gro ba'i bla mas dge slong des bdag nyid rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su dag pa phul lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'og nas kyang 'gro ba'i bla mas dge slong des bdag nyid rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su dag pa phul lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs par 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is said below, “The preceptor of the practitioner should offer the poṣadha for the sake of purifying the bhikṣu.”

original: phung nas zhes bya ba ni bzhag nas so //
analyzed: phung nas zhes bya ba ni bzhag nas so //
translated: “Having placed” means having set aside.

original: bar chad kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba ni pham par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bar chad kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba ni pham par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The causes of obstacles” are the causes of defeat, and so on.

original: brjod do zhes bya ba ni khyod la brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brjod do zhes bya ba ni khyod la brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “One should say” means “I should tell you.”

original: rig par bgyid do zhes bya ba ni brgyud pas dge 'dun la yang rig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rig par bgyid do zhes bya ba ni brgyud pas dge 'dun la yang rig par byed pa'o //
translated: One should inform means that one should inform the Saṅgha through an intermediary.

original: lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyis zhes bya ba ni mgo gcog pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyis zhes bya ba ni mgo gcog pa la sogs pas so //
translated: By physical intimation means by cutting off one's head, and so on.

original: blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bskur bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bskur bar bya ba'o //
translated: One should accept means one should receive.

original: rgyug bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyug cing 'gro bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyug bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyug cing 'gro bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should not run means one should not go running.

original: mgyogs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni mi brgyug par cung zad ngal ba'i 'gros kyis 'gro bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: mgyogs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni mi brgyug par cung zad ngal ba'i 'gros kyis 'gro bar bya ba'o //
translated: One should not hurry means one should go at a pace that is slightly slow.

original: mchong bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni mchong bar mi bya'o //🔽phyi rol la mchong bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol gyi rtsig pa dang / sa sgal la mchong bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: mchong bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni mchong bar mi bya'o // phyi rol la mchong bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol gyi rtsig pa dang / sa sgal la mchong bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not jump means one should not jump.🔽One should not jump outside means one should not jump from the wall or roof of the monastery.

original: 'obs mchong bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni mtshams kyi 'obs la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: 'obs mchong bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni mtshams kyi 'obs la sogs pa la'o //
translated: One should not jump into a moat means in a boundary moat, and so on.

original: bar rim la mchong bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi khyams kyi bar rim la'o //
analyzed: bar rim la mchong bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi khyams kyi bar rim la'o //
translated: One should not step over the intermediate level of the outer courtyard.

original: nam mkha' la 'dug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la 'dug pa'am 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la 'dug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la 'dug pa'am 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not stand in the sky. One should not stand or walk in the sky.

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni mtshams nas mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni mtshams nas mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not go outside the boundary. One should not go outside the boundary from the boundary.

original: gom pa gcig gis skas kyi rim pa gnyis la thod rgal du 'dzeg par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni skas kyi gdang bu gzhan thod rgal du bzhag ste /🔽gzhan la thod rgal du goms pa 'dor bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: gom pa gcig gis skas kyi rim pa gnyis la thod rgal du 'dzeg par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni skas kyi gdang bu gzhan thod rgal du bzhag ste / gzhan la thod rgal du goms pa 'dor bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should not ascend two steps of a ladder with one foot. One should not place one foot on a different step of a ladder than the other.🔽One should not skip a step when going up or down stairs.

original: gom pa gcig gis them skas kyi them pa gnyis la thod rgal du 'dzeg bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni them skas gzhan bzhag nas gzhan du gom pa dor bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: gom pa gcig gis them skas kyi them pa gnyis la thod rgal du 'dzeg bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni them skas gzhan bzhag nas gzhan du gom pa dor bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should not ascend two steps of a staircase with one foot. One should not place one foot on a different step of a staircase than the other.

original: chu lkog ma nub tsam la 'bog bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i lam gzhan yod na ste med na ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: chu lkog ma nub tsam la 'bog bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i lam gzhan yod na ste med na ni nyes pa med do //
translated: One should not urinate in water that reaches the level of the collar bone, unless there is no other choice.

original: gnyid log par byed pa dang snyoms @317b par 'jug par byed pa ni rgyu gnyis kyis smad par bya ba yin te zhes bya ba la ngo tsha med pa nyid ces bya ba ni bla ma dang yon tan can dag la mi gus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyid log par byed pa dang snyoms @317b par 'jug par byed pa ni rgyu gnyis kyis smad par bya ba yin te zhes bya ba la ngo tsha med pa nyid ces bya ba ni bla ma dang yon tan can dag la mi gus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who falls asleep or enters meditative absorption is despised for two reasons. Lack of shame means that one is not respectful toward superiors and those with good qualities.

original: ma klas pa nyid ces bya ba ni bstan pa de la the tshom za ba nyid dang / ma nges pa nyid dang / ma mos pa nyid dang / ma gus pa nyid kyi bar ma do na g-yel bag tu ldom pa'o //
analyzed: ma klas pa nyid ces bya ba ni bstan pa de la the tshom za ba nyid dang / ma nges pa nyid dang / ma mos pa nyid dang / ma gus pa nyid kyi bar ma do na g-yel bag tu ldom pa'o //
translated: Lack of reverence means that one is in a state of distraction, wavering between doubt about the teachings, uncertainty, lack of interest, and lack of respect.

original: ma lhags pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni mtshams kyi nang na 'khod pa dge 'dun gyi nang du ma 'dus pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: ma lhags pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni mtshams kyi nang na 'khod pa dge 'dun gyi nang du ma 'dus pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Those who are not present means those who are within the boundary but have not gathered in the midst of the Saṅgha.

original: lan gsum du bzlas zhes bya ba ni gang zag la bzlas pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: lan gsum du bzlas zhes bya ba ni gang zag la bzlas pa'i sngags so //
translated: Three times means the mantra of repetition for the individual.

original: dge 'dun la bzlas pa ni lan gcig gis chog go //
analyzed: dge 'dun la bzlas pa ni lan gcig gis chog go //
translated: But it is sufficient to repeat the formula once with regard to the Sangha.

original: khyim pa nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: khyim pa nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the expression “to be a householder,” etc.,

original: dbyar gyis 'che ba zhes bya ba ni dam 'cha' ba ste khas len zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽ji ltar khyim pa la sdom pa med pa de bzhin du bdag kyang sdom pa med pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir des 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa ma blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: dbyar gyis 'che ba zhes bya ba ni dam 'cha' ba ste khas len zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // ji ltar khyim pa la sdom pa med pa de bzhin du bdag kyang sdom pa med pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir des 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa ma blangs pa yin no //
translated: to be a householder is to take a vow, to accept, that is to say, to undertake the discipline of a householder.🔽Since he accepts the state of being without the restraint, he does not take up the intention and the purification.

original: ji ltar dge tshul dge slong gis las dag la mi rigs pa de bzhin du bdag kyang khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar dge tshul dge slong gis las dag la mi rigs pa de bzhin du bdag kyang khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since he accepts the state of being a novice monk and a monk, he does not take up the intention and the purification.

original: ji ltar za ma nyid nas rku thabs su gnas pa nyid kyi bar dag sdom pa'i zhing du gyur pa ma yin pa de bzhin du bdag kyang khas len pa'i phyir dang / ji ltar tha dad par gnas pa nyid rab tu byung ba thams cad las tha dad par gyur cing khyim pa dang 'dra ba de bzhin du bdag kyang tha dad par gyur pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: ji ltar za ma nyid nas rku thabs su gnas pa nyid kyi bar dag sdom pa'i zhing du gyur pa ma yin pa de bzhin du bdag kyang khas len pa'i phyir dang / ji ltar tha dad par gnas pa nyid rab tu byung ba thams cad las tha dad par gyur cing khyim pa dang 'dra ba de bzhin du bdag kyang tha dad par gyur pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Just as eunuchs and so on are not fields of merit for those who wish to take vows, so too I accept that I am not a field of merit for you.🔽Just as those who are not celibate are not fully ordained, and those who are not fully ordained are not similar to householders, so too I accept that I am not fully ordained.

original: ji ltar gnas par mi bya ba nyid nyams pa'i phyir cho ga 'khrugs shing sdom pa nyams pa de bzhin du bdag kyang khas len pa'i phyir de dag gis kyang 'dun pa dang / yongs su dag pa ma blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas par mi bya ba nyid nyams pa'i phyir cho ga 'khrugs shing sdom pa nyams pa de bzhin du bdag kyang khas len pa'i phyir de dag gis kyang 'dun pa dang / yongs su dag pa ma blangs pa yin no //
translated: Just as those who have violated the rules are not fully ordained, so too I accept that I am not fully ordained.

original: blangs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dge 'dun gyi nang du 'ongs te ma brjod na des ji ltar 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: blangs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dge 'dun gyi nang du 'ongs te ma brjod na des ji ltar 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: If one enters the saṅgha and does not declare one’s intention and purity, how does one declare one’s intention and purity?

original: 'di la blangs pa nyid du khyed kyis the tshom med par khong du chud par bya ba'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir rjod par byed pa yin pas dge slong de dge 'dun gyi nang du 'ongs pa nyid kyis thams cad la the tshom med par gyur pas des na
analyzed: 'di la blangs pa nyid du khyed kyis the tshom med par khong du chud par bya ba'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir rjod par byed pa yin pas dge slong de dge 'dun gyi nang du 'ongs pa nyid kyis thams cad la the tshom med par gyur pas des na
translated: Since he is the one who speaks, the monk, by simply entering the Saṅgha, becomes free of doubt for all.

original: nyes pa'i skabs med do //
analyzed: nyes pa'i skabs med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no opportunity for fault.

original: de lta bas na blangs pa nyid du 'du shes pa las byed na ma brjod du zin kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur gyi gzhan du na ltung bar 'gyur ba kho nar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na blangs pa nyid du 'du shes pa las byed na ma brjod du zin kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur gyi gzhan du na ltung bar 'gyur ba kho nar rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, if one acts with the perception that it is to be accepted, then even if it is not stated, there is no downfall. Otherwise, it should be understood that there is a downfall.

original: yongs su dag pa las @318a * //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa las @318a * //
translated: From the purification

original: ji lta ba bzhin du 'dun pa la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du 'dun pa la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood in the same way for aspiration.

original: dge slong yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
translated: A monk who is pure means one who possesses the ethics as taught.

original: lta ba mthun pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i rnam pa drug cu rtsa gnyis ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba mthun pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i rnam pa drug cu rtsa gnyis ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having the same view means not generating the sixty-two views.

original: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: Today is the fifteenth day of the monks' purification ceremony.

original: gso sbyong bco lnga zhes smos pa ni gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: gso sbyong bco lnga zhes smos pa ni gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa'i dpe ste /
translated: The fifteenth day of the purification ceremony is an example of the fourteenth day of the purification ceremony.

original: ji skad du mdo las gso sbyong ni gnyis te /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las gso sbyong ni gnyis te /
translated: As it is said in the sutra, there are two purification ceremonies:

original: bcu bzhi pa dang bco lnga ba'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa dang bco lnga ba'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the fourteenth day and the fifteenth day.

original: byin gyis brlab po zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan du bya ba'i phyir dang / gzhan par bya ba'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab po zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan du bya ba'i phyir dang / gzhan par bya ba'o //
translated: Blessing means to perform at another time and in another place.

original: rim pa zhes bya ba ni go rims te /
analyzed: rim pa zhes bya ba ni go rims te /
translated: Order means sequence.

original: de ni dge 'dun med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dge 'dun med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because there is no Sangha.

original: 'og ma dag la yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'og ma dag la yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in the same way for the following.

original: gcig la gcig brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig gso sbyong sbyin zhing byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: gcig la gcig brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig gso sbyong sbyin zhing byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: One should inform each other means that one should give and bless the purification ceremony to each other.

original: gsol ba byas te gso sbyong bya'o zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlab pa'i gso sbyong yang yod pas de las dgar ba'i phyir te las dang bcas pa'i gso sbyong bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽der ni nad pa'i yongs su dag pa blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun ma tshang ba'i phyir de'i yongs su dag pa blang ba dag ga par mdzad de /
analyzed: gsol ba byas te gso sbyong bya'o zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlab pa'i gso sbyong yang yod pas de las dgar ba'i phyir te las dang bcas pa'i gso sbyong bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // der ni nad pa'i yongs su dag pa blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun ma tshang ba'i phyir de'i yongs su dag pa blang ba dag ga par mdzad de /
translated: The phrase having made a request, one should perform the poṣadha is stated in order to exclude the poṣadha that is a consecration, because the poṣadha that is a consecration is not a poṣadha that is a rite.

original: dge 'dun tshang na ni nad pa'i yongs su dag pa blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun tshang na ni nad pa'i yongs su dag pa blang bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase there, one should not accept the purity of the sick is stated because the Saṅgha is incomplete. The purity of the sick should be accepted if the Saṅgha is complete.🔽The summary verse states:🔽The king seizes a monk,

original: sdom la / rgyal pos dge slong bzung ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar spyi sdom la rgyal po'i zhes smos pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: sdom la / rgyal pos dge slong bzung ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar spyi sdom la rgyal po'i zhes smos pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa yin par sbyar ro //
translated: and so on. The summary verse that begins with the words the king was stated previously in the general summary.

original: gsod pa zhes bya ba ni gshed ma'o //
analyzed: gsod pa zhes bya ba ni gshed ma'o //
translated: The phrase those who kill refers to executioners.

original: phyir rgol ba zhes bya ba ni longs spyod dbrog pa'i phyir brtson pa'o //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba zhes bya ba ni longs spyod dbrog pa'i phyir brtson pa'o //
translated: The phrase those who are hostile refers to those who are intent on stealing property.

original: dgra bo zhes bya ba ni 'khon gyi sha gon pa'i phyir brtson pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bo zhes bya ba ni 'khon gyi sha gon pa'i phyir brtson pa'o //
translated: The term enemy is used because he is hostile.

original: dkyil 'khor bar dong ste zhes bya ba ni dge slong bzung ba de mtshams kyi nang na 'dug na mi mthun pa spang ba'i phyir de skad gsungs pa yin gyi de mtshams kyi nang na mi 'dug na dkyil 'khor bar 'dod mi dgos so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bar dong ste zhes bya ba ni dge slong bzung ba de mtshams kyi nang na 'dug na mi mthun pa spang ba'i phyir de skad gsungs pa yin gyi de mtshams kyi nang na mi 'dug na dkyil 'khor bar 'dod mi dgos so //
translated: The phrase he should go to the middle of the boundary means that if the monk who is to be suspended is within the boundary, then this is said in order to avoid a disagreement. But if he is not within the boundary, then it is not necessary to go to the middle of the boundary.

original: de'i 'dun pa blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i 'dun pa blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: He should accept his consent.

original: gal te 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa gnyis la bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa gnyis la bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: If consent and purification are the same, what is the difference between them?

original: 'dun pa dbul ba la ni las mthun pa bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dun pa dbul ba la ni las mthun pa bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Consent is offered in order to accomplish the purpose of the assembly.

original: yongs su dag pa dbul ba ni bdag nyid kyis gso sbyong nyams su myong bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa dbul ba ni bdag nyid kyis gso sbyong nyams su myong bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Purification is offered in order to experience the poṣadha oneself.

original: de'i phyir dge slong des @318b bdag nyid yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su dag par dbul bar bya zhing dge 'dun gyis las mthun par bya ba'i phyir de'i 'dun pa yang blang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong des @318b bdag nyid yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su dag par dbul bar bya zhing dge 'dun gyis las mthun par bya ba'i phyir de'i 'dun pa yang blang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in order to purify oneself, the monk should offer his purification and in order to harmonize the Saṅgha’s actions, he should also offer his consent.

original: de lta bas na gso sbyong dang dgag dbye gnyis la ni dge slong gis 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa gnyis ka blang bar bya ba la mtshams bcad pa ma gtogs pa'i las gzhan la ni 'dun pa 'ba' zhig blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na gso sbyong dang dgag dbye gnyis la ni dge slong gis 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa gnyis ka blang bar bya ba la mtshams bcad pa ma gtogs pa'i las gzhan la ni 'dun pa 'ba' zhig blang bar bya ste /
translated: Thus, both purification and consent should be offered in the two rites of poṣadha and pravāraṇa. But in other rites, except for the rite of establishing a boundary, only consent should be offered.

original: nye ba 'khor mtshams bcad pa ma gtogs pa'i las gzhan thams cad ni 'dun pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽sgren mo zhes bya ba ni mdoms ma g-yogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor mtshams bcad pa ma gtogs pa'i las gzhan thams cad ni 'dun pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro // sgren mo zhes bya ba ni mdoms ma g-yogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Upāli, all other rites except for the rite of establishing a boundary are performed with consent.🔽Naked means not covering the genitals.

original: smyos zhes bya ba ni smyos byed kyi tha snyad nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smyos zhes bya ba ni smyos byed kyi tha snyad nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Insane means impaired by insanity.

original: sems 'khrugs zhes bya ba ni rlung la sogs pas rang bzhin gyis sems nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems 'khrugs zhes bya ba ni rlung la sogs pas rang bzhin gyis sems nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Mental disturbance” means the natural deterioration of the mind due to wind, etc.

original: res 'ga' zhes bya ba ni dus lan 'ga'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' zhes bya ba ni dus lan 'ga'o //
translated: “Sometimes” means at some time.

original: ltung ba zhes bya ba ni nyes byas la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba zhes bya ba ni nyes byas la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Downfall” means a minor offense, etc.

original: chos bzhin du phyir bya zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa bsgrub pa'i phyir te ltung ba dang bcas pa las nyams su myong ba bkag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos bzhin du phyir bya zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa bsgrub pa'i phyir te ltung ba dang bcas pa las nyams su myong ba bkag pa'i phyir te /
translated: “One should restore it according to the Dharma” means in order to achieve purity, because one is prohibited from experiencing a downfall.

original: 'og nas kyang thams cad yongs su dag pa lta ba mthun pa 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa dag gis gso sbyong bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'og nas kyang thams cad yongs su dag pa lta ba mthun pa 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa dag gis gso sbyong bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: And below it says, “The Poṣadha purification should be performed by those who are pure, who agree, who are seated together, and who have reached consensus.”

original: dag ba'i mtha' tshun chad nas bzung ste zhes bya ba ni ltung ba med pa'i gnas skabs kyi mtha' tshun chad nas so //🔽mthol lo zhes bya ba ni ming brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dag ba'i mtha' tshun chad nas bzung ste zhes bya ba ni ltung ba med pa'i gnas skabs kyi mtha' tshun chad nas so // mthol lo zhes bya ba ni ming brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: “Up to the end of the purification” means up to the end of the period of being free from downfalls.🔽“Confess” means to declare one’s name.

original: 'chags so zhes bya ba ni rigs brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chags so zhes bya ba ni rigs brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: “Make amends” means to declare one’s family.

original: mi 'chab bo zhes bya ba ni tshig tu brjod pa tsam 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi bdag yid kyis kyang mi 'chab ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'chab bo zhes bya ba ni tshig tu brjod pa tsam 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi bdag yid kyis kyang mi 'chab ba'o //
translated: Not concealing means not only not concealing by mere words, but also not concealing in one's mind.

original: bde ba la reg pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa thob pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba la reg pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa thob pa ste /
translated: Touching bliss means attaining purity.

original: ltung ba dang bral ba'i rgyus yid yongs su dga' ba'o //
analyzed: ltung ba dang bral ba'i rgyus yid yongs su dga' ba'o //
translated: It is the complete delight of the mind due to the cause of being free from downfalls.

original: phyin chad ces bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: phyin chad ces bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na'o //
translated: In the future means in the future.

original: sdom zhes bya ba ni mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: sdom zhes bya ba ni mi byed pa'o //
translated: To restrain means not to do.

original: bar bcad ba zhes bya ba ni 'dir mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: bar bcad ba zhes bya ba ni 'dir mi bya ba'o //
translated: To interrupt means not to do here.

original: dogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis byas pa'i the tshom mo //
analyzed: dogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis byas pa'i the tshom mo //
translated: Doubt means doubt created by others.

original: yid gnyis zhes bya ba ni rang gis byas pa'i the tshom mo //
analyzed: yid gnyis zhes bya ba ni rang gis byas pa'i the tshom mo //
translated: Uncertainty means doubt created by oneself.

original: bsal nas zhes bya ba ni yongs su spangs nas so //
analyzed: bsal nas zhes bya ba ni yongs su spangs nas so //
translated: Having dispelled means having completely abandoned.

original: rang gi sems kyis byin gyis brlab par bya zhes bya ba ni las byed pas so //
analyzed: rang gi sems kyis byin gyis brlab par bya zhes bya ba ni las byed pas so //
translated: One should bless one's own mind means the one who is performing the action.

original: dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas nas dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas tshul khrims dang lta ba dang ldan par 'gro bar bya ba ni 'gres gcig go //

translated: From a place with monks to a place with monks, one should go with morality and views. This is one permutation.

original: dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas nas dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas 'thab krol la sogs pa dang ldan par 'gro bar mi bya ba ni 'gres gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas nas dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas 'thab krol la sogs pa dang ldan par 'gro bar mi bya ba ni 'gres gnyis pa'o //
translated: From a place with monks to a place with monks, one should not go with quarreling and so on. This is the second permutation.

original: dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas nas dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas dang / dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas ma yin pa tshul khrims dang lta ba dang ldan par 'gro bar bya ba ni gsum pa'o //🔽dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas nas dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas dang / dge slong dang bcas pa gnas ma yin pa 'thab krol byed pa la sogs @324a * //
analyzed: dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas nas dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas dang / dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas ma yin pa tshul khrims dang lta ba dang ldan par 'gro bar bya ba ni gsum pa'o // dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas nas dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas dang / dge slong dang bcas pa gnas ma yin pa 'thab krol byed pa la sogs @324a * //
translated: From a place with monks to a place with monks, and from a place with monks to a place without monks, one should go with morality and views. This is the third permutation.

original: par ldan par 'gro bar mi bya ba ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: par ldan par 'gro bar mi bya ba ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: From a place with monks to a place with monks, and from a place with monks to a place without monks, one should not go with quarreling and so on. This is the fourth permutation.

original: dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas dang dge slong dang bcas pa gnas ma yin pa nas dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas dang / dge slong dang bcas pa gnas ma yin pa tshul khrims dang lta ba dang ldan par 'gro bar bya ba ni lnga pa'o //🔽dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas dang / dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas ma yin pa nas dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas dang / dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas ma yin pa 'thab krol byed pa la sogs pa dang ldan par 'gro bar mi bya ba ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas dang dge slong dang bcas pa gnas ma yin pa nas dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas dang / dge slong dang bcas pa gnas ma yin pa tshul khrims dang lta ba dang ldan par 'gro bar bya ba ni lnga pa'o // dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas dang / dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas ma yin pa nas dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas dang / dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas ma yin pa 'thab krol byed pa la sogs pa dang ldan par 'gro bar mi bya ba ni drug pa'o //
translated: The fifth is to go to a place with monks or to a place without monks, with monks, with monks who are endowed with morality and view.🔽The sixth is not to go to a place with monks or to a place without monks, with monks, with monks who are endowed with quarreling and so on.

original: dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas dang / dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas ma yin pa dang / dge slong dang bcas pa gnas dang gnas ma yin pa nas dge slong med pa'i gnas su shin tu sbyangs pa'i phyir 'gro bar bya ba ni 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas dang / dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas ma yin pa dang / dge slong dang bcas pa gnas dang gnas ma yin pa nas dge slong med pa'i gnas su shin tu sbyangs pa'i phyir 'gro bar bya ba ni 'dun pa'o //
translated: The seventh is to go to a place with monks or to a place without monks, with monks, to a place without monks in order to attain tranquility.

original: dge slong dang bcas pa gnas ma yin pa dang / dge slong dang bcas pa gnas dang gnas ma yin pa nas dge slong med pa'i gnas su gnod ba byung ba la sogs pa ma gtogs par 'gro bar mi bya ba ni brgyad pa'o //🔽dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas dang / dge slong dang bcas pa gnas ma yin pa dang / dge slong dang bcas pa gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang / dge slong med pa'i gnas nas dge slong med pa'i gnas su shin tu sbyangs pa'i phyir 'gro bar bya ba ni dgu pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong dang bcas pa gnas ma yin pa dang / dge slong dang bcas pa gnas dang gnas ma yin pa nas dge slong med pa'i gnas su gnod ba byung ba la sogs pa ma gtogs par 'gro bar mi bya ba ni brgyad pa'o // dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas dang / dge slong dang bcas pa gnas ma yin pa dang / dge slong dang bcas pa gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang / dge slong med pa'i gnas nas dge slong med pa'i gnas su shin tu sbyangs pa'i phyir 'gro bar bya ba ni dgu pa'o //
translated: The eighth is not to go from a place where there are monks to a place where there are not, except in case of danger, etc.🔽The ninth is to go from a place where there are monks to a place where there are not, for the sake of complete relaxation.

original: dge slong dang bcas pa gnas ma yin pa dang / dge slong dang bcas pa gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang / dge slong med pa'i gnas nas dge slong med pa'i gnas su gnod pa byung ba la sogs pa ma gtogs par 'gro bar mi bya ba ni bcu pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong dang bcas pa gnas ma yin pa dang / dge slong dang bcas pa gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang / dge slong med pa'i gnas nas dge slong med pa'i gnas su gnod pa byung ba la sogs pa ma gtogs par 'gro bar mi bya ba ni bcu pa'o //
translated: The tenth is not to go from a place where there are no monks to a place where there are not, except in case of danger, etc.

original: dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas dang dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas ma yin pa dang / dge slong dang bcas pa gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang / dge slong med pa'i gnas dang dge slong med pa gnas ma yin pa nas dge slong med pa gnas dang gnas ma yin par shin tu sbyangs pa'i phyir 'gro bar bya ba ni bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas dang dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas ma yin pa dang / dge slong dang bcas pa gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang / dge slong med pa'i gnas dang dge slong med pa gnas ma yin pa nas dge slong med pa gnas dang gnas ma yin par shin tu sbyangs pa'i phyir 'gro bar bya ba ni bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: The eleventh is that one should go to a place where there are monks, or to a place where there are not, or to a place where there are and are not, in order to be well-trained.

original: dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas dang / dge slong dang bcas pa gnas ma yin pa dang / dge slong dang bcas pa gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang / dge slong med pa'i gnas dang / dge slong med pa gnas ma yin pa nas dge slong med pa gnas dang gnas ma yin par gnod @324b ba byung ba la sogs pa ma gtogs par 'gro bar mi bya ba ni bcu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas dang / dge slong dang bcas pa gnas ma yin pa dang / dge slong dang bcas pa gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang / dge slong med pa'i gnas dang / dge slong med pa gnas ma yin pa nas dge slong med pa gnas dang gnas ma yin par gnod @324b ba byung ba la sogs pa ma gtogs par 'gro bar mi bya ba ni bcu gnyis pa'o /
translated: The twelfth is that one should not go to a place where there are monks, or to a place where there are not, or to a place where there are and are not, except in the case of danger and so on.

original: sbyar ba mang po man chad 'di yan chad kyi 'gres thams cad spyir bsdoms na 'gres nyis brgya bdun cu rtsa gnyis yod do //
analyzed: sbyar ba mang po man chad 'di yan chad kyi 'gres thams cad spyir bsdoms na 'gres nyis brgya bdun cu rtsa gnyis yod do //
translated: The entire series from the many applications up to this point, when added together, has 272 series.

original: yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni bsdam par bya ba kha na ma tho ba dag gis kyang yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni bsdam par bya ba kha na ma tho ba dag gis kyang yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: Purity means being pure even with respect to the downfalls that are to be refrained from.

original: 'dul ba gzhi rgya cher 'grel pa mdo sde 'dzin pa dge legs bshes gnyen gyis nye bar sbyar ba las gso sbyong gi gzhi rgya cher 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'dul ba gzhi rgya cher 'grel pa mdo sde 'dzin pa dge legs bshes gnyen gyis nye bar sbyar ba las gso sbyong gi gzhi rgya cher 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the extensive commentary on the basis of the Poṣadha, composed by the Vinaya master Kalyāṇamitra.

original: // / bam po bcu gsum pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bcu gsum pa /
translated: The summary verse:🔽The lifting of restrictions, the permission,

original: sdom la / dgag dbye rjes su gnang ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dgag dbye'i gzhi'i spyi sde ma las dgag dbye zhes smos pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: sdom la / dgag dbye rjes su gnang ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dgag dbye'i gzhi'i spyi sde ma las dgag dbye zhes smos pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa yin par sbyar ro //
translated: and so on, is the summary verse of the chapter on the lifting of restrictions, which is the general chapter on the basis of the Vinaya.

original: tshul khrims nyams pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa lhag par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa lhag par spyod pa'o //
translated: The phrase impaired morality means engaging in natural misdeeds.

original: lta ba nyams pa zhes bya ba ni bdag tu lta ba la sogs kun tu spyad pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba nyams pa zhes bya ba ni bdag tu lta ba la sogs kun tu spyad pa'o //
translated: The degeneration of view is the practice of the view of self, etc.

original: cho ga nyams pa zhes bya ba ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa lhag par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: cho ga nyams pa zhes bya ba ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa lhag par spyod pa'o //
translated: The degeneration of rite is the practice of what is prohibited, i.e., the transgression of rules.

original: 'tsho ba nyams pa zhes bya ba ni log par 'tsho ba'o //🔽gtsang ma'i bum pa zhes bya ba ni rung ba'i chu dang zang zing gi chu snod do //
analyzed: 'tsho ba nyams pa zhes bya ba ni log par 'tsho ba'o // gtsang ma'i bum pa zhes bya ba ni rung ba'i chu dang zang zing gi chu snod do //
translated: The degeneration of livelihood is wrong livelihood.🔽The pure pot is a vessel for drinking water and for water used in rituals.

original: chab khung sa'i bum pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su spyad pa'i chu snod do //🔽gsog ces bya ba ni chu dgos pa shas shig yod pa'o //
analyzed: chab khung sa'i bum pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su spyad pa'i chu snod do // gsog ces bya ba ni chu dgos pa shas shig yod pa'o //
translated: The pot for the water of the privy is a vessel for water used in cleaning.🔽The pot for water that is stored is a vessel for water that is needed in small quantities.

original: gso ba ces bya ba ni chu mi dgos pa shas shig yod pa'o //
analyzed: gso ba ces bya ba ni chu mi dgos pa shas shig yod pa'o //
translated: The pot for water that is kept is a vessel for water that is not needed in small quantities.

original: chu med pa zhes bya ba ni chu gtan med pa'o //
analyzed: chu med pa zhes bya ba ni chu gtan med pa'o //
translated: The pot for water that is not available is a vessel for water that is not available at all.

original: yang na gsog ces bya ba ni de ni gnas pa'i tshul med pa'o //🔽gsob ces bya ba ni glo bur bsnan pa'i chu med pa'o //
analyzed: yang na gsog ces bya ba ni de ni gnas pa'i tshul med pa'o // gsob ces bya ba ni glo bur bsnan pa'i chu med pa'o //
translated: Or, the pot for water that is stored is a vessel for water that is not available for a while.🔽The pot for water that is kept is a vessel for water that is available for a while.

original: chu med pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka ye med pa'o //
analyzed: chu med pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka ye med pa'o //
translated: The pot for water that is not available is a vessel for water that is not available at all.

original: nus na zhes bya ba ni phyod pa'o //
analyzed: nus na zhes bya ba ni phyod pa'o //
translated: “If able” means “if capable.”

original: lag brdas zhes bya ba ni lag pa'i mtshan ma bstan pas so //
analyzed: lag brdas zhes bya ba ni lag pa'i mtshan ma bstan pas so //
translated: “By gestures” means by showing signs with the hands.

original: gnas ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gang gi gnas gang yin par ro //
analyzed: gnas ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gang gi gnas gang yin par ro //
translated: “In the proper place” means in the place of the one who is to be censured.

original: gcig la gcig mi smra bar zhes bya ba ni tshig dang ldan par mi smra bar ro //
analyzed: gcig la gcig mi smra bar zhes bya ba ni tshig dang ldan par mi smra bar ro //
translated: “Without speaking to one another” means without speaking with words.

original: dgra bo dang 'grogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dgra dang lhan cig 'khod pa bzhin du cang mi smra ba'o //
analyzed: dgra bo dang 'grogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dgra dang lhan cig 'khod pa bzhin du cang mi smra ba'o //
translated: “Like enemies” means like enemies who are living together without speaking.

original: mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyi rtags te mi smra ba yi dam mo //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyi rtags te mi smra ba yi dam mo //
translated: “The banner of the tīrthikas” means the sign of the tīrthikas, which is to remain silent.

original: mi smra ba zhes bya ba ni tshig med par 'dug pa'o /
analyzed: mi smra ba zhes bya ba ni tshig med par 'dug pa'o /
translated: “Silence” means to remain without speaking.

original: mi smra ba'i yi dam bca' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni yi dam bca' ba sngon du btang ste mi smra ba'i brtul zhugs blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi smra ba'i yi dam bca' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni yi dam bca' ba sngon du btang ste mi smra ba'i brtul zhugs blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not take up the vow of silence” means that one should not take up the vow of silence after having made a prior commitment.

original: 'gal tshangs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya @325a * //
analyzed: 'gal tshangs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya @325a * //
translated: “One would be in a state of conflict” means that one would be in a state of conflict with the training.

original: ba ni nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ba ni nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The offense is a minor offense.

original: dag pa dang grol bar lta bas yi dam 'cha' na ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyi skabs su gtogs pa'i nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dag pa dang grol bar lta bas yi dam 'cha' na ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyi skabs su gtogs pa'i nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If one makes a vow with the view that it is pure and liberating, then it is a serious offense belonging to the context of schism in the saṅgha.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dge slong de dag gis dbyar gnas par khas blangs nas dgag dbyem byas par 'dir lhags pas des na dgag dbye bya ba 'di rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dge slong de dag gis dbyar gnas par khas blangs nas dgag dbyem byas par 'dir lhags pas des na dgag dbye bya ba 'di rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: In this way, etc. means that since those monks who have accepted the rainy season retreat have arrived here without doing the lifting of restrictions, therefore this lifting of restrictions is permitted.

original: dogs pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma las byung ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: dogs pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma las byung ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: Doubt means knowledge arising from signs.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
translated: Abiding means cause.

original: zhag bcu'am zla ba phyed kyis dgag dbye 'byung bar 'gyur ba na zhes bya ba ni de tsam gyi mdun nas so //
analyzed: zhag bcu'am zla ba phyed kyis dgag dbye 'byung bar 'gyur ba na zhes bya ba ni de tsam gyi mdun nas so //
translated: When the lifting of restrictions occurs in ten days or a half month, means that much time remains.

original: kha cig las ni zhag bdun nam brgyad na zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kha cig las ni zhag bdun nam brgyad na zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Some say seven or eight days.

original: spyod yul du zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang dang nye ba'i grong du'o //
analyzed: spyod yul du zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang dang nye ba'i grong du'o //
translated: In the sphere of activity means in the vicinity of the monastery.

original: nyi ma 'di tsam na dge 'dun gyi dgag dbye 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni da phyin chad zhag 'di tsam na dge 'dun dgag dbye mdzad par 'gyur ba khyed cag la brjod pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyi ma 'di tsam na dge 'dun gyi dgag dbye 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni da phyin chad zhag 'di tsam na dge 'dun dgag dbye mdzad par 'gyur ba khyed cag la brjod pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: One should say, The Saṅgha's observance day will occur on such-and-such a day. This means that one should say, From now on, the Saṅgha's observance day will occur on such-and-such a day, and that one should inform the others.

original: 'di ni spyod yul na gnas pa'i sems can bsod nams la sbyar ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni spyod yul na gnas pa'i sems can bsod nams la sbyar ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is stated for the purpose of engaging beings who dwell within the range of one's activity in the practice of merit.

original: dge slong gnas par bya ba dag gis zhes bya ba ni gnas la rag las pa dag gis te /
analyzed: dge slong gnas par bya ba dag gis zhes bya ba ni gnas la rag las pa dag gis te /
translated: By the monks who are abiding means by those who are dependent on a dwelling place.

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon la brten pa dag gis zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon la brten pa dag gis zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means by those who are dependent on preceptors and teachers.

original: mchod pa'i dbang du byas pa zhes bya ba ni mchod pa rtsom pa ste /
analyzed: mchod pa'i dbang du byas pa zhes bya ba ni mchod pa rtsom pa ste /
translated: In relation to worship means in relation to the performance of worship.

original: gtsug lag khang brgyan pa dang / khang pa brtsegs pa brtsigs pa dang / mchod rten dag gso ba dang / byi dor bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang brgyan pa dang / khang pa brtsegs pa brtsigs pa dang / mchod rten dag gso ba dang / byi dor bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It means the adorning of temples, the construction of multi-storied buildings, the restoration of stūpas, the cleaning of them, and so on.

original: byug pas byug par bya zhes bya ba ni gur gum la sogs pas bri bar bya ba'am /🔽ral ba dang 'drums pa la sogs pa bcos par bya ba'o //
analyzed: byug pas byug par bya zhes bya ba ni gur gum la sogs pas bri bar bya ba'am / ral ba dang 'drums pa la sogs pa bcos par bya ba'o //
translated: Anointing means anointing with saffron, etc., or repairing cracks, holes, etc.

original: byi dor bya ba zhes bya ba ni ras la sogs pas rdul la sogs pa phyi bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: byi dor bya ba zhes bya ba ni ras la sogs pas rdul la sogs pa phyi bar bya ba'o //
translated: Polishing means polishing with cotton, etc., to remove dust, etc.

original: gtsang khang phyur bu dag ces bya ba ni dri gtsang khang spyi cog ste /
analyzed: gtsang khang phyur bu dag ces bya ba ni dri gtsang khang spyi cog ste /
translated: The pure abode is the temple.

original: bltam pa dang / byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bltam pa dang / byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The great enlightenment is the enlightenment of a Buddha, and the great parinirvāṇa is the parinirvāṇa of a Buddha.

original: brgyan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ri mo bri ba dang / gos la sogs pas brgyan par bya ba'o //
analyzed: brgyan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ri mo bri ba dang / gos la sogs pas brgyan par bya ba'o //
translated: Adorning means adorning with paintings, etc., and with cloth, etc.

original: chag chag gdab par bya ba la sogs pa yang mchod pa'i dbang du byas pa'i las yin no //
analyzed: chag chag gdab par bya ba la sogs pa yang mchod pa'i dbang du byas pa'i las yin no //
translated: Sprinkling, etc., are actions done in the context of worship.

original: mtshan thog thag tu chos mnyan pa sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshes bcu bzhi la seng ge'i khri brgyan pa bshams nas do nub @325b mtshan thog thag chos mnyan pa 'byung bar 'gyur gyi der tshe dang ldan pa dag gis chags pa sbyin par bya'o zhes
analyzed: mtshan thog thag tu chos mnyan pa sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshes bcu bzhi la seng ge'i khri brgyan pa bshams nas do nub @325b mtshan thog thag chos mnyan pa 'byung bar 'gyur gyi der tshe dang ldan pa dag gis chags pa sbyin par bya'o zhes
translated: I will give the gift of listening to the Dharma all night.

original: spyod yul du brjod nas /
analyzed: spyod yul du brjod nas /
translated: This is said to be the domain of the monks.

original: mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang / ma mo 'dzin pa gsol ba gdab pa dag gis tshes bcu bzhi'i mtshan thog thag tu kha ton du 'don par chos mnyan pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang / ma mo 'dzin pa gsol ba gdab pa dag gis tshes bcu bzhi'i mtshan thog thag tu kha ton du 'don par chos mnyan pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Having requested those who uphold the sutras, vinaya and mātṛkā, they should give the gift of listening to the Dharma by reciting the sutras and vinaya all night on the fourteenth day of the month.

original: gal te skya rengs ma shar bar dgag dbye mi nus par shes na shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te skya rengs ma shar bar dgag dbye mi nus par shes na shes par bya ste /
translated: If it is known that the lifting of restrictions cannot be done before dawn, it should be known.

original: ci bder bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshes bco lnga'i nub mo mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang ma mo 'dzin pa de dag gis dgag dbye'i las la ma bab pa'i mdun rol tshun chad du chos dang ldan pa'i gtam rnam par gtan la dbab par mtshan 'da' bar bya zhing dus ji tsam nas dgag dbye'i las brtsams pa'i las kyi mjug dang
analyzed: ci bder bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshes bco lnga'i nub mo mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang ma mo 'dzin pa de dag gis dgag dbye'i las la ma bab pa'i mdun rol tshun chad du chos dang ldan pa'i gtam rnam par gtan la dbab par mtshan 'da' bar bya zhing dus ji tsam nas dgag dbye'i las brtsams pa'i las kyi mjug dang
translated: The phrase as is convenient means that on the evening of the fifteenth day, those who uphold the sutras, the vinaya, and the mātṛkā should engage in a Dharma discussion that determines the nature of reality prior to the ceremony for the conclusion of the rains retreat.

original: skya rengs dang por mi phrad par de tsam du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: skya rengs dang por mi phrad par de tsam du shes par bya ste /
translated: They should know that the ceremony for the conclusion of the rains retreat should be performed for as long as it does not conflict with the first appearance of dawn.

original: chos dang ldan pa'i gtam rnam par gtan la dbab pa ci bder bya zhing dgag dbye'i las kyi mog brtsam par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i gtam rnam par gtan la dbab pa ci bder bya zhing dgag dbye'i las kyi mog brtsam par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase as is convenient means that they should engage in a Dharma discussion that determines the nature of reality and then perform the ceremony for the conclusion of the rains retreat.

original: 'di skad du bstan te dgag dbye'i las ni skya rengs dang por shar ba'i mdun du zin par bya dgos pas gal te skya rengs ma shar bar dgag dbye'i las zin par mi nus par shes nas ji tsam gyis nus par shes pa tsam nas chos bshad pa
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan te dgag dbye'i las ni skya rengs dang por shar ba'i mdun du zin par bya dgos pas gal te skya rengs ma shar bar dgag dbye'i las zin par mi nus par shes nas ji tsam gyis nus par shes pa tsam nas chos bshad pa
translated: This is taught: “The procedure of the invitation should be completed before the first part of the night is over. If it is known that the procedure of the invitation cannot be completed before the first part of the night is over, then the Dharma talk

original: gzhag cing las brtsam par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhag cing las brtsam par bya ba'o //
translated: should be put aside and the procedure should be begun as soon as it is known that it can be completed.

original: dge slong dgag dbye byed pa gcig gam gnyis sam rab tu mang po dag bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te gcig gis nus na gcig bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dgag dbye byed pa gcig gam gnyis sam rab tu mang po dag bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te gcig gis nus na gcig bsko bar bya'o //
translated: “One, two, or many invitation procedures should be appointed.” If one can do it, one should be appointed.

original: gcig gis mi nus na gnyis bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: gcig gis mi nus na gnyis bsko bar bya'o //
translated: If one cannot do it, two should be appointed.

original: gnyis kyis mi nus na gsum bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyis mi nus na gsum bsko bar bya'o //
translated: If two cannot do it, three should be appointed.

original: bzhi yan chad ni bsko bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: bzhi yan chad ni bsko bar mi bya ste /
translated: Four or more should not be appointed,

original: tshogs kyis tshogs kyi las byar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs kyis tshogs kyi las byar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because a group cannot perform the duties of a group.

original: rtsva ku sha nye bar gzhag par bya zhing de'i 'og tu dgram par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong dgag dbye byed pa des snga nas rtsva ku sha sta gon bya zhing de'i 'og tu dge 'dun thams cad la khyed par brim par bya'o //
analyzed: rtsva ku sha nye bar gzhag par bya zhing de'i 'og tu dgram par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong dgag dbye byed pa des snga nas rtsva ku sha sta gon bya zhing de'i 'og tu dge 'dun thams cad la khyed par brim par bya'o //
translated: This means that the monk who is performing the invitation ceremony should prepare the kuśa grass beforehand and then spread it out for the entire saṅgha.

original: de ni dgag dbye go bar byed pa'i dus na dgag dbye bya ba dang / dgag dbye byed pa gnyis ka'i lag pas phan tshun nas gzung bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni dgag dbye go bar byed pa'i dus na dgag dbye bya ba dang / dgag dbye byed pa gnyis ka'i lag pas phan tshun nas gzung bar bya ba yin te /
translated: When the time comes to announce the invitation ceremony, both the one who is performing the invitation ceremony and the one who is being invited should hold each other’s hands.

original: de'ang ji ltar rtsva ku sha 'di dag 'dud par byed pa de bzhin du bdag kyang ltung ba chos bzhin du phyir bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'ang ji ltar rtsva ku sha 'di dag 'dud par byed pa de bzhin du bdag kyang ltung ba chos bzhin du phyir bya ba'i phyir /
translated: “Just as these kuśa blades bend, so too do I bend to the monks in order to confess my downfall in accordance with the Dharma.”

original: dge slong rnams la 'dud par byed do zhes bya ba ni don 'di bstan pa'i phyir bya'o zhes 'dul ba 'dzin pa dag gi man ngang las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong rnams la 'dud par byed do zhes bya ba ni don 'di bstan pa'i phyir bya'o zhes 'dul ba 'dzin pa dag gi man ngang las shes par bya'o //
translated: This is how it should be explained. This is to be understood from the instructions of the upholders of the vinaya.

original: gdams su gsol zhes bya ba ni bya bar 'os pa nyid du rjod cig pa'o //
analyzed: gdams su gsol zhes bya ba ni bya bar 'os pa nyid du rjod cig pa'o //
translated: “Please instruct me” means “Please tell me what I should do.”

original: rjes su @326a * //
analyzed: rjes su @326a * //
translated: Later,

original: bstan pa gsol zhes bya ba ni bya bar mi 'os pa mi bya ba nyid du rjod cig pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa gsol zhes bya ba ni bya bar mi 'os pa mi bya ba nyid du rjod cig pa'o //
translated: say, I will restore the training.

original: shes shing zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rkyen gyis shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes shing zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rkyen gyis shes pa'o //
translated: If you know, means if you know through the condition of another.

original: mthong na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis bdag ste'o //
analyzed: mthong na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis bdag ste'o //
translated: If you see, means if you see through your own self.

original: chos bzhin zhes bya ba ni ltung ba'i ngo bo nyid las mi 'da' bar ro //
analyzed: chos bzhin zhes bya ba ni ltung ba'i ngo bo nyid las mi 'da' bar ro //
translated: In accordance with the Dharma, means not transgressing the nature of the downfall.

original: 'dul ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba bzhin phyir bcos pa las mi 'da' bar ro //
analyzed: 'dul ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba bzhin phyir bcos pa las mi 'da' bar ro //
translated: In accordance with the Vinaya, means not transgressing the amendment in accordance with the Vinaya.

original: slar bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni phyir bcos par bya'o //
analyzed: slar bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni phyir bcos par bya'o //
translated: I will do it again, means I will amend it.

original: de tsam gyis nad pa ngal pa dang // gnas mal phan phun du 'gyur ba dang / dus las yol ba dang / gnod pa 'byung na lan gnyis bzlas so zhes bya ba ni lan gsum bzlas pa de tsam gyis nad pa la ngal ba 'byung ba'am /🔽gnas mal phan phan du gyur pa byung ngam /
analyzed: de tsam gyis nad pa ngal pa dang // gnas mal phan phun du 'gyur ba dang / dus las yol ba dang / gnod pa 'byung na lan gnyis bzlas so zhes bya ba ni lan gsum bzlas pa de tsam gyis nad pa la ngal ba 'byung ba'am / gnas mal phan phan du gyur pa byung ngam /

If the sick person is tired by just that much, or if the bedding and seat are lost, or if the time has passed, or if harm will arise, then it is said, Repeat it twice.

original: dus las yol ba byung ngam /
analyzed: dus las yol ba byung ngam /
translated: If the sick person is tired by just that much, or if the bedding and seat are lost, or if the time has passed, or if harm will arise, then it is said, Repeat it twice.🔽 If the sick person is tired by just that much, or if the bedding and seat are lost, or if the time has passed, or if harm will arise, then it is said, Repeat it twice.

original: gnod pa 'byung ba lta na dgag dbye go bar bya ba'i sngags lan gnyis bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnod pa 'byung ba lta na dgag dbye go bar bya ba'i sngags lan gnyis bzla bar bya'o //
translated: If there is a danger, he should recite the mantra for the announcement of the end of the rains retreat twice.

original: de'i 'og tu dge slong las byed pas dgag dbye byas te zhes bya ba ni des dge slong gi gral gyi dgag dbye rdzogs nas rang gi dgag dbye bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dge slong las byed pas dgag dbye byas te zhes bya ba ni des dge slong gi gral gyi dgag dbye rdzogs nas rang gi dgag dbye bya ba'o //
translated: After that, the monk who is the ritual master should announce the end of the rains retreat.

original: legs par zhes bya ba ni mdzes shing kha na ma tho ba med par ro//
analyzed: legs par zhes bya ba ni mdzes shing kha na ma tho ba med par ro//
translated: “Properly” means beautifully and without fault.

original: shin tu zhes bya ba ni 'di la the tshom med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu zhes bya ba ni 'di la the tshom med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Thoroughly” means “there is no doubt about this.”

analyzed: yang na legs par byas zhes bya ba ni rigs par ro /

original: shin tu zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i rgyur ro /
analyzed: shin tu zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i rgyur ro /
translated: “Thoroughly” means “for the sake of happiness.”

original: rdzas zhes bya ba ni khab la sogs pa'i rdzas so //
analyzed: rdzas zhes bya ba ni khab la sogs pa'i rdzas so //
translated: “Materials” refers to needles and so on.

original: 'di lta bu byas kyang zhes bya ba ni chung ngus kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'di lta bu byas kyang zhes bya ba ni chung ngus kyang ngo //
translated: “Even if they are made like this” means “even if they are small.”

original: dgag dbye bgyir rung ngo zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'i phyir mgron du gnyer du rung ba'o //
analyzed: dgag dbye bgyir rung ngo zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'i phyir mgron du gnyer du rung ba'o //
translated: “The end of the rains retreat is suitable” means “it is suitable to invite them for the sake of worship.”

original: 'di ni sbyin dang byed pa rnams kyi bsod nams kyi 'du ba'i sgo'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir bcas te 'di ltar dgag dbye byas pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun ni dge legs kyi bsam pa can yin pa'i phyir shin tu yongs su dag pa dang byams pa'i
analyzed: 'di ni sbyin dang byed pa rnams kyi bsod nams kyi 'du ba'i sgo'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir bcas te 'di ltar dgag dbye byas pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun ni dge legs kyi bsam pa can yin pa'i phyir shin tu yongs su dag pa dang byams pa'i
translated: Thus, the Saṅgha of fully ordained monks who have done the rainy season retreat are extremely pure because they have the intention to do what is virtuous and they become extremely clear because they have loving minds.🔽Therefore, when one gives gifts to them, the result is much greater because they are a very special field of merit.

original: sems dang ldan pa'i phyir shin tu dang bar 'gyur ba yin pas de'i phyir bsod nams kyi zhing ches khyad par 'phags pa yin pas de la sbyin pa byin na 'bras bu ches mang por 'gyur ro //

translated: After that, the novitiates should do the rainy season retreat.

original: de'i 'og tu dge tshul rnams la dgag dbye bya'o zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyi dgag dbye byas pa'i 'og tu dgag dbye byed pa des dge tshul rnams la dgag dbye ba'o ;
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dge tshul rnams la dgag dbye bya'o zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyi dgag dbye byas pa'i 'og tu dgag dbye byed pa des dge tshul rnams la dgag dbye ba'o ;
translated: This means that after the rainy season retreat is done with the material things, the one who does the rainy season retreat should do the rainy season retreat for the novitiates.

translated: After that, the nuns should do the invitation ceremony means that after the novices have done the invitation ceremony, that [ceremony] should be done for the nuns.
